data.data: <verse>Great is Thy faithfulness, O God my Father;There is no shadow of turning with Thee;Thou changest not, Thy compassions, they fail not;As Thou hast been, Thou forever will be.</verse><chorus>Great is Thy faithfulness!Great is Thy faithfulness!Morning by morning new mercies I see.All I have needed Thy hand hath provided;Great is Thy faithfulness, Lord, unto me!</chorus><verse>Summer and winter and springtime and harvest,Sun, moon and stars in their courses aboveJoin with all nature in manifold witnessTo Thy great faithfulness, mercy and love.</verse><verse>Pardon for sin and a peace that endurethThine own dear presence to cheer and to guide;Strength for today and bright hope for tomorrow,Blessings all mine, with ten thousand beside!</verse>

data.title: Children of the Heavenly Father
data.preview: <verse>Children of the heavenly FatherSafely in His bosom ga
data.data: <verse>Children of the heavenly FatherSafely in His bosom gather;Nestling bird nor star in heavenSuch a refuge e'er was given.</verse><verse>God His own doth tend and nourish,In His holy love they flourish;From all evil things He spares them,In His mighty arms He bears them.</verse><verse>Neither life nor death shall everFrom the Lord His children sever;Unto them His grace He showeth,And their sorrows all He knoweth.</verse><verse>Praise the Lord in joyful numbers,Your Protector never slumbers;At the will of your DefenderEvery foe-man must surrender.</verse><verse>Though He giveth or He taketh,God His children ne'er forsaketh;His the loving purpose solelyTo preserve them pure and holy.</verse>

data.title: Unto the Hills
data.preview: <verse>Unto the hills around shall I lift up my longing eyes
data.data: <verse>Unto the hills around shall I lift up my longing eyes?O whence for me shall my salvation come,From whence arise?From God the Lord doth come my certain aid,From God the Lord, who heav'n and earth hath made.</verse><verse>He will not suffer that thy foot be moved;Safe shalt thou beNo careless slumber shall His eyelids close,Who keepeth thee.Behold our God, the Lord, He slumbereth ne'er,Who keepeth Israel in His holy care.</verse><verse>Jehovah is Himself thy keeper true, thy changeless shade.Jehovah thy defense on thy right hand Himself hath madeAnd thee no sun by day shall ever smite,No moon shall harm thee in the silent night.</verse><verse>From every evil shall He keep thy soul, from every sin;Jehovah shall preserve thy going out, thy coming in.Above thee watching, He, whom adore,Shall keep thee henceforth, yea, forevermore.</verse>

data.title: O God, Our Help
data.preview: <verse>O God, our help in ages past,Our hope for years to co
data.data: <verse>O God, our help in ages past,Our hope for years to come,Our shelter from the stormy blast,And our eternal home!</verse><verse>Under the shadow of Thy throne,Still may we dwell secure;Sufficient is thine arm alone,And our defense is sure.</verse><verse>Before the hills in order stood,Or earth received her frame,From everlasting, Thou art God,To endless years the same.</verse><verse>A thousand ages, in Thy sight,Are like an evening gone;Short as the watch that ends the night,Before the rising sun.</verse><verse>O God, our help in ages past,Our hope for years to come;Be Thou our guide while life shall last,And our eternal home!</verse>

data.title: My Shepherd Will Supply My Need
data.preview: <verse>My Shepherd will supply my need,Jehovah is His name.I
data.data: <verse>My Shepherd will supply my need,Jehovah is His name.In pastures fresh He makes me feedBeside the living stream.He brings my wand'ring spirit backWhen I forsake His ways,And leads me, for His mercy's sake,In paths of truth and grace.</verse><verse>When I walk through the shades of death,Thy presence is my stay;A word of Thy supporting breathDrives all my fears away.Thy hand in sight of all my foesDoth still my table spread;My cup with blessings over flows,Thine oil anoints my head.</verse><verse>The sure provisions of my GodAttend me all my days;O may Thy house be mine abodeAnd all my work be praise.There would I find a settled restWhile others go and come;No more a stranger or a guest,But like a child at home.</verse>

data.title: Sing to the Great Jehovah's Praise
data.preview: <verse>Sing to the great Jehovah's praise!All praise to Him
data.data: <verse>Sing to the great Jehovah's praise!All praise to Him belongs;Who kindly lengthens out our days,Inspires our choicest songs,Inspires our choicest songs.</verse><verse>His providence hath brought us throughAnother various year;We all, with vows and anthems new,Before our God appear,Before our God appear.</verse><verse>O God, Thy mercies past we own,And Thy continued care;To Thee presenting through Thy SonWhat e'er we have and are,What e'er we have and are.</verse>

data.title: Give to Our god Immortal Praise
data.preview: <verse>Give to our God immortal praise;Mercy and truth are a
data.data: <verse>Give to our God immortal praise;Mercy and truth are all His ways:Wonders of grace to God belong,Repeat His mercies in your song.</verse><verse>Give to the Lord of lords renown,The King of kings with glory crown:His mercies ever shall endureWhen lords and kings are known no more.</verse><verse>He sent His Son with power to saveFrom guilt and darkness and the grave:Wonders of grace to God belong,Repeat His mercies in your song.</verse><verse>Thro' this vain world He guides our feet,And leads us to His heav'nly seat;His mercies ever shall endure,When this vain world shall be no more.</verse>

data.title: God Moves in a Mysterious Way
data.preview: <verse>God moves in a mysterious wayHis wonders to perform;H
data.data: <verse>God moves in a mysterious wayHis wonders to perform;He plants His footsteps in the sea,And rides upon the storm.</verse><verse>Ye fearful saints, fresh courage take;The clouds ye so much dreadAre big with mercy, and shall breakIn blessings on your head.</verse><verse>Judge not the Lord by feeble sense,But trust Him for His grace;Behind a frowning providenceHe hides a smiling face.</verse><verse>His purposes will ripen fast,Unfolding every hour;The bud may have a bitter taste,But sweet will be the flower.</verse><verse>Blind unbelief is sure to err,And scan His work in vain;God is His own interpreter,And He will make it plain.</verse>

data.title: Amazing Grace
data.preview: <verse>Amazing grace! How sweet the soundThat saved a wretch
data.data: <verse>Amazing grace! How sweet the soundThat saved a wretch like me!I once was lost, but now am found;Was blind, but now I see.</verse><verse>'Twas grace that taught my heart to fear,And grace my fears relieved;How precious did that grace appearThe hour I first believed.</verse><verse>The Lord has promised good to me,His word my hope secures;He will my shield and portion be,As long as life endures.</verse><verse>Through many dangers, toils, and snares,I have already come;'Tis grace hath brought me safe thus far,And grace will lead me home.</verse><verse>When we've been there ten thousand years,Bright shining as the sun,We've no less days to sing God's praiseThan when we first begun.</verse>

data.title: Marvelous Grace
data.preview: <verse>Marvelous grace of our loving Lord.Grace that exceeds
data.data: <verse>Marvelous grace of our loving Lord.Grace that exceeds our sin and our guilt!Yonder on Calvary's mount outpouredThere where the blood of the Lamb was spilt.</verse><chorus>Grace, grace, God's grace,Grace that will pardon and cleanse withinGrace, grace, God's grace,Grace that is greater than all our sin!</chorus><verse>Sin and despair, like the sea waves cold,Threaten the soul with infinite loss;Grace that is greater, yes, grace untoldPoints to the Refuge, the mighty Cross.</verse><verse>Marvelous, infinite, matchless grace,Freely bestowed on all who believe!You that are longing to see His face,Will you this moment His grace receive?</verse>

data.title: God's Free Mercy Streameth
data.preview: <verse>God's free mercy streameth over all the world,And His
data.data: <verse>God's free mercy streameth over all the world,And His banner gleameth, By His church unfurled;Broad and deep and glorious, As the heaven above,Shines in might victorious His eternal love.</verse><verse>Summer suns are glowing over land and sea;Happy light is flowing, Bountiful and free;Everything rejoices in the mellow rays;Earth's ten thousand voices swell the psalm of praise.</verse><verse>Lord, upon our blindness Thy pure radiance pour;For Thy loving kindness we would love Thee more;And when clouds are drifting dark across the sky,Then, the veil uplifting, Father, be Thou nigh.</verse><verse>We will never doubt Thee, tho' veil Thy light;Life is dark without Thee, death with Thee is bright.Light of light, shine o'er us on our pilgrim way,Go Thou still before us to the endless day.</verse>

data.title: It Took a Miracle
data.preview: <verse>My Father is omnipotentAnd that you can't deny;A God
data.data: <verse>My Father is omnipotentAnd that you can't deny;A God of might and miracles;'Tis written in the sky.</verse><chorus>It took a miracle to put the stars in place;It took a miracle to hang the world in space.But when He saved my soul,Cleansed and made me whole,It took a miracle of love and grace!</chorus><verse>Though here His glory has been shown,We still can't fully seeThe wonders of His might, His throne;'Twill take eternity.</verse><verse>The Bible tells us of His powerAnd wisdom all way through;And every little bird and flowerAre testimonies, too.</verse>

data.title: Let Us With a Gladsome Mind
data.preview: <verse>Let us with a gladsome mindPraise the Lord, for He is
data.data: <verse>Let us with a gladsome mindPraise the Lord, for He is kind:For His mercies shall endure,Ever faithful, ever sure.</verse><verse>He, with all commanding might,Filled the new made world with light:For His mercies shall endure,Ever faithful, ever sure.</verse><verse>All things living He does feed;His full hand supplies their need:For His mercies shall endure,Ever faithful, ever sure.</verse><verse>Let us then with gladsome mindPraise the Lord, for He is kind:For His mercies shall endure,Ever faithful, ever sure.</verse>

data.title: As Pants the Hart
data.preview: <verse>As pants the hart for cooling streamsWhen heated in t
data.data: <verse>As pants the hart for cooling streamsWhen heated in the chase,So longs my soul, O God, for Thee,And Thy refreshing grace.</verse><verse>For Thee, my God, the living God,My thirsty soul doth pine:O when shall I behold Thy face,Thou Majesty divine?</verse><verse>Why restless, why cast down, my soul?Hope still, and thou shalt singThe praise of Him who is thy God,Thy health's eternal spring.</verse><verse>To Father, Son, and Holy Ghost,The God whom we adore,Be glory, as it was, is now,And shall be evermore.</verse>

data.title: There's a Wideness
data.preview: <verse>There's a wideness, in God's mercy,Like the wideness
data.data: <verse>There's a wideness, in God's mercy,Like the wideness of the sea;There is mercy, with the Savior,Which is more than liberty.</verse><verse>There is welcome, for the sinner,And more graces for the good;There is mercy, with the Savior,There is healing in His blood.</verse><verse>For the love of God is broaderThan the measure of man's mind.And the heart of the Eternal,Is most wonderfully kind.</verse><verse>If our love were but more simple,We should take Him at His word;And our lives would be all sunshine,In the sweetness of our Lord.</verse>

data.title: O Come, O Come, Immanuel
data.preview: <verse>O come, O come, Immanuel,And ransom captive Israel,Th
data.data: <verse>O come, O come, Immanuel,And ransom captive Israel,That mourns in lonely exile hereUntil the Son of God appear.</verse><chorus>Rejoice! Rejoice!Immanuel shall come to thee,O Israel.</chorus><verse>O come, Thou Wisdom from on high,And order all things far and nigh;To us the path of knowledge show,And cause us in her ways to go.</verse><verse>O come, Desire of nations, bindAll peoples in one heart and mind;Bid envy, strife, and quarrels cease;Fill the whole world with heaven's peace.</verse>

data.title: Of the Father's Love Begotten
data.preview: <verse>Of the Father's love begotten,Ere the worlds began to
data.data: <verse>Of the Father's love begotten,Ere the worlds began to be,He is Alpha and Omega,He the source, the ending He,Of the things that are, that have been,And that future years shall see,Evermore and evermore! Amen.</verse><verse>O ye heights of heaven adore Him;Angel hosts, His praises sing;Powers, dominions, bow before Him,And extol our God and King;Let no tongue on earth be silent,Every voice in concert ring,Evermore and evermore! Amen.</verse><verse>Christ, to Thee with God the FatherAnd, O Holy Ghost, to Thee,Hymn and chant and high thanksgivingAnd unwearied praises be.Honor, glory, and dominion,And eternal victory,Evermore and evermore! Amen.</verse>

data.title: The Advent of Our God
data.preview: <verse>The advent of our GodWith eager prayers we greet,And
data.data: <verse>The advent of our GodWith eager prayers we greet,And singing haste upon His roadHis coming reign to meet.</verse><verse>The everlasting SonWas born to make us free;And He a servant's form put onTo gain our liberty.</verse><verse>As Judge, on clouds of light,He soon will come again,His scattered people to uniteWith them in heaven to reign.</verse><verse>Praise to the incarnate SonWho comes to set us free,With Father, Spirit, ever one,To all eternity.</verse>

data.title: The First Noel
data.preview: <verse>The first noel the angel did sayWas to certain poor s
data.data: <verse>The first noel the angel did sayWas to certain poor shepherds in fields where they lay;In fields where they lay keeping their sheep,On a cold winter's night that was so deep.</verse><chorus>Noel, Noel, Noel, Noel, Born is the King of Israel</chorus><verse>They looked up and saw a starShining in the east, beyond them far,And to the earth it gave great light,And so it continued both day and night.</verse><verse>And by the light of that same star, Three wise men came from country far,To seek for a King was their intent,And to follow the star wherever it went.</verse><verse>This star drew nigh to the northwest,O'er Bethlehem it took its rest,And there it did both stop and stay,Right over the place where Jesus lay.</verse><verse>Then entered in those wise men three,Full reverently upon the knee,And offered there, in His presence,Their gold, and myrrh, and frankincense.</verse>

data.title: Angels From the Realms of Glory
data.preview: <verse>Angels from the realms of glory,Wing your flight o`er
data.data: <verse>Angels from the realms of glory,Wing your flight o`er all the earth;Ye, who sang creation`s story,Now proclaim Messiah`s birth;Come and worship, Come and worship,Worship Christ, the newborn King.</verse><verse>Shepherds, in the field abiding,Watching o`er your flocks by night,God with man is now residing;Yonder shines the Infant Light;Come and worship, Come and worship,Worship Christ, the newborn King.</verse><verse>Sages, leave your contemplations,Brighter visions beam afar;Seek the great Desire of nations;Ye have seen His natal star;Come and worship, Come and worship,Worship Christ, the newborn King.</verse><verse>Saints, before the altar bending,Watching long in hope and fear,Suddenly the Lord, descending,In His temple shall appear;Come and worship, Come and worship,Worship Christ, the newborn King.</verse>

data.title: There's a Song in the Air
data.preview: <verse>There's a song in the air!There's a star in the sky!T
data.data: <verse>There's a song in the air!There's a star in the sky!There's a mother's deep prayerAnd a baby's low cry!And the star rains its fireWhile the beautiful sing,For the manger of BethlehemCradles a King!</verse><verse>There's a tumult of joyO'er the wonderful birth,For the virgin's sweet boyIs the Lord of the earth.Aye! the star rains its fireWhile the beautiful sing,For the manger of BethlehemCradles a King!</verse><verse>In the light of that starLie the ages impearled;And that song from afarHas swept over the world.Every hearth is aflameAnd the beautiful singIn the homes of the nationsThat Jesus is King!</verse><verse>We rejoice in the light,And we echo the songThat comes down through the nightFrom the heavenly throng.Aye! we shout to the lovely evangel they bring,And we greet in His cradleOur Savior and King!</verse>

data.title: Go, Tell It On the Mountain
data.preview: <verse>While shepherds kept their watchingO'er silent flocks
data.data: <verse>While shepherds kept their watchingO'er silent flocks by night,Behold throughout the heavensThere shone a holy light.</verse><chorus>Go, tell it on the mountain,Over the hills and everywhere:Go, tell it on the mountainThat Jesus Christ is born!</verse></chorus><verse>The shepherds feared and trembledWhen lo! Above the earthRang out the angel chorusThat hailed our Savior's birth.</verse><verse>Down in a lowly mangerThe humble Christ was born,And brought us God's salvationThat blessed Christmas morn.</verse>

data.title: Hark! the Herald Angels Sing
data.preview: <verse>Hark! the herald angels sing,"Glory to the new b
data.data: <verse>Hark! the herald angels sing,"Glory to the new born King,Peace on earth, and mercy mild,God and sinners reconciled!"Joyful, all ye nations rise,Join the triumph of the skies;With th' angelic host proclaim,"Christ is born in Bethlehem!"Hark! the herald angels sing,"Glory to the new born King!"</verse><verse>Christ, by highest heaven adored;Christ, the everlasting Lord;Late in time behold him come,Offspring of a virgin's womb.Veiled in flesh the Godhead see;Hail th' incarnate Deity,Pleased with us in flesh to dwell,Jesus, our Immanuel.Hark! the herald angels sing,"Glory to the new born King!"</verse><verse>Hail the heaven-born Prince of Peace!Hail the Sun of Righteousness!Light and life to all he brings,Risen with healing in His wings.Mild He lays His glory by,Born that we no more may die,Born to raise us from the earth,Born to give us second birth.Hark! the herald angels sing,"Glory to the new born King!"</verse>

data.title: As With Gladness Men of Old
data.preview: <verse>As with gladness men of oldDid the guiding star behol
data.data: <verse>As with gladness men of oldDid the guiding star behold,As with joy they hailed its light,Leading onward, beaming bright,So, most gracious Lord, may weEvermore be led to Thee.</verse><verse>As with joyful steps they spedTo that lowly manger bed,There to bend the knee beforeHim whom heav'n and earth adore,So may we with willing feetEver seek Thy mercy seat.</verse><verse>As they offered gifts most rareAt that manger rude and bare,So may we with holy joy,Pure, and free from sin's alloy,All our costliest treasures bring,Christ, to Thee our heav'nly King.</verse><verse>Holy Jesus, every dayKeep us in the narrow way;And, when earthly things are past,Bring our ransomed souls at lastWhere they need no star to guide,Where no clouds Thy glory hide.</verse>

data.title: Away in a Manger
data.preview: <verse>Away in a manger, no crib for a bed,The little Lord J
data.data: <verse>Away in a manger, no crib for a bed,The little Lord Jesus laid down His sweet head.The stars in the sky looked down where He lay,The little Lord Jesus asleep in the hay.</verse><verse>The cattle are lowing, the Baby awakes,But little Lord Jesus no crying He makes.I love Thee, Lord Jesus, look down from the skyAnd stay by my cradle til morning is nigh.</verse><verse>Be near me, Lord Jesus, I ask Thee to stayClose by me forever, and love me, I pray.Bless all the dear children in Thy tender care,And take us to heaven, to live with Thee there.</verse>

data.title: Joy to the World
data.preview: <verse>Joy to the world, the Lord is come!Let earth receive
data.data: <verse>Joy to the world, the Lord is come!Let earth receive her King;Let every heart prepare Him room,And heaven and nature sing, And heaven and nature sing,And heaven, and heaven and nature sing.</verse><verse>Joy to the earth, the Savior reigns!Let men their songs employ;While fields and floods, rocks, hills, and plains,Repeat the sounding joy, Repeat the sounding joy,Repeat, repeat the sounding joy.</verse><verse>No more let sin and sorrow grow,Nor thorns infest the ground;He comes to make His blessings flowFar as the curse is found, Far as the curse is found,Far as, far as the curse is found.</verse><verse>He rules the world with truth and grace,And makes the nations proveThe glories of His righteousness,And wonders of His love, And wonders of His love,And wonders, and wonders of His love.</verse>

data.title: In the Bleak Midwinter
data.preview: <verse>In the bleak midwinter Frosty wind made moan;Earth st
data.data: <verse>In the bleak midwinter Frosty wind made moan;Earth stood hard as iron, Water like a stone;Snow had fallen, snow on snow, Snow on snow,In the bleak minwinter, Long ago.</verse><verse>Angels and archangels May have gathered there,Cherubim and seraphim Thronged the air.But His mother only In her maiden bliss,Worshiped the beloved With a kiss.</verse><verse>What can I give Him, Poor as I am?If I were a shepherd I would bring a lamb;If I were a wise man I would do my part;Yet what can I give Him? Give my heart.</verse>

data.title: Infant Holy, Infant Lowly
data.preview: <verse>Infant holy, Infant lowly,For His bed a cattle stall;
data.data: <verse>Infant holy, Infant lowly,For His bed a cattle stall;Oxen lowing, little knowingChrist the babe is Lord of all;Swift are winging angels singing,Noels ringing, tidings bringing,Christ the babe is Lord of all,Christ the babe is Lord of all.</verse><verse>Flocks were sleeping, shepherds keepingVigil till the morning new;Saw the glory, heard the story,Tidings of the gospel true;Thus rejoicing, free from sorrow,Praising voicing greet the morrow,Christ the babe was born for you,Christ the babe was born for you.</verse>

data.title: Break Forth, O Beauteous Heavenly Light
data.preview: <verse>Break forth, O beauteous heavenly light,And usher in
data.data: <verse>Break forth, O beauteous heavenly light,And usher in the morning;Ye shepherds, shrink not with affright,But hear the angel's warning.This child, now weak in infancyOur confidence and joy shall be,The power of Satan breaking,Our peace eternal making.</verse><verse>Break forth, O beauteous heavenly light,To herald our salvation;He stoops to earth the God of might,Our hope and expectation.He comes in human flesh to dwell,Our God with us, Immanuel,The night of darkness ending,Our fallen race be friending.</verse>

data.title: As It Fell Upon a Night
data.preview: <verse>As it fell upon a nightIn the winter weather,Angels b
data.data: <verse>As it fell upon a nightIn the winter weather,Angels bright in starry heightBegan to sing together.</verse><verse>Shepherds sleeping on the plainWoke to see the glory,All amazed they stood and gazedAnd heard the angels' story.</verse><verse>Unto you a child is bornIn a manger lowly,Humble, He, yet born to beThe King of Love most holy.</verse><verse>Happy angels from afar,Cease your singing never!In excelsis gloria!For ever and for ever.</verse>

data.title: It Came Upon the Midnight Clear
data.preview: <verse>It came upon the midnight clear,That glorious song of
data.data: <verse>It came upon the midnight clear,That glorious song of old,From angels bending near the earth,To touch their harps of gold:"Peace on the earth, goodwill to menFrom heavens all gracious King!"The world in solemn stillness layTo hear the angels sing.</verse><verse>Still through the cloven skies they come,With peaceful wings unfurled;And still their heavenly music floatsO'er all the weary world:Above its sad and lowly plainsThey bend on hovering wing,And ever o'er its Babel soundsThe blessed angels sing.</verse><verse>O ye beneath life's crushing load,Whose forms are bending low,Who toil along the climbing wayWith painful steps and slow;Look now, for glad and golden hoursCome swiftly on the wing;Oh rest beside the weary roadAnd hear the angels sing.</verse>

data.title: Lo, How a Rose E'er Blooming
data.preview: <verse>Lo, how a rose e're blooming From tenderstem hath spr
data.data: <verse>Lo, how a rose e're blooming From tenderstem hath sprung,Of Jesse's lineage coming As men of old have sung.It came, a floweret bright, Amid the cold of winterWhen half spent was the night.</verse><verse>Isaiah 'twas foretold it, The Rose I have in mind,With Mary we beheld it, The virgin mother kind.To show God's love aright She bore to them a Savior,When half spent was the night.</verse>

data.title: O Come, All Ye Faithful
data.preview: <verse>O come, all ye faithful, joyful and triumphant,O come
data.data: <verse>O come, all ye faithful, joyful and triumphant,O come ye, O come ye to Bethlehem!Come and behold Him, born the King of angels!O come, let us adore Him, O come, let us adore Him,O come, let us adore Him, Christ, the Lord!</verse><verse>Sing, choirs of angels sing in exultation,O sing all ye citizens of heaven above!Glory to God, all glory in the highest!O come, let us adore Him, O come, let us adore Him,O come, let us adore Him, Christ, the Lord!</verse><verse>Yea, Lord, we greet Thee, born this happy morning,Jesus, to Thee be all glory given;Word of the Father, now in flesh appearing!O come, let us adore Him, O come, let us adore Him,O come, let us adore Him, Christ, the Lord!</verse>

data.title: Now Is Born the Divine Christ Child
data.preview: <verse>He was born in a stable bare,On bed of straw howHe sl
data.data: <verse>He was born in a stable bare,On bed of straw howHe sleeps so soundly,He was born in a stable bare,Let us worship and to Him bow.</verse><verse>Ages long since are past and gone,When the wise men foretold His coming,Ages long since are past and gone,When the wise men foretold His birth.</verse>

data.title: O Jesus Sweet
data.preview: <verse>O Jesus sweet, O Jesus mild,Thy Father's will hast Th
data.data: <verse>O Jesus sweet, O Jesus mild,Thy Father's will hast Thou fulfilled;For Thou hast left Thy heavenly throneOur lowly state to make Thine own.O Jesus sweet, O Jesus mild.</verse><verse>O Jesus sweet, O Jesus mild,With joy hast Thou the whole world filled;Thou comest down from heaven's hallTo comfort us whom tears enthrall.O Jesus sweet, O Jesus mild.</verse><verse>O Jesus sweet, O Jesus mild,Thou art love's image undefiled.Inflame our hearts with love's pure fire,That we may share Thy heart's desire.O Jesus sweet, O Jesus mild.</verse><verse>O Jesus sweet, O Jesus mild,Help us to do as Thou hast willed.What e'er we have belongs to Thee:O may we ever faithful be.O Jesus sweet, O Jesus mild.</verse>

data.title: O Little Town of Bethlehem
data.preview: <verse>O little town of Bethlehem, how still we see thee lie
data.data: <verse>O little town of Bethlehem, how still we see thee lie!Above thy deep and dreamless sleep the silent stars go by.Yet in thy dark streets shineth the everlasting Light;The hopes and fears of all the years are met in thee tonight.</verse><verse>For Christ is born of Mary, and gathered all above,While mortals sleep, the angels keep their watch of wondering love.O morning stars together, proclaim the holy birth,And praises sing to God the King, and peace to men on earth!</verse><verse>How silently, how silently, the wondrous Gift is giv'n;So God imparts to human hearts the blessings of His heav'n.No ear may hear His coming, but in this world of sin,Where meek souls will receive Him still, the dear Christ enters in.</verse><verse>O holy Child of Bethlehem, descend to us, we pray;Cast out our sin, and enter in, be born in us today.We hear the Christmas angels the great glad tidings tell;O come to us, abide with us, our Lord Emmanuel!</verse>

data.title: Good Christians, Now Rejoice
data.preview: <verse>Good Christians, now rejoice,With heart, and soul, an
data.data: <verse>Good Christians, now rejoice,With heart, and soul, and voice;Give ye heed to what we say:Jesus Christ is born today;Ox and ass before Him bow,And He is in the manger now.Christ is born today!Christ is born today!</verse><verse>Good Christians, now rejoice,With heart, and soul, and voice;Now ye hear of endless bliss:Jesus Christ was born for this!He hath ope'd the heav'nly door,And we are blessed evermore.Christ was born for this!Christ was born for this!</verse><verse>Good Christians, now rejoice,With heart, and soul, and voice;Now ye need not fear the grave:Jesus Christ was born to save!Calls you one and calls you allTo gain His everlasting hall.Christ was born to save!Christ was born to save!</verse>

data.title: We Three Kings
data.preview: <verse>We three kings of Orient are;Bearing gifts we travers
data.data: <verse>We three kings of Orient are;Bearing gifts we traverse afarField and fountain, moor and mountain,Following yonder star.</verse><chorus>O star of wonder, star of night,Star with royal beauty bright,Westward leading, still proceeding,Guide us to Thy perfect light.</chorus><verse>Born a King on Bethlehem's plain,Gold I bring to crown Him again,King forever, ceasing neverOver us all to reign.</verse><verse>Frankincense to offer have I;Incense owns a Deity nigh;Prayer and praising all men raising,Worship Him, God on high.</verse><verse>Myrrh is mine; its bitter perfumeBreathes a life of gathering gloom:Sorrowing, sighing, bleeding, dying,Sealed in the stonecold tomb.</verse><verse>Glorious now behold Him arise,King and God and sacrifice;Alleluia, Alleluia!Sounds through the earth and skies.</verse>

data.title: Rise Up, Shepherd, and Follow
data.preview: <verse>There's a star in the east on Christmas morn.Rise Up,
data.data: <verse>There's a star in the east on Christmas morn.Rise Up, shepherd, and follow.It will lead to the place where the Savior's born,Rise Up, shepherd, and follow.</verse><chorus>Leave your sheep and leave your lamb,Rise Up, shepherd, and follow.Leave your ewes and leave your rams,Rise Up, shepherd, and follow. Follow, Follow,Rise Up, shepherd, and follow.Follow the star of Bethlehem,Rise Up, shepherd, and follow.</chorus><verse>If you take good heed to the angel's words,Rise Up, shepherd, and follow.You'll forget your flocks, you'll forget your herdsRise Up, shepherd, and follow.</verse>

data.title: While Shepherds Watched Their Flocks
data.preview: <verse>While shepherds watched their flocks by night,All sea
data.data: <verse>While shepherds watched their flocks by night,All seated on the ground,The angel of the Lord came down,And glory shone around.</verse><verse>"Fear nor!" said he- for mighty dreadHad seized their troubled mind-"Glad tidings of great joy I bring,To you and all mankind.</verse><verse>"To you, in David's town this day,Is born of David's line,The Savior who is Christ the Lord;And this shall be the sign:</verse><verse>"The heavenly Babe you there shall findTo human view displayed,All meanly wrapped in swathing bands,And in a manger laid."</verse><verse>Thus spake the seraph; and forth withAppeared a shining throngOf angels praising God on high,Who thus addressed their song:</verse><verse>"All glory be to God on high,And to the earth be peace;Good will henceforth from heaven to men,Begin and never cease!"</verse>

data.title: Thou Didst Leave Thy Throne
data.preview: <verse>Thou didst leave Thy throneAnd Thy kingly crownWhen T
data.data: <verse>Thou didst leave Thy throneAnd Thy kingly crownWhen Thou camest to earth for me;But in Bethlehem's homeWas there found no roomFor Thy holy nativity.</verse><chorus>O come to my heart, Lord Jesus,There is room in my heart for Thee.</chorus><verse>Heaven's arches rangWhen the angels sangProclaiming Thy royal degree;But of lowly birthDidst Thou come to earth,And in greatest humility.</verse><verse>The foxes found rest,And the birds their nestIn the shade of the forest tree;But Thy couch was the sod,O Thou Son of God,In the deserts of Galilee.</verse><verse>Thou camest, O Lord,With the living wordThat should set Thy people free;But with mocking scorn,And with crown of thorn,They bore Thee to Calvary.</verse><verse>When the heavens shall ring,And the angels sing,At Thy coming to victory,Let Thy voice call me home,Saying, "Yet there is room,There is room at My side for thee."Last RefrainMy heart shall rejoice, Lord Jesus,When Thou comest and callest for me.</verse>

data.title: What Child Is This?
data.preview: <verse>What Child is this, who, laid to rest, On Mary`s lap
data.data: <verse>What Child is this, who, laid to rest, On Mary`s lap is sleeping? Whom angels greet with anthems sweet, While shepherds watch are keeping? </verse><chorus>This, this is Christ the King,Whom shepherds guard and angels sing:Haste, haste to bring Him laud,The Babe, the Son of Mary.</chorus>2 <verse>Why lies He in such mean estate Where ox and ass are feeding? Good Christian, fear: for sinners here The silent Word is pleading. </verse><verse>3 <verse>So bring Him incense, gold, and myrrh, Come, peasant, king, to own Him, The King of kings salvation brings, Let loving hearts enthrone Him.</verse>

data.title: Angels We Have Heard on High
data.preview: <verse>Angels we have heard on highSweetly singing o'er the
data.data: <verse>Angels we have heard on highSweetly singing o'er the plains,And the mountains in replyEchoing their joyous strains.</verse><chorus>Gloria, in excelsis Deo!Gloria, in excelsis Deo!</chorus><verse>Shepherds, why this jubilee?Why these songs of happy cheer?What great brightness did you see?What glad tidings did you hear?</verse><verse>Come to Bethlehem and seeHim Whose birth the angels sing;Come, adore on bended knee,Christ the Lord, the newborn King.</verse><verse>See Him in a manger laid,Whom the angels praise above;Mary, Joseph, lend your aid,While we raise our hearts in love.</verse>

data.title: Silent Night, Holy Night
data.preview: <verse>Silent night! holy night! All is calm, all is brightR
data.data: Silent night! holy night! All is calm, all is brightRound yon virgin mother and Child, Holy Infant so tender and mild,Sleep in heavenly peace, sleep in heavenly peace. Silent night! holy night! Darkness flies, all is light,Shepherds hear the angels sing, Alleluia! Hail the King!;Christ, the Savior is born, Christ, the Savior is born. Silent night! holy night! Son of God, love's pure light,Radiant beams from Thy holy face, With the dawn of redeeming grace,Jesus, Lord, at Thy birth,Jesus, Lord, at Thy birth.Silent night, holy night,Wondrous star, lend thy light;With the angels let us sing,Allelulia to our King;Christ the Savior is born, Christ the Savior is born.

data.title: O Sing a Song of Bethlehem
data.preview: <verse>O sing a song of Bethlehem,Of shepherds watching ther
data.data: <verse>O sing a song of Bethlehem,Of shepherds watching there,And of the news that came to themFrom angels in the air:The light that shone on BethlehemFills all the world today;Of Jesus' birth and peace on earthThe angels sing alway.</verse><verse>O sing a song of Nazareth,Of sunny days of joy,O sing of fragrant flowers breath,And of the sinless Boy:For now the flowers of NazarethIn every heart may grow;Now spreads the fame of His dear nameOn all the winds that blow.</verse><verse>O sing a song of Calvary,Its glory and dismay;Of Him who hung upon the tree,And took our sins away:For He who died on CalvaryIs risen from the grave;And Christ, our Lord, by heaven adored,Is mighty now to save.</verse>

data.title: Songs of Thankfulness and Praise
data.preview: <verse>Songs of thankfulness and praise,Jesus, Lord, to You
data.data: <verse>Songs of thankfulness and praise,Jesus, Lord, to You we raise,Manifested by the starTo the sages from afar;Branch of royal David's stemIn Your birth at Bethlehem;Anthems be to You addressed,God in man made manifest.</verse><verse>Manifest at Jordan's stream,Prophet, Priest, and King supreme;And at Cana, wedding guest,In Your Godhead manifest;Manifest in power divine,Changing water into wine;Anthems be to You addressed,God in man made manifest.</verse><verse>Manifest in making wholePalsied limbs and fainting soul;Manifest in valiant fight,Quelling all the devil's might;Manifest in gracious will,Ever bringing good from ill;Anthems be to You addressed,God in man made manifest.</verse><verse>Grant us grace to see You, Lord,Mirrored in Your holy Word;May we imitate Your way,And be pure, as pure we may,That we like to You may beAt Your great epiphany;Let us praise You, ever blest,God in man made manifest.</verse>

data.title: I Think When I Read That Sweet Story
data.preview: <verse>I think when I read that sweet story of old,When Jesu
data.data: <verse>I think when I read that sweet story of old,When Jesus was here among men,How He called little children as lambs to His fold,I should like to have been with Him then.</verse><verse>I wish that His hands had been placed on my head,That His arm had been thrown around me,And that I might have seen His kind look when He said,"Let the little ones come unto Me."</verse><verse>I long for the joy of that glorious time,The sweetest and brightest and best,When the dear little children of every climeShall crowd to His arms and be blest.</verse>

data.title: Christ Upon the Mountain Peak
data.preview: <verse>Christ upon the mountain peakStands alone in glory bl
data.data: <verse>Christ upon the mountain peakStands alone in glory blazing;Let us, if we dare to speak,With the saints and angels praise Him:Alleluia, Alleluia, Alleluia.</verse><verse>Trembling at His feet we sawMoses and Elijah speaking;All the prophets and the lawShout thro'them their joyful greeting:Alleluia, Alleluia, Alleluia.</verse><verse>Swift the cloud of glory came,God proclaiming in the thunderJesus as His Son by name;Nations cry aloud in wonder!Alleluia, Alleluia, Alleluia.</verse><verse>This is God's beloved Son:Law and prophets fade before Him;First and last, the only One,Let creation now adore Him.Alleluia, Alleluia, Alleluia.</verse>

data.title: O Love, How Deep, How Broad
data.preview: <verse>O love, how deep, how broad, how high,Beyond all thou
data.data: <verse>O love, how deep, how broad, how high,Beyond all thought and fantasy,That God, the Son of God, should takeOur mortal form for mortal's sake!</verse><verse>For us baptized, for us He boreHis holy fast and hungered sore;For us temptation sharp He knew;For us the tempter over threw.</verse><verse>For us by wickedness betrayed,For us, in crown of thorns arrayed,He bore the shameful cross and death;For us He gave His dying breath.</verse><verse>For us He rose from death again,For us He went on high to reign;For us He sent His Spirit hereTo guide, to strengthen, and to cheer.</verse><verse>All glory to our Lord and GodFor love so deep, so high, so broad;The Trinity whom we adoreForever and forevermore.</verse>

data.title: Once in Royal David's City
data.preview: <verse>Once in royal David's cityStood a lowly cattle shed,W
data.data: <verse>Once in royal David's cityStood a lowly cattle shed,Where a mother laid her BabyIn a manger for His bed;Mary was that mother mild,Jesus Christ her little Child.</verse><verse>He came down to earth from heaven,Who is God and Lord of all,And His shelter was a stable,And His cradle was a stall;With the poor, and mean, and lowly,Lived on earth our Savior holy.</verse><verse>And through all His wondrous childhoodHe would honor and obey,Love and watch the lowly motherIn whose gentle arms He lay.Christian children all must beMild, obedient, good as He.</verse><verse>And our eyes at last shall see Him,Through His own redeeming love;For that Child so dear and gentleIs our Lord in heaven above;And He leads His children onTo the place where He is gone.</verse>

data.title: Who Is He in Yonder Stall?
data.preview: <verse>Who is He in yonder stall,At whose feet the shepherds
data.data: <verse>Who is He in yonder stall,At whose feet the shepherds fall?</verse><chorus>'Tis the Lord, O wondrous story,'Tis the Lord, the King of glory!At His feet we humbly fall,Crown Him, crown Him Lord of all.At His feet we humbly fall- the Lord of all.Crown Him, crown Him, Jesus, Jesus,Crown Him Lord of all.</chorus><verse>Who is He in deep distress,Fasting in the wilderness?</verse><verse>Who is He, the gathering throngGreet with loud triumphant song?</verse><verse>Lo, at midnight, who is HePrays in dark Gethsemane?</verse><verse>Who is He on yonder treeDies in shame and agony?</verse><verse>Who is He that from the graveComes to heal and help and save?</verse><verse>Who is He that from His throneRules through all the world alone?</verse>

data.title: Jesus Walked This Lonesome Valley
data.preview: <verse>Jesus walked this lonesome valley;He had to walk it b
data.data: <verse>Jesus walked this lonesome valley;He had to walk it by Himself.O nobody else could walk it for Him.He had to walk it by Himself.</verse><verse>I must go and stand my trial.I have to stand it by myself.O nobody else could stand it for me.I have to stand it by myself.</verse><verse>Jesus walked this lonesome valley;He had to walk it by Himself.O nobody else could walk it for Him.He had to walk it by Himself.</verse>

data.title: Tell Me the Story of Jesus
data.preview: <verse>Tell me the story of Jesus,Write on my heart every wo
data.data: <verse>Tell me the story of Jesus,Write on my heart every word.Tell me the story most precious,Sweetest that ever was heard.Tell how the angels in chorus,Sang as they welcomed His birth,"Glory to God in the highest!Peace and good tidings to earth."</verse><chorus>Tell me the story of Jesus,Write on my heart every word.Tell me the story most precious,Sweetest that ever was heard.</chorus><verse>Fasting alone in the desert,Tell of the days that He passed.How for our sins He was tempted,Yet was triumphant at last.Tell of the years of His labor,Tell of the sorrow He bore.He was despised and afflicted,Homeless, rejected and poor.</verse><verse>Tell of the cross where they nailed Him,Writhing in anguish and pain.Tell of the grave where they laid Him,Tell how He liveth again.Love in that story so tender,Clearer than ever I see.Stay, let me weep while you whisper,Love paid the ransom for me.</verse>

data.title: Prince of Peace, Control My Will
data.preview: <verse>Prince of Peace, control my will,Bid this struggling
data.data: <verse>Prince of Peace, control my will,Bid this struggling heart be still;Bid my fears and doubtings cease,Hush my spirit into peace.</verse><verse>Thou hast bought me with Thy blood,Opened wide the gate to God;Peace, I ask, but peace must be,Lord, in being one with Thee.</verse><verse>May Thy will, not mine, be done,May Thy will and mine be one;Chase these doubtings from my heart,Now Thy perfect peace impart.</verse>

data.title: When I Survey the Wondrous Cross
data.preview: <verse>When I survey the wondrous crossOn which the Prince o
data.data: <verse>When I survey the wondrous crossOn which the Prince of Glory died;My richest gain I count but loss,And pour contempt on all my pride.</verse><verse>Forbid it, Lord, that I should boast,Save in the death of Christ, my God;All the vain things that charm me most,I sacrifice them to His blood.</verse><verse>See, from His head, His hands, His feet,Sorrow and love flow mingled down.Did e'er such love and sorrow meet,Or thorns compose so rich a crown.</verse><verse>Were the whole realm of nature mine,That were an offering far too small;Love so amazing, so divine,Demands my soul, my life, my all.</verse>

data.title: When I Survey the Wondrous Cross
data.preview: <verse>When I survey the wondrous crossOn which the Prince o
data.data: <verse>When I survey the wondrous crossOn which the Prince of glory died,My richest gain I count but loss,And pour contempt on all my pride.</verse><verse>See, from His head, His feet,Sorrow and love flow mingled down;Did e'er such love and sorrow meet?Or thorns compose so rich a crown?</verse><verse>Since I, who was undone and lost,Have pardon through His name and word;Forbid it, then, that I should boast,Save in the cross of Christ my Lord.</verse><verse>Were the whole realm of nature mine,That were a tribute far too small;Love so amazing, so divine,Demands my life, my soul, my all.</verse>

data.title: O Sacred Head Now Wounded
data.preview: <verse>O sacred Head, now wounded, With grief and shame weig
data.data: <verse>O sacred Head, now wounded, With grief and shame weighed down, Now scornfully surrounded With thorns, Thine only crown: O sacred head what glory,What bliss till now was Thine!Yet, though despised and gory,I joy to call Thee mine.</verse><verse>What Thou, my Lord, hast suffered Was all for sinners' gain; Mine, mine was the transgression, But Thine the deadly pain. Lo, here I fall, my Savior! 'Tis I deserve Thy place; Look on me with Thy favor, Vouchsafe to me Thy grace. </verse><verse>What language shall I borrow To thank thee, dearest friend, For this Thy dying sorrow, Thy pity without end? O make me Thine forever; And should I fainting be, Lord, let me never, never Outlive my love for Thee.</verse>

data.title: Go to Dark Gethsemane
data.preview: <verse>Go to dark Gethsemane,Ye who feel the tempter's power
data.data: <verse>Go to dark Gethsemane,Ye who feel the tempter's powerYour Redeemer's conflict see.Watch with Him one bitter hour;Turn not from His griefs away;Learn from Jesus Christ to pray.</verse><verse>See Him at the judgment hall,Beaten, bound, reviled, arraigned;See Him meekly bearing all;Love to man His soul sustained!Shun not suffering, shame, or loss;Learn from Him to bear the cross.</verse><verse>Calvary's mournful mountain climb;There, adoring at His feet,Mark that miracle of time,God's own sacrifice complete."It is finished!" hear Him cry;Learn from Jesus Christ to die.</verse>

data.title: Were You There?
data.preview: <verse>Were you there when they crucified my Lord?Were you t
data.data: <verse>Were you there when they crucified my Lord?Were you there when they crucified my Lord?O! Sometimes it causes me to tremble, tremble, tremble.Were you there when they crucified my Lord?</verse><verse>Were you there when they nailed Him to the tree?Were you there when they nailed Him to the tree?O! Sometimes it causes me to tremble, tremble, tremble.Were you there when they nailed Him to the tree?</verse><verse>Were you there when they pierced Him in the side?Were you there when they pierced Him in the side?O! Sometimes it causes me to tremble, tremble, tremble.Were you there when they pierced Him in the side?</verse><verse>Were you there when the sun refused to shine?Were you there when the sun refused to shine?O! Sometimes it causes me to tremble, tremble, tremble.Were you there when the sun refused to shine?</verse><verse>Were you there when they laid Him in the tomb?Were you there when they laid Him in the tomb?O! Sometimes it causes me to tremble, tremble, tremble.Were you there when they laid Him in the tomb?</verse>

data.title: The Old Rugged Cross
data.preview: <verse>On a hill far away stood an old rugged cross,The embl
data.data: <verse>On a hill far away stood an old rugged cross,The emblem of suffering and shame;And I love that old cross where the dearest and bestFor a world of lost sinners was slain.</verse><chorus>So I'll cherish the old rugged cross,Till my trophies at last I lay down;I will cling to the old rugged cross,And exchange it some day for a crown.</chorus><verse>O that old rugged cross, so despised by the world,Has a wondrous attraction for me;For the dear Lamb of God left His glory aboveTo bear it to dark Calvary.</verse><verse>To that old rugged cross I will ever be true,It's shame and reproach gladly bear;Till He calls me some day to my home far away,Where His glory forever I'll share.</verse>

data.title: Ride On in Majesty
data.preview: <verse>Ride on! ride on in majesty!Hark, all the tribes hosa
data.data: <verse>Ride on! ride on in majesty!Hark, all the tribes hosanna cry;O Savior meek, pursue Thy roadWith palms and scattered garments strowed.</verse><verse>Ride on! ride on in majesty!In lowly pomp ride on to die;O Christ, Thy triumphs now beginO'er captive death and conquered sin.</verse><verse>Ride on! ride on in majesty!The winged squadrons of the skyLook down with sad and wondering eyesTo see the approaching sacrifice.</verse><verse>Ride on! ride on in majesty!In lowly pomp ride on to die;Bow Thy meek head to mortal pain,Then take, O God, Thy power and reign.</verse>

data.title: Throned Upon the Awful Tree
data.preview: <verse>Throned upon the awful tree,Lamb of God, Your grief w
data.data: <verse>Throned upon the awful tree,Lamb of God, Your grief we see.Darkness veils Your anguished face;None its lines of woe can trace.None can tell what pangs unknownHold You silent and alone.</verse><verse>Silent through those three dread hours,Wrestling with the evil powers,Left alone with human sin,Gloom around You and within,Till th'appointed time is nigh,Till the Lamb of God may die.</verse><verse>Hark, that cry that peals aloudUpward through the whelming cloud!You, the Father's only Son,You, His own anointed one,You are asking- can it be?"Why have You forsaken Me?"</verse><verse>Lord, should fear and anguish rollDarkly o'er our sinful soul,You, who once were thus bereftThat Your own might ne'er be left,Teach us by that bitter cryIn the gloom to know You nigh.</verse>

data.title: Wondrous Love
data.preview: <verse>What wondrous love is this, O my soul, O my soul?What
data.data: <verse>What wondrous love is this, O my soul, O my soul?What wondrous love is this, O my soul?What wondrous love is this that caused the Lord of bliss To bear the dreadful curse for my soul, for my soul;To bear the dreadful curse for my soul</verse><verse>To God and to the Lamb I will sing, I will sing;  To God and to the Lamb, I will sing; To God and to the Lamb who is the great I am,While millions join the theme, I will sing, I will sing; While millions join the theme, I will sing.</verse><verse>And when from death I'm free, I'll sing on, I'll sing on;And when from death I'm free, I'll sing on;And when from death I'm free, I'll sing and joyful be,And through eternity I'll sing on, I'll sing on!And through eternity, I'll sing on</verse>

data.title: At the Cross
data.preview: <verse>Alas! and did my Savior bleed,And did my Sovereign di
data.data: <verse>Alas! and did my Savior bleed,And did my Sovereign die?Would He devote that sacred headFor sinners such as I?</verse><chorus>At the cross, at the cross,Where I first saw the light,And the burden of my heart rolled away;It was there by faith I received my sight,And now I am happy all the day!</chorus><verse>Was it for crimes that I have done,He groaned upon the tree?Amazing pity! Grace unknown!And love beyond degree!</verse><verse>But drops of grief can ne'er repayThe debt of love I owe:Here, Lord, I give myself away;'Tis all that I can do!</verse>

data.title: There Is a Green Hill Far Away
data.preview: <verse>There is a green hill far away,Without a city wall,Wh
data.data: <verse>There is a green hill far away,Without a city wall,Where the dear Lord was crucified,Who died to save us all.</verse><verse>We may not know, we cannot tell,What pains He had to bear,But we believe it was for usHe hung and suffered there.</verse><verse>He died that we might be forgiven,He died to make us good,That we might go at last to heaven,Saved by His precious blood.</verse><verse>There was no other good enoughTo pay the price of sin;He only could unlock the gateOf heaven, and let us in.</verse><verse>O dearly, dearly has He loved!And we must love Him too,And trust in His redeeming blood,And try His works to do.</verse>

data.title: Look, You Saints! the Sight Is Glorious
data.preview: <verse>Look, you saints, the sight is glorious,See the Man o
data.data: <verse>Look, you saints, the sight is glorious,See the Man of sorrows now;From the fight returned victorious,Every knee to Him shall bow.Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!Crowns become the victor's brow.Crowns become the victor's brow.</verse><verse>Crown the Savior! angels crown Him!Rich the trophies Jesus brings;On the seat of power enthrone HimWhile the vault of heaven rings.Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!Crown the Savior, King of Kings.Crown the Savior, King of Kings.</verse><verse>Sinners in derision crowned Him,Mocking thus the Savior's claim;Saints and angels crowd around Him,Own His title, praise His name.Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!Spread abroad the victor's fame!Spread abroad the victor's fame!</verse><verse>Hark! those bursts of acclamation!Hark! those loud triumphant chords!Jesus takes the highest station;Oh, what joy the sight affords!Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!Crown Him! Crown Him! Crown Him!King of kings and Lord of lords!King of kings and Lord of lords!</verse>

data.title: Christ the Lord Is Risen Today
data.preview: <verse>Christ the Lord is risen today, Alleluia!Sons of man
data.data: <verse>Christ the Lord is risen today, Alleluia!Sons of man and angels say, Alleluia!Raise your joys and triumphs high, Alleluia!Sing, ye heavens, and earth reply, Alleluia!</verse><verse>Lives again our glorious King, Alleluia!Where, O death, is now thy sting? Alleluia!Once he died our souls to save, Alleluia!Where's thy victory, boasting grave? Alleluia!</verse><verse>Love's redeeming work is done, Alleluia!Fought the fight, the battle won, Alleluia!Death in vain forbids him rise, Alleluia!Christ has opened paradise, Alleluia!</verse><verse>Soar we now where Christ has led, Alleluia!Following our exalted Head, Alleluia!Made like him, like him we rise, Alleluia!Ours the cross, the grave, the skies, Alleluia!</verse>

data.title: Alleluia! Sing to Jesus!
data.preview: <verse>Alleluia! sing to Jesus! His the scepter, His the thr
data.data: <verse>Alleluia! sing to Jesus! His the scepter, His the throne.Alleluia! His the triumph, His the victory alone.Hark! the songs of peaceful Zion thunder like a mighty flood.Jesus out of every nation has redeemed us by His blood.</verse><verse>Alleluia! not as orphans are we left in sorrow now;Alleluia! He is near us, faith believes, nor questions how;Though the cloud from sight received Him when the forty days were o'erShall our hearts forget His promise, "I am with you evermore"?</verse><verse>Alleluia! bread of angels, Thou on earth our food, our stay;Alleluia! here the sinful flee to Thee from day to day:Intercessor, Friend of sinners, Earth's Redeemer, plead for me,Where the songs of all the sinless sweep across the crystal sea.</verse>

data.title: And Have the Bright Immensities
data.preview: <verse>And have the bright immensitiesReceived our risen Lor
data.data: <verse>And have the bright immensitiesReceived our risen Lord,Where light years frame the PleiadesAnd point Orion's sword?Do flaming suns His footsteps traceThro'corridors sublime,The Lord of inter stellar spaceAnd conqueror of time?</verse><verse>The heav'n that hides Him from our sightKnows neither near nor far;A little candle sheds its lightAs surely as a star.And where His loving people meetTo share the gift divine,There stands He with unhurrying feet;There heav'nly splendors shine.</verse>

data.title: Come, You Faithful
data.preview: <verse>Come, you faithful, raise the strainOf triumphant gla
data.data: <verse>Come, you faithful, raise the strainOf triumphant gladness;God has brought His peopleNow rejoice, Jerusalem, And with true affectionWelcome in unwearied strains Jesus' resurrection.</verse><verse>'Tis the spring of souls today;Christ has burst His prisonFrom the frost and gloom of deathLight and life have risenAll the winter of our sins,Long and dark, is flyingFrom His ligth, to whom we giveThanks and praise undying.</verse><verse>"Alleluia!" now we cryTo our King immortal,Who, triumphant, burst theBars of the tomb's dark portal"Alleluia!" with the Son,God the Father praising;"Alleluia!" yet again tothe Spirit raising.</verse>

data.title: Come, You Faithful
data.preview: <verse>Come, you faithful, raise the strainOf triumphant gla
data.data: <verse>Come, you faithful, raise the strainOf triumphant gladness;God has brought His IsraelInto joy from sadness;Loosed from Pharoah's bitter yokeJacob's sons and daughters;Led them with unmoistened footThrough the Red Sea waters.</verse><verse>'Tis the spring of souls today;Christ has burst His prison,And from three days' sleep in deathAs a sun has risen;All the winter of our sins,Long and dark, is flyingFrom His light, to whom is giv'nLaud and praise undying.</verse><verse>Now the queen of seasons, brightWith the day of splendor,With the royal feast of feasts,Comes its joy to render;Comes to gladden faithful heartsWhich with true affectionWelcome in unwearied strainJesus' resurrection.</verse><verse>For today among the twelveChrist appeared, be stowingHis deep peace, which evermorePasses human knowing.Neither could the gates of death,Nor the tomb's dark portal,Nor the watchers, nor the seal,Hold Him as a mortal.</verse><verse>"Alleluia!" now we cryTo our King immortal,Who, triumphant, burst the bars Of the tomb's dark portal;"Alleluia" with the Son,God the Father praising;"Alleluia!" yet againTo the Spirit raising.</verse>

data.title: Thine Is the Glory
data.preview: <verse>Thine is the glory, Risen, conquering Son;Endless is
data.data: <verse>Thine is the glory, Risen, conquering Son;Endless is the victory thou o'er death hast won.Angels in bright raiment rolled the stone away,Kept the folded grave-clothes where Thy body lay.</verse><chorus>Thine is the glory, Risen, conquering Son;Endless is the victory thou o'er death hast won.</chorus><verse>Lo! Jesus meets us. Risen from the tomb,Lovingly He greets us, Scatters fear and gloom;Let His Church with gladness hymns of triumph sing,For her Lord now liveth; Death has lost its sting.</verse><verse>No more we doubt Thee, Glorious Prince of life!Life is nought without Thee; Aid us in our strife;Make us more than conquerors through Thy deathless loveBring us safe through Jordan to Thy home above.</verse>

data.title: The Strife Is O'er
data.preview: <verse>Alleluia, alleluia, alleluia!The strife is o'er, the
data.data: <verse>Alleluia, alleluia, alleluia!The strife is o'er, the battle done;Now is the victor's triumph won!Now be the song of praise begun. Alleluia!</verse><verse>The pow'rs of death have done their worst,But Christ their legions has dispersed.Let shouts of holy joy outburst. Alleluia!</verse><verse>The three sad days have quickly sped,He rises glorious from the dead.All glory to our risen head! Alleluia!</verse><verse>Lord, by the stripes which wounded You,From death's sting free Your servants too,That we may live and sing to You. Alleluia!</verse>

data.title: Good Christian Friends, Rejoice!
data.preview: <verse>Good Christian friends, rejoice and sing!Now is the t
data.data: <verse>Good Christian friends, rejoice and sing!Now is the triumph of our King!To all the world glad news we bring:Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!</verse><verse>The Lord of life is risen for aye;Bring flowers of song to strew His way;Let all mankind rejoice and say:Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!</verse><verse>Praise we in songs of victoryThat love, that life which cannot die,And sing with hearts uplifted high:Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!</verse><verse>Thy name we bless, O risen Lord,And sing today with one accordThe life laid down, the life restored:Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!</verse>

data.title: Star of Our Hope
data.preview: <verse>Star of our hope! He'll soon appear,The last loud tru
data.data: <verse>Star of our hope! He'll soon appear,The last loud trumpet speaks Him near;Hail Him, all saints, from pole to pole-How welcome to the faithful soul!</verse><verse>From heaven angelic voices sound:Behold the Lord of glory crowned,Arrayed in majesty divine,And in His highest glories shine.</verse><verse>The grave yields up its precious trust,Which long has slumbered in the dust,Resplendent forms ascending, fair,Now meet the Savior in the air.</verse><verse>Descending with His azure throne,He claims the kingdom for His own;The saints rejoice, they shout, they sing,And hail Him their triumphant King.</verse>

data.title: Now the Green Blade Rises
data.preview: <verse>Now the green blade rises from the buried grain,What
data.data: <verse>Now the green blade rises from the buried grain,What that in dark earth many days has lain;Love lives again, that with the dead has been;Love is come again like wheat arising green.</verse><verse>In the grave they laid Him, love by hatred slain,Thinking that He would never wake again,Laid in the earth like grain that sleeps unseen;Love is come again like wheat arising green.</verse><verse>Forth He came in triumph, like the risen grain,He that for three days in the grave had lain;Raised from the dead, my living Lord is seen;Love is come again like wheat arising green.</verse><verse>When our hearts are wintry, grieving, or in pain,Your touch can call us back to life again,Field of our hearts that dead and bare have been;Love is come again like wheat arising green.</verse>

data.title: Hail the Day That Sees Him Rise
data.preview: <verse>Hail the day that sees Him rise, Alleluia!Glorious to
data.data: <verse>Hail the day that sees Him rise, Alleluia!Glorious to His native skies; Alleluia!Christ, awhile to mortals giv'n, Alleluia!Enters now the highest heav'n! Alleluia!</verse><verse>There the glorious triumph waits; Alleluia!Lift your heads, eternal gates! Alleluia!Wide unfold the radiant scene; Alleluia!Take the King of glory in! Alleluia!</verse><verse>See! He lifts His hands above; Alleluia!See! He shows the prints of love: Alleluia!Hark! His gracious lips bestow, Alleluia!Blessings on His Church below. Alleluia!</verse><verse>Lord beyond our mortal sight, Alleluia!Raise our hearts to reach Thy height, Alleluia!There Thy face unclouded see, Alleluia!Find our heav'n of heav'ns in Thee. Alleluia!</verse>

data.title: Jesus, Your Blood and Righteousness
data.preview: <verse>Jesus, your blood and righteousnessMy beauty are, my
data.data: <verse>Jesus, your blood and righteousnessMy beauty are, my glorious dress;Mid flaming worlds, in these arrayed,With joy shall I lift up my head.</verse><verse>Bold shall I stand in that great day,Cleansed and redeemed, no debt to pay;For by your cross absolved I amFrom sin and guilt, from fear and shame.</verse><verse>Lord, I believe your precious blood,Which at the mercy seat of GodPleads for the captives' liberty,Was also shed in love for me.</verse><verse>When from the dust of death I riseTo claim my mansion in the skies,This then shall be my only plea:Christ Jesus lived and died for me.</verse>

data.title: The Unveiled Christ
data.preview: <verse>Once our blessed Christ of beautyWas veiled off from
data.data: <verse>Once our blessed Christ of beautyWas veiled off from human views;But through suffering, death, and sorrowHe has rent the veil in two.</verse><chorus>O behold the Man of Sorrows!O behold Him in plain view!Lo! He is the mighty ConquerorSince He rent the veil in two;Lo! He is the mighty ConquerorSince He rent the veil in two.</chorus><verse>Yes, He is with God, the Father,Interceding there for you;For He is the Well belovedSince He rent the veil in two.</verse><verse>Holy angels bow before Him,Men of earth give praises due;For He is the mighty ConquerorSince He rent the veil in two.</verse>

data.title: The Wonders of Redeeming Love
data.preview: <verse>The wonders of redeeming loveOur highest thoughts exc
data.data: <verse>The wonders of redeeming loveOur highest thoughts exceed;The Son of God comes from aboveFor sinful man to bleed.</verse><verse>He gives Himself, His life, His all,A sinless sacrifice.For man He drains the cup of gall,For man the victim dies.</verse><verse>And now before His Father's faceHis precious blood He pleads;For those who seek the throne of graceHis love still intercedes.</verse><verse>He knows the frailties of our frame,For He has borne our grief;Our great High Priest once felt the same,And He can send relief.</verse><verse>His love will not be satisfied,Till He in glory seesThe faithful ones for whom He diedFrom sin forever free.</verse>

data.title: O Listen to Our Wondrous Story
data.preview: <verse>O listen to our wondrous story,Counted once among the
data.data: <verse>O listen to our wondrous story,Counted once among the lost;Yet One came down from heaven's glory,Saving us at awful cost!</verse><chorus>Who saved us from eternal loss?Who but God's Son upon the cross?What did He do? He died for you!Where is He now? Believe it thou,In heaven interceding! In heaven interceding!</chorus><verse>No angel could His place have taken,Highest of the high tho' he;The loved One on the cross forsakenWas One of the Godhead three!</verse><verse>Will you surrender to this Savior?To His scepter humbly bow?You, too, shall come to know His favor,He will save you, save you now.</verse>

data.title: Does Jesus Care?
data.preview: <verse>Does Jesus care when my heart is painedToo deeply for
data.data: <verse>Does Jesus care when my heart is painedToo deeply for mirth and song;As the burdens press, and the cares distress,And the way grows weary and long?</verse><chorus>O yes, He cares- I know He cares!His heart is touched with my grief;When the days are weary,The long nights dreary,I know my Savior cares. (He cares.)</chorus><verse>Does Jesus care when my way is darkWith a nameless dread and fear?As the daylight fades into deep night shades,Does He care enough to be near?</verse><verse>Does Jesus care when I've said goodbyeTo the dearest on earth to me,And my sad heart aches till it nearly breaks' Is it aught to Him? Does He see?</verse>

data.title: Christ Is Alive
data.preview: <verse>Christ is alive!Let Christians sing.His cross stands
data.data: <verse>Christ is alive!Let Christians sing.His cross stands empty to the sky.Let streets and homes with praises ring.His love in death shall never die.</verse><verse>Christ is alive!No longer boundTo distant years in Palestine,He comes to claim the here and nowAnd conquer every place and time.</verse><verse>In every insult,Rift, and warWhere color, scorn or wealth divide,He suffers still, yet loves the more,And lives, though ever crucified.</verse><verse>Christ is alive!Ascended LordHe rules the world His Father made,Till, in the end, His love adoredShall be to all on earth displayed.</verse>

data.title: I Will Sing of Jesus' Love
data.preview: <verse>I Will sing of Jesus love, Sing of Him,who first love
data.data: <verse>I Will sing of Jesus love, Sing of Him,who first loved me; For He left bright worlds above,And died on Calvary.</verse><chorus>I will sing of Jesus love Endless praise my heart shall give; He has died that I might live I will sing His love to me.</chorus><verse>O the depths of love divine! Earth or heaven can never know How that sin as dark as mine Can be made as white as snow.</verse><verse>Nothing good for Him I've done; How could He such love bestow? Lord, I own my heart is won, Help me now my love to show.</verse>

data.title: Jesus Paid It All
data.preview: <verse>I hear the Savior say,"Thy strength indeed is sm
data.data: <verse>I hear the Savior say,"Thy strength indeed is small;Child of weakness, watch and pray,Find in Me thine all in all."</verse><chorus>Jesus paid it all,All to Him I owe;Sin had left a crimson stain,He washed it white as snow.</chorus><verse>Lord, now indeed I findThy power and Thine alone,Can change the leper's spotsAnd melt the heart of stone.</verse><verse>Since nothing good have IWhereby Thy grace to claim,I'll wash my garments whiteIn the blood of Calv'ry's Lamb.</verse><verse>And when before the throneI stand in Him complete,I'll lay my trophies downAll down at Jesus' feet.</verse>

data.title: Jesus Is All the World to Me
data.preview: <verse>Jesus is all the world to me,My life, my joy, my all;
data.data: <verse>Jesus is all the world to me,My life, my joy, my all;He is my strength from day to day,Without him I would fall.When I am sad, to Him I go,No other one can cheer me so;When I am sad, He makes me glad,He's my friend.</verse><verse>Jesus is all the world to me,My friend in trials sore;I go to Him for blessings, andHe gives them o'er and o'er.He sends the sunshine and the rain,He sends the harvest's golden grain;Sunshine and rain, harvest of grain,He's my friend.</verse><verse>Jesus is all the world to me,And true to Him I'll be;O how could I this friend deny,When He's so true to me?Following Him I know I'm right,He watches o'er me day and night;Following Him by day and night,He's my friend.</verse><verse>Jesus is all the world to me,I want no better friend;I trust Him now, I'll trust Him whenLife's fleeting days shall end.Beautiful life with such a friend,Beautiful life that has no end;Eternal life, eternal joy,He's my friend.</verse>

data.title: I've Found a Friend
data.preview: <verse>I've found a Friend; oh, such a Friend!He loved me er
data.data: <verse>I've found a Friend; oh, such a Friend!He loved me ere I knew Him;He drew me with the cords of love,And thus He bound me to Him.And 'round my heart still closely twineThose ties which nought can sever,For I am His, and He is mine,Forever and forever.</verse><verse>I've found a Friend; oh, such a Friend!He bled, He died to save me;And not alone the gift of life,But His own self He gave me.Nought that I have my own I call,I hold it for the Giver;My heart, my strength, my life my all,Are His, and His forever.</verse><verse>I've found a Friend; oh, such a Friend!All power to Him is given;To guard me on my upward course,And bring me safe to heaven.The eternal glories gleam afar,To nerve my faint endeavor;So now to watch, to work, to war,And then to rest forever.</verse><verse>I've found a Friend; oh, such a Friend!So kind, and true, and tender,So wise a counselor and guide,So mighty a defender.From Him, who loveth me so well,What power my soul can sever?Shall life or death, or earth, or hell?No; I am His forever.</verse>

data.title: Jesus, What a Friend for Sinners
data.preview: <verse>Jesus! what a Friend for sinners!Jesus! Lover of my s
data.data: <verse>Jesus! what a Friend for sinners!Jesus! Lover of my soul;Friends may fail me, foes assail me,He, my Savior, makes me whole.</verse><chorus>Hallelujah! what a Savior!Hallelujah! what a Friend!Saving, helping, keeping, loving,He is with me to the end.</chorus><verse>Jesus! what a Strength in weakness!Let me hide myself in Him.Tempted, tried, and sometimes failing,He, my Strength, my victory wins.</verse><verse>Jesus! what a Help in sorrow!While the billows over me roll,Even when my heart is breaking,He, my Comfort, helps my soul.</verse><verse>Jesus! I do now receive Him,[or Jesus! I do now adore Him,]More than all in Him I find.He hath granted me forgiveness,I am His, and He is mine.</verse>

data.title: My Song Is Love Unknown
data.preview: <verse>My song is love unknown,My Savior's love to me,Love t
data.data: <verse>My song is love unknown,My Savior's love to me,Love to the loveless shown,That they might lovely be.O who am I that for my sakeMy Lord should take frail flesh and die?</verse><verse>He came from His blest throne,Salvation to bestow,But men made strange, and noneThe longed for Christ would know.But O my Friend, my Friend indeedWho at my need His life did spend.</verse><verse>Sometimes they strew His way,And His sweet praises sing,Resounding all the day,Hosannas to their King.Then "Crucify" is all their breath,And for His death they thirst and cry.</verse><verse>Why, what hath my Lord done?What makes this rage and spite?He made the lame to run,He gave the blind their sight.Sweet injuries! yet they at theseThemselves displease, and 'gainst Him rise.</verse><verse>They rise, and needs will haveMy dear Lord made away;A murderer they save,The Prince of life they slay.Yet cheerful He to suff'ring goes,That He His foes from thence might free.</verse><verse>Here might I stay and sing,No story so divine:Never was love, dear King,Never was grief like Thine!This is my Friend, in whose sweet praiseI all my days could gladly spend.</verse>

data.title: All That Thrills My Soul
data.preview: <verse>Who can cheer the heart like Jesus,By His presence al
data.data: <verse>Who can cheer the heart like Jesus,By His presence all divine?True and tender, pure and precious,Oh, how blest to call Him mine!</verse><chorus>All that thrills my soul is Jesus;He is more than life to me; (to me;)And the fairest of ten thousand,In my blessed Lord I see.</chorus><verse>Love of Christ so freely given,Grace of God beyond degree,Mercy higher than the heaven,Deeper than the deepest sea.</verse><verse>Every need His hand supplying,Every good in Him I see;On His strength divine relying,He is All in All to me.</verse><verse>By the crystal flowing riverWith the ransomed I will sing,And forever and foreverPraise and glorify the King</verse>

data.title: Jesus Loves Me
data.preview: <verse>Jesus loves me! this I know,For the Bible tells me so
data.data: <verse>Jesus loves me! this I know,For the Bible tells me so;Little ones to Him belongThey are weak but He is strong</verse><chorus>Yes, Jesus loves me!Yes, Jesus loves me!Yes, Jesus loves me!The Bible tells me so.</chorus><verse>Jesus loves me! He who diedHeaven's gate to open wide:He will wash away my sin,Let His little child come in.</verse><verse>Jesus, take this heart of mine,Make it pure and wholly thine;On the cross You died for me,I will love and live for Thee.</verse>

data.title: Love Divine
data.preview: <verse>Love divine, all loves excelling,Joy of heaven, to ea
data.data: <verse>Love divine, all loves excelling,Joy of heaven, to earth come down;Fix in us Thy humble dwelling;All Thy faithful mercies crown!Jesus Thou art all compassion,Pure, unbounded love Thou art;Visit us with Thy salvation;Enter every trembling heart.</verse><verse>Breathe, O breathe thy loving SpiritInto every troubled breast!Let us all in thee inherit;Let us find the promised rest.Take away our bent to sinning;Alpha and Omega be;End of faith, as its beginning,Set our hearts at liberty.</verse><verse>Come, Almighty to deliver,Let us all Thy grace receive;Suddenly return and never,Nevermore Thy temples leave.Thee we would be always blessing,Serve Thee as Thy hosts above,Pray and praise Thee without ceasing,Glory in Thy perfect love.</verse><verse>Finish, then, Thy new creation;Pure and spotless let us be.Let us see Thy great salvationPerfectly restored in Thee;Changed from glory into glory,Till in heaven we take our place,Till we cast our crowns before Thee,Lost in wonder, love, and praise.</verse>

data.title: O Shepherd Divine
data.preview: <verse>O Shepherd divine, I know Thou art mine;Thy search in
data.data: <verse>O Shepherd divine, I know Thou art mine;Thy search in the night was for me.This bleak world is cold, but warm is Thy fold;My Shepherd, I follow Thee.Thy beautiful lamp shineth bright o'er my way,Thy glorious light unto Thy perfect day.Thro' pastures serene, Thro' valleys of green,My Shepherd, I follow Thee.</verse><verse>O Shepherd divine, I know Thou art mine;Thy great heart was broken for me.Thy grace and Thy law I picture in awe;They kissed upon Calvary.Ah! life that was given to ransom my soul,Ah! heart that was broken to make sinners whole,This world is but loss In view of Thy cross,My Shepherd, I follow Thee.</verse><verse>O Shepherd divine, I know Thou art mine;I hear Thee say, "Follow thou Me."Thy message today illumines my way;The Spirit of Prophecy.I thrill at Thy marvelous love to Thy sheep,The way Thou dost lead to the still waters deep,One staff and one rod, One fold and one God,My Shepherd, I follow Thee.</verse>

data.title: Savior, Teach Me
data.preview: <verse>Savior, teach me day by day,Love's sweet lesson to ob
data.data: <verse>Savior, teach me day by day,Love's sweet lesson to obey,Sweeter lesson cannot be,Loving Him who first loved me.</verse><verse>With a child's glad heart of love,At Thy bidding may I move,Prompt to serve and follow Thee,Loving Him who first loved me.</verse><verse>Teach me I am not my own,I am Thine, and Thine alone;Thine to keep, to rule, to saveFrom all sin that would enslave.</verse><verse>Love in loving finds employ,In obedience all her joy;Ever new that joy will be,Loving Him who first loved me.</verse><verse>Teach me thus Thy steps to trace,Strong to follow in Thy grace.Learning how to love from Thee,Loving Him who first loved me.</verse>

data.title: Sing We of the Modern City
data.preview: <verse>Sing we of the modern city,Scene alike of joy and str
data.data: <verse>Sing we of the modern city,Scene alike of joy and stress;Sing we of its namelss peopleIn their urban wilderness.Into endless rows of housesLife is set a millionfold,Life expressed in human beingsDaily born and growing old.</verse><verse>In the city full of people,World of speed and hectic days,In the everchanging settingOf the latest trend and craze,Christ is present, and among us;In the crowd we see Him stand.In the bustle of the cityJesus Christ is every man.</verse><verse>God is not remote in heaven,But on earth to share our shame,Changing graph and mass and numberInto persons with a name.Christ has shown, beyond statistics,Human life with glory crowned,By His timeless presence provingPeople matter, people count!</verse>

data.title: Showers of Blessing
data.preview: <verse>"There shall be showers of blessing;" This
data.data: <verse>"There shall be showers of blessing;" This is the promise of love;There shall be seasons refreshing, Sent from the Savior above.</verse><chorus>Showers of blessing,Showers of blessing we need; Mercy drops round us are falling,But for the showers we plead.</chorus><verse>"There shall be showers of blessing;" Precious reviving again;Over the hills and the valleys,Sound of abundance of rain.</verse><verse>"There shall be showers of blessing;" Send them upon us, O Lord;Grant to us now a refreshing;Come, and now honor Thy word.</verse><verse>"There shall be showers of blessing;" O that today they might fall, Now as to God we're confessing,Now as on Jesus we call! </verse>

data.title: Tell Me the Old, Old Story
data.preview: <verse>Tell me the old, old story of unseen things above,Of
data.data: <verse>Tell me the old, old story of unseen things above,Of Jesus and His glory, of Jesus and His love.Tell me the story simply, as to a little child,For I am weak and weary, and helpless and defiled.</verse><chorus>Tell me the old, old story, tell me the old, old story,Tell me the old, old story, of Jesus and His love.</chorus><verse>Tell me the story softly, with earnest tones and grave;Remember I'm the sinner whom Jesus came to save.Tell me the story always, if you would really be,In any time of trouble, a comforter to me.</verse><verse>Tell me the same old story when you have cause to fearThat this world's empty glory is costing me too dear.Yes, and when that world's glory is dawning on my soul,Tell me the old, old story: "Christ Jesus makes thee whole."</verse>

data.title: The King of Love My Shepherd Is
data.preview: <verse>The King of love my Shepherd is,Whose goodness failet
data.data: <verse>The King of love my Shepherd is,Whose goodness faileth never;I nothing lack if I am His,And He is mine forever.</verse><verse>Where streams of living water flowMy ransomed soul He leadeth,And, where the verdant pastures grow,With food celestial feedeth.</verse><verse>Perverse and foolish, oft I strayed,But yet in love He sought me,And on His shoulder gently laid,And home, rejoicing, brought me.</verse><verse>And so through all the length of daysThy goodness faileth never;Good Shepherd! I would sing Thy praiseWithin Thy house forever.</verse>

data.title: And Can It Be?
data.preview: <verse>And can it be that I should gain An interest in the S
data.data: <verse>And can it be that I should gain An interest in the Savior's blood! Died he for me? Who caused His pain! For me? who Him to death pursued? Amazing love!
