How can it be That Thou, my God, shouldst die for me? </verse><chorus>Amazing love! How can it be That Thou, my God, shouldst die for me? </chorus><verse>He left his Father's throne above So free, so infinite His grace!; Emptied Himself of all but love, And bled for Adam's helpless race. 'Tis mercy all, immense and free, For O my God, it found out me! </verse><verse>Long my imprisoned sprit lay, Fast bound in sin and nature's night; Thine eye diffused a quickening ray; I woke, the dungeon flamed with light; My chains fell off, my heart was free, I rose, went forth, and followed Thee. </verse><verse>No condemnation now I dread; Jesus, and all in Him, is mine; Alive in Him, my living Head, And clothed in righteousnes divine, Bold I approach th' eternal throne, And claim the crown, through Christ my own. </verse>

data.title: The Head That Once Was Crowned
data.preview: <verse>The head that once was crowned with thornsIs crowned
data.data: <verse>The head that once was crowned with thornsIs crowned with glory now;A royal diadem adornsThe mighty victor's brow.</verse><verse>The highest place that heaven affordsIs His, is His by right;The King of kings, and Lord of lords,And heaven's eternal light.</verse><verse>The joy of all who dwell above,The joy of all below,To whom He manifests His love,And grants His name to know.</verse><verse>To them the cross, with all its shame,With all its grace is given;Their name an everlasting name,Their joy the joy of heaven.</verse>

data.title: The Lord Is Coming
data.preview: <verse>The Lord is coming, let this beThe herald note of jub
data.data: <verse>The Lord is coming, let this beThe herald note of jubilee;And when we meet and when we partThe salutation from the heart.</verse><chorus>The Lord is coming, let this beThe herald note of jubilee,The herald note of jubilee.</chorus><verse>The Lord is coming! sound it forthFrom east to west, from south to north;Speed on! speed on the tidings glad,That none who love Him may be sad.</verse><verse>The Lord is coming, swift and sureAnd all His judgments shall endure,And none can hope to escape His wrath, Who walk not in the narrow path.</verse><verse>This earth, with her ten thousand wrongsWill soon be tuned to nobler songs;Our praise shall then, in realms of light,With all His universe unite.</verse>

data.title: Christ Is Coming
data.preview: <verse>Christ is coming! let creationBid her groans and trav
data.data: <verse>Christ is coming! let creationBid her groans and travail cease;Let the glorious proclamationHope restore and faith increase;Christ is coming! Christ is coming!Come, Thou blessed Prince of Peace!(Prince of Peace!)Come, Thou blessed Prince of Peace!</verse><verse>Earth can now but tell the storyOf Thy bitter cross and pain;She shall yet behold Thy gloryWhen Thou comest back to reign;Christ is coming! Christ is coming!Let each heart repeat the strain.(repeat the strain)Let each heart repeat the strain.</verse><verse>With that "blessed hope" before us,Let no harp remain unstrung;Let the mighty advent chorusOnward roll from tongue to tongue:Christ is coming! Christ is coming!Come, Lord Jesus, quickly come! (quickly come!)Come, Lord Jesus, quickly come!</verse>

data.title: Hail Him the King of Glory
data.preview: <verse>Tell it to every kindred and nation,Tell it far and n
data.data: <verse>Tell it to every kindred and nation,Tell it far and near;Earth's darkest night will fade with the dawning,Jesus will soon appear.</verse><chorus>Hail Him the King of glory,Once the Lamb for sinners slain;Tell, tell the wondrous story,"Jesus comes to reign."</chorus><verse>Nations again in strife and commotion,Warnings by the way;Signs in the heavens, unerring omens,Herald the glorious day.</verse><verse>Children of God look up with rejoicing;Shout and sing His praise;Bless'd are they who, waiting and watching,Look for the dawning rays.</verse>

data.title: This Is the Threefold Truth
data.preview: <verse>This is the threefold truthOn which our faith depends
data.data: <verse>This is the threefold truthOn which our faith depends;And with this joyful cryWorship begins and ends.</verse><chorus>Christ had died! Christ has risen!Christ will come again!</chorus><verse>By this we are upheld When doubt and grief assailOur Christian fortitude And only grace avails</verse><verse>This is the threefold truth Which, if we hold it fast,Changes the world and us And brings us home at last.</verse>

data.title: Come, Thou Long Expected Jesus
data.preview: <verse>Come, thou long expected Jesus!Born to set Thy people
data.data: <verse>Come, thou long expected Jesus!Born to set Thy people free; From our fears and sins release us, Let us find our rest in Thee. Israel's strength and consolation, Hope of all the earth Thou art; Dear desire of every nation, Joy of every longing heart.</verse><verse>Born Thy people to deliver, Born a child and yet a King, Born to reign in us forever, Now Thy gracious kingdom bring. By Thine own eternal spirit Rule in all our hearts alone; By Thine all sufficient merit, Raise us to thy glorious throne.</verse>

data.title: Gleams of the Golden Morning
data.preview: <verse>The golden morning is fast approaching; Jesus soon wi
data.data: <verse>The golden morning is fast approaching; Jesus soon will come To take His faithful and happy children To their promised home</verse><chorus>O, we see the gleams of the golden morning Piercing thro' this night of gloom! O, we see the gleams of the golden morning That will burst the tomb.</chorus><verse>The gospel summons will soon be carried To the nations round; The Bridegroom then will cease to tarry And the trumpet sound.</verse><verse>Attended by all the shining angels, Down the flaming sky The Judge will come, and will take His people Where they will not die.</verse><verse>The lov'd of earth who have long been parted, Meet in that glad day; The tears of those who are broken hearted Shall be wiped away.</verse>

data.title: Face to Face
data.preview: <verse>Face to face with Christ my Savior,Face to face, what
data.data: <verse>Face to face with Christ my Savior,Face to face, what will it be,When with rapture I behold Him,Jesus Christ, who died for me?</verse><chorus>Face to face shall I behold Him,Far beyond the starry sky;Face to face in all His gloryI shall see Him by and by!</chorus><verse>Only faintly now I see Him,With the darkening veil between,But a blessed day is coming, When His glory shall be seen.</verse><verse>What rejoicing in His presence,When are banished grief and pain;When the crooked ways are straightened, And the dark things shall be plain!</verse><verse>Face to face! oh, blissful moment!Face to face to see and know;Face to face with my Redeemer,Jesus Christ, who loves me so.</verse>

data.title: It May Be at Morn
data.preview: <verse>It may be at morn, when the day is awaking,When sunli
data.data: <verse>It may be at morn, when the day is awaking,When sunlight through darkness and shadow is breaking,That Jesus will come in the fullness of gloryTo receive from the world His own.</verse><chorus>O Lord Jesus, how long, how longEre we shout the glad song?Christ returneth, Hallelujah! Hallelujah! Amen, Hallelujah! Amen.</chorus><verse>It may be at midday, it may be at twilight,It may be, perchance, that the blackness of midnightWill burst into light in the blaze of His glory,When Jesus receives His own.</verse><verse>O joy! O delight! should we go without dying,No sickness, no sadness, no dread, and no crying,Caught up through the clouds with our Lord into glory,When Jesus receives His own.</verse>

data.title: There'll Be No Dark Valley
data.preview: <verse>There'll be no dark valleys when Jesus comes,There'll
data.data: <verse>There'll be no dark valleys when Jesus comes,There'll be no dark valleys when Jesus comes,There'll be no dark valleys when Jesus comes,To gather His loved ones home.</verse><chorus>To gather His loved ones home,To gather His loved ones home.There'll be no dark valleys when Jesus comes,To gather His loved ones home.</chorus><verse>There'll be no more sorrow when Jesus comes,There'll be no more sorrow when Jesus comes,There'll be a happy tomorrow when Jesus comes,To gather His loved ones home.</verse><verse>There'll be songs of greeting when Jesus comes,There'll be songs of greeting when Jesus comes,There'll be songs of greeting when Jesus comes,To gather His loved ones home.</verse>

data.title: That Glorious Day Is Coming
data.preview: <verse>That glorious day is coming,The hour is hastening on;
data.data: <verse>That glorious day is coming,The hour is hastening on;Its radiant light is nearing,Far brighter than the sun;In yonder clouds of heaven,The Savior will appear,And gather all His chosen,To meet Him in the air.</verse><verse>The saints, then all victoriousWill go to meet their Lord;An earth both bright and glorious,Will then be their reward;And God Himself there reigning,Will wipe all tears away;Nor clouds nor night remaining,But one eternal day.</verse><verse>O Christian, keep from sleeping,And let your love abound;Be watchful, prayerful, faithful,The trumpet soon will sound!O sinner, hear the warning!To Jesus quickly fly!Then you, in that blest morning,May meet Him in the sky!</verse>

data.title: Wake, Awake for the Night Is Flying
data.preview: <verse>Wake, awake, for night is flying,The watchmen on the
data.data: <verse>Wake, awake, for night is flying,The watchmen on the heights are crying,Awake, Jerusalem, arise!Midnight's solemn hour is tolling,His chariot wheels are nearer rolling,He comes; prepare, ye virgins wise.Rise up with willing feetGo forth, the Bridegroom meet; Alleluia!Bear through the night your well-trimmed light,Speed forth to join the marriage rite.</verse><verse>Zion hears the watchmen singing, Her heart with deep delight is springing,She wakes, she rises from her gloom;Forth her Bridegroom comes, all-glorious,In grace arrayed, by truth victorious;Her Star is risen, her Light is come!All hail, incarnate Lord,Our crown, and our reward! Alleluia!We haste along, in pomp and song,And gladsome join the marriage throng.</verse><verse>Lamb of God, the heavens adore Thee,And men and angels sing before Thee,With harp and cymbal's clearest tone.By the pearly gates in wonderWe stand, and swell the voice of thunder,That echoes round Thy dazzling throne.No vision ever brought,No ear hath ever caught,Such bliss and joy;We raise the song, we swell the throng,To praise Thee ages all along.</verse>

data.title: Lo! He Comes
data.preview: <verse>Lo! He comes, with clouds descending,Once for favored
data.data: <verse>Lo! He comes, with clouds descending,Once for favored sinners slain;Countless angels, Him attending,Swell the triumph of His train:Hallelujah! Hallelujah!Jesus comes, and comes to reign.</verse><verse>Every eye shall now behold HimRobed in dreadful majesty!Those who set at nought and sold Him,Pierced, and nailed Him to the tree,Deeply wailing, Deeply wailing,Shall the true Messiah see!</verse><verse>When the solemn trump has sounded,Heaven and earth shall flee away;All who hate Him, must, confounded,Hear the summons of that day-"Come to judgment! Come to judgment!Come to judgment! Come away!"</verse><verse>Yea, amen! let all adore Thee,High on Thy eternal throne!Savior, take the power and glory,Make Thy righteous sentence known;O come quickly, O come quickly,Claim the kingdom for Thine own!</verse>

data.title: 'Tis Almost Time for the Lord to Come
data.preview: <verse>'Tis almost time for the Lord to come,I hear the peop
data.data: <verse>'Tis almost time for the Lord to come,I hear the people say;The stars of heaven are growing dim,It must be the breaking of the day.</verse><chorus>O it must be the breaking of the day!O it must be the breaking of the day!The night is almost gone,The day is coming on;O it must be the breaking of the day!</chorus><verse>The signs foretold in the sun and moon,In earth and sea and sky,Aloud proclaim to all mankind,The coming of the Master draweth nigh.</verse><verse>It must be time for the waiting churchTo cast her pride away,With girded loins and burning lamps,To look for the breaking of the day.</verse><verse>Go quickly out in the streets and lanesAnd in the broad highway,And call the maimed, the halt, and blind,To be ready for the breaking of the day.</verse>

data.title: Jesus Is Coming Again
data.preview: <verse>Lift up the trumpet, and loud let it ring:Jesus is co
data.data: <verse>Lift up the trumpet, and loud let it ring:Jesus is coming again!Cheer up, ye pilgrims, be joyful and sing:Jesus is coming again!</verse><chorus>Coming again, coming again,Jesus is coming again!</chorus><verse>Echo it, hilltops; proclaim it, ye plains:Jesus is coming again!Coming in glory, the Lamb that was slain;Jesus is coming again!</verse><verse>Heavings of earth, tell the vast, wondering throng:Jesus is coming again!Tempests and whirlwinds, the anthem prolong;Jesus is coming again!</verse><verse>Nations are angry--by this we do knowJesus is coming again!Knowledge increases; men run to and fro;Jesus is coming again!</verse>

data.title: We Have This Hope
data.preview: <verse>We have this hope that burns within our heart,Hope in
data.data: <verse>We have this hope that burns within our heart,Hope in the coming of the Lord.We have this faith that Christ alone imparts,Faith in the promise of His Word.We believe the time is here,When the nations far and nearShall awake, and shout and singHallelujah! Christ is King!We have this hope that burns within our heart,Hope in the coming of the Lord.</verse><verse>We are united in Jesus Christ our Lord.We are united in His love.Love for the waiting people of the world,People who need our Savior's love.Soon the heav'ns will open wide,Christ will come to claim His bride,All the universe will singHallelujah! Christ is King!We have this hope this faith, and God's great love,We are united in Christ.</verse>

data.title: The King Shall Come
data.preview: <verse>The King shall come when morning dawnsAnd light trium
data.data: <verse>The King shall come when morning dawnsAnd light triumphant breaks,When beauty gilds the eastern hillsAnd life to joy awakes.</verse><verse>Not as of old a little child,To bear and fight and die,But crowned with glory like the sunThat lights the morning sky.</verse><verse>O, brighter than the rising mornWhen Christ, victorious, roseAnd left the lonesome place of death,Despite the rage of foes.</verse><verse>O, brighter than that glorious mornShall dawn upon our raceThe day when Christ in splendor comes,And we shall see His face.</verse><verse>The King shall come when morning dawnsAnd light and beauty brings.Hail, Christ the Lord! Your people pray:Come quickly, King of kings.</verse>

data.title: When the Roll Is Called Up Yonder
data.preview: <verse>When the trumpet of the Lord shall sound,And time sha
data.data: <verse>When the trumpet of the Lord shall sound,And time shall be no more,And the morning breaks, eternal, bright and fair;When the saved of earth shall gatherOver on the other shore,And the roll is called up yonder, I'll be there.</verse><chorus>When the roll is called up yonder,When the roll is called up yonder,When the roll is called up yonder,When the roll is called up yonder, I'll be there.</chorus><verse>On that bright and cloudless morning,When the dead in Christ shall rise,And the glory of His resurection share;When His chosen ones shall gatherTo their home beyond the skies,And the roll is called up yonder, I'll be there.</verse><verse>Let us labor for the MasterFrom the dawn till setting sun,Let us talk of all His wondrous love and care,Then, when all of life is over,And our work on earth is done,And the roll is called up yonder I'll be there.</verse>

data.title: The Church Has Waited Long
data.preview: <verse>The church has waited longHer absent Lord to see;And
data.data: <verse>The church has waited longHer absent Lord to see;And still in loneliness she waits,A friendless stranger she.</verse><verse>How long, O Lord our God,Holy and true and good,Wilt Thou not judge Thy suffering church,Her sighs and tears and blood?</verse><verse>We long to hear Thy voice,To see Thee face to face,To share Thy crown and glory then,As now we share Thy grace.</verse><verse>Come, Lord, and wipe awayThe curse, the sin, the stain,And make this blighted world of oursThine own fair world again.</verse>

data.title: When He Cometh
data.preview: <verse>When He cometh, when He comethTo make up His jewels,A
data.data: <verse>When He cometh, when He comethTo make up His jewels,All His jewels, precious jewels,His loved and His own.</verse><chorus>Like the stars of the morning,His brightness adorning,They shall shine in their beauty,Bright gems for His crown.</chorus><verse>He will gather, He will gatherThe gems for His kingdom;All the pure ones, all the bright ones,His loved and His own.</verse><verse>Little children, little children,Who love their Redeemer,Are the jewels, precious jewels,His loved and His own.</verse>

data.title: When Jesus Comes in Glory
data.preview: <verse>When Jesus comes in glory,As Lord and King of kings,O
data.data: <verse>When Jesus comes in glory,As Lord and King of kings,O what a wondrous storyThe blessed Bible brings:His face will shine like sunlight,His head be white as snow,His eyes like flaming firelight,His feet like brass aglow.</verse><verse>His voice like rushing watersWill reach with mighty soundInto the deepest quartersOf all creation round;And at this wondrous greetingThe dead in Christ shall rise,Their Lord and Savior meetingIn glory in the skies.</verse><verse>And we who are believingAnd His appearing love,Shall know we are receivingHis glory from above;His resurrection powerWill raise us to the placeWhere we that wondrous hourShall see Him face to face.</verse><verse>O hasten Thine appearing,Thou bright and Morning Star!Lord, may we soon be hearingThe trumpet sound afar;Thy people all are yearningTo be Thy raptured bride,And at Thine own returningBe caught up to Thy side.</verse>

data.title: When He Comes
data.preview: <verse>When He comes, When He comes, We shall see the Lord i
data.data: <verse>When He comes, When He comes, We shall see the Lord in glorywhen He comes! As I read the gospel story,We shall see the Lord in glory,We shall see the Lord in glory when He comes!With the alleluias ringing to the sky,With the alleluias ringing to the sky,As I read the gospel story,We shall see the Lord in glory,With the alleluias ringing to the sky!</verse><verse>When He comes, When He comes, We shall hear the trumpet sounded,when He comes! We shall hear the trumpet sounded,See the Lord by saints surrounded,We shall hear the trumpet sounded, when He comes!With the alleluias ringing to the sky,With the alleluias ringing to the sky,We shall hear the trumpet sounded,See the Lord by saints surrounded,With the alleluias ringing to the sky!</verse><verse>When He comes, When He comes, We shall all rise up to meet Him when He comes! We shall all rise up to meet Him,When He calls His own to greet HimWe shall all rise up to meet Him when He comes!With the alleluias ringing to the sky,With the alleluias ringing to the sky,We shall all rise up to meet Him,When He calls His own to greet Him,With the alleluias ringing to the sky!</verse>

data.title: Rejoice, the Lord Is King
data.preview: <verse>Rejoice, the Lord is King! Your Lord and King adore!R
data.data: <verse>Rejoice, the Lord is King! Your Lord and King adore!Rejoice, give thanks, and sing and triumph evermoreLift up your heart, lift up your voice!Rejoice, again I say, rejoice!</verse><verse>Jesus, the Savior, reigns, The God of truth and love;When He had purged our stains, He took His seat aboveLift up your heart, lift up your voice!Rejoice, again I say, rejoice!</verse><verse>His kingdom cannot fail, He rules o'er earth and heavenThe keys of death and grave Are to our Jesus givenLift up your heart, lift up your voice!Rejoice, again I say, rejoice!</verse><verse>Rejoice in glorious hope! Our Lord the judge shall come,And take His servants up To their eternal homeLift up your heart, lift up your voice!Rejoice, again I say, rejoice!</verse>

data.title: Hark! Ten Thousand Harps and Voices
data.preview: <verse>Hark! ten thousand harps and voicesSound the note of
data.data: <verse>Hark! ten thousand harps and voicesSound the note of praise above;Jesuse reigns, and heaven rejoices,Jesus reigns, the God of love:See, He sits on yonder throne;Jesus rules the world alone.Alleluia! Alleluia!Alleluia! Amen.</verse><verse>King of glory, reign forever,Thine an everlasting crown;Nothing from Thy love shall severThose whom Thou hast made Thine own;Happy objects of Thy grace,Destined to behold Thy face.Alleluia! Alleluia!Alleluia! Amen.</verse><verse>Savior, hasten Thine appearing;Bring, O bring the glorious day,When, the awful summons hearing,Heaven and earth shall pass away:;Then, with golden harps we'll sing,"Glory, glory to our King!"Alleluia! Alleluia!Alleluia! Amen.</verse>

data.title: Crown Him With Many Crowns
data.preview: <verse>Crown him with many crowns,The Lamb upon His throne,H
data.data: <verse>Crown him with many crowns,The Lamb upon His throne,Hark! how the heavenly anthem drownsAll music but its own.Awake, my soul, and singOf Him who died for thee,And hail Him as thy matchless KingThrough all eternity.</verse><verse>Crown Him the Lord of love!Behold His hands and side,Those wounds, yet visible above,In beauty glorified;No angel in the skyCan fully bear that sight,But downward bend His wondering eyeAt mysteries so great.</verse><verse>Crown Him the Lord of peace!Whose power a scepter swaysFrom pole to pole, that wars may cease,And all be prayer and praise.His reign shall know no end,And round His pierced feetFair flowers of paradise extendTheir fragrance ever sweet.</verse><verse>Crown Him the Lord of years;The potentate of time,Creator of the rolling spheres,Ineffably sublime!All hail, Redeemer, hail!For Thou hast died for me;Thy praise shall never, never failThroughout eternity.</verse>

data.title: Seek Ye First the Kingdom
data.preview: <verse>Seek ye first the kingdom, 'Tis your Father's will.So
data.data: <verse>Seek ye first the kingdom, 'Tis your Father's will.So the voice of Jesus bids us follow still.Savior, we would hear Thee, Follow, find, and see;And in life's adventure Thy disciples be.</verse><verse>As for hidden treasure, Or for matchless pearl,When at last discovered, some will sell their all:So, when breaks the vision of that kingdom fair,Ours shall be its riches and its beauty rare.</verse><verse>As the silent leaven works its secret way,Or as grows the seed grain through the night and day;Lord, so be the increase, peaceable but sure,Of Thy word within us, And Thy kingdom's power.</verse><verse>As the tender seedling grows up tall and strong,And the birds of heaven to its branches throng;So shall all God's children, from the east and west,Gather to His kingdom, In its shadow rest.</verse><verse>Humblest shall be greatest, poor in spirit reign;Home shall come the childlike, born through Thee againEager hearts arrive there on the pilgrim's road,Hail! the kingdom glorious of the living God!</verse>

data.title: God Is Working His Purpose Out
data.preview: <verse>God is working His purpose outAs year suceeds to year
data.data: <verse>God is working His purpose outAs year suceeds to year;God is working His purpose out,And the time is drawing near;Nearer and nearer draws the time,The time that shall surely beWhen the earth shall be filled with the glory of GodAs the waters cover the sea.</verse><verse>From utmost east to utmost west,Where'er man's foot hath trod,By the mouth of many messengersGoes forth the voice of God;Give ear to me, ye continents,Ye isles, give ear to me,That the earth shall be filled with the glory of GodAs the waters cover the sea.</verse><verse>March we forth in the strength of GodWith the banner of Christ unfurled,That the light of the glorious gospel of truthMay shine throughout the world:Fight we the fight with sorrow and sinTo set their captives free,That the earth shall be filled with the glory of GodAs the waters cover the sea.</verse><verse>All we can do is nothing worthUnless God blesses the deed;Vainly we hope for the harvest tideTill God gives life to the seed;Yet nearer and nearer draws the time,The time that shall surely be,When the earth shall be filled with the glory of GodAs the waters cover the sea.</verse>

data.title: Lift Up Your Heads
data.preview: <verse>Lift up your heads, ye mighty gates!Behold the King o
data.data: <verse>Lift up your heads, ye mighty gates!Behold the King of glory waits;The King of kings is drawing near,The Savior of the world is here.</verse><verse>The Lord is just, a helper tried;Mercy is ever at His side;His kingly crowns is holiness,His scepter, pity in distress.</verse><verse>O blest the land, the city blest,Where Christ the Ruler is confessed!O happy hearts and happy homesTo whom this King in triumph comes!</verse><verse>Fling wide the portals of your heart;Make it a temple, set apartFrom earthly use for heaven's employ,Adorned with prayer, and love, and joy.</verse><verse>Redeemer, come; I open wideMy heart to Thee; here, Lord, abide.Let me Thy inner presence feel,Thy grace and love in me reveal.</verse>

data.title: Jesus Shall Reign
data.preview: <verse>Jesus shall reign where'er the sunDoes his successive
data.data: <verse>Jesus shall reign where'er the sunDoes his successive journeys run;His kingdom stretch from shore to shore,Till moons shall wax and wane no more.</verse><verse>People and realms of ev'ry tongueDwell on His love with sweetest song,And infant voices shall proclaimTheir early blessings on His name.</verse><verse>Blessings abound wherever He reigns;The prisoner leaps to lose his chains;The weary find eternal rest,And all who suffer want are blessed.</verse><verse>Let every creature rise and bringHonors peculiar to our King;Angels descend with songs again,And earth repeat the loud amen!</verse>

data.title: A Hymn of Glory Let Us Sing
data.preview: <verse>A hymn of glory let us sing;New hymns thro'-out the w
data.data: <verse>A hymn of glory let us sing;New hymns thro'-out the world shall ringAlleluia! Alleluia!Christ, by a road before untrod,Ascends unto the throne of God.Alleluia! Alleluia!Alleluia, alleluia, alleluia!</verse><verse>O Lord, our homeward pathway bend,That our unwearied hearts ascend.Alleluia! Alleluia!Where, seated on Your Father's throne,You reign as King of kings alone.Alleluia! Alleluia!Alleluia, alleluia, alleluia!</verse><verse>Give us Your joy on earth, O Lord,In heav'n to be our great reward.Alleluia! Alleluia!When throned with You forever, weShall praise Your name eternally.Alleluia! Alleluia!Alleluia, alleluia, alleluia!</verse><verse>O risen Christ, ascended Lord,All praise to you let earth accord:Alleluia! Alleluia!You are, while endless ages run,With Father and with Spirit one.Alleluia! Alleluia!Alleluia, alleluia, alleluia!</verse>

data.title: All Hail the Power of Jesus' Name
data.preview: <verse>All hail the power of Jesus' name! Let angels prostra
data.data: <verse>All hail the power of Jesus' name! Let angels prostrate fall;Bring forth the royal diadem, and crown Him Lord of all.Bring forth the royal diadem, and crown Him Lord of all.</verse><verse>Ye chosen seed of Israel's race, ye ransomed from the fall,Hail Him who saves you by His grace, and crown Him Lord of all.Hail Him who saves you by His grace, and crown Him Lord of all.</verse><verse>Let every kindred, every tribe on this terrestrial ballTo Him all majesty ascribe, and crown Him Lord of all.To Him all majesty ascribe, and crown Him Lord of all.</verse><verse>O that with yonder angel throng we at His feet may fall!We'll join the everlasting song, and crown Him Lord of all.We'll join the everlasting song, and crown Him Lord of all.</verse>

data.title: All Glory, Laud, and Honor
data.preview: <verse>All glory, laud, and honor,To Thee, Redeemer, King,To
data.data: <verse>All glory, laud, and honor,To Thee, Redeemer, King,To whom the lips of childrenMade sweet hosannas ring.Thou art the King of Israel,Thou David's royal Son,Who in the Lord's name comest,The King and Blessed One.</verse><verse>The company of angelsAre praising Thee on high,And we with all creationIn chorus make reply.The people of the HebrewsWith psalms before Thee went;Our prayer and praise and anthemsBefore Thee we present.</verse><verse>To thee, before Thy passion,They sang their hymns of praise;To Thee, now high exalted,Our melody we raise.Thou didst accept their praises;Accept the prayers we bring,Who in all good delightest,Thou good and gracious King.</verse>

data.title: Blest Be the King
data.preview: <verse>Blest be the King whose comingIs in the name of God!F
data.data: <verse>Blest be the King whose comingIs in the name of God!For Him let doors be opened,No hearts against Him barred!Not robed in royal splendor,In power and pomp comes He;But clad as are the poorest,Such His humility. </verse><verse>Blest be the King whose comingIs in the name of God!By those who truly listenHis voice is truly heard;Pity the proud and haughty,Who have not learned to heedThe Christ who is the promise,Who has atonement made. </verse><verse>Blest be the King whose comingIs in the name of God!He only to the humbleReveals the face of God.All power is His, all glory!All things are in His hand,All ages and all peoples,'Till time itself shall end. </verse><verse>Blest be the King whose comingIs in the name of God!He offers to the burdenedThe rest and grace they need.Gentle is He and humble!And light His Yoke shall be,For He would have us bear it,So He can made us free!</verse>

data.title: At the Name of Jesus
data.preview: <verse>At the name of Jesus every knee shall bow,Every tongu
data.data: <verse>At the name of Jesus every knee shall bow,Every tongue confess Him King of glory now;"Tis the Father's pleasure we should call Him Lord,Who from the beginning was the mighty Word.</verse><verse>At His voice creation sprang at once to sight,All the angel faces, All the hosts of light,Thrones and dominations stars upon their way,All the heavenly orders in their great array.</verse><verse>Humbled for a season, To receive a nameFrom the lips of sinners, Unto whom He came;He is God the Savior, He is Christ the Lord,Ever to be worshiped, Trusted and adored.</verse><verse>In your hearts enthrone Him: There let Him subdueAll that is not holy, All that is not true;Crown Him as your captain in temptation's hour,Let His will enfold you in its light and power.</verse><verse>Surely, this Lord Jesus shall return again,With His Father's glory, With His angel train;For all wreaths of empire meet upon His brow,And our hearts confess Him King of glory now.</verse>

data.title: Christ, Whose Glory Fills the Skies
data.preview: <verse>Christ, whose glory fills the skies, Christ, the true
data.data: <verse>Christ, whose glory fills the skies, Christ, the true, the only light, Sun of Righteousness, arise, Triumph o'er the shades of night; Dayspring from on high, be near; Daystar, in my heart appear.</verse><verse>Dark and cheerless is the morn Unaccompanied by thee; Joyless is the day's return, Till Thy mercy's beams I see; Till they inward light impart, Cheer my eyes and warm my heart.</verse><verse>Visit then this soul of mine; Pierce the gloom of sin and grief; Fill me, Radiancy divine, Scatter all my unbelief; More and more Thyself display, Shining to the perfect day.</verse>

data.title: Christ Is the World's Light
data.preview: <verse>Christ is the world's Light,He and none other; born i
data.data: <verse>Christ is the world's Light,He and none other; born in our darkness,He became our brother.If we have seen Him, we have seen the Father:Glory to God on high!</verse><verse>Christ is the world's Peace,He and none other; no one can serve HimAnd despise another.Who else unites us one in God the Father?Glory to God on high!</verse><verse>Christ is the world's Life,He and none other; sold once for silver,Murdered here, our brother,He who redeems us reigns with God the Father.</verse><verse>Give God the glory,God and none other; give God the glory,Spirit, Son, and Father; give God the glory,God in Man my brother; Glory to God on high!</verse>

data.title: Christ Is Made the Sure Foundation
data.preview: <verse>Christ is made the sure foundation,Christ, our head a
data.data: <verse>Christ is made the sure foundation,Christ, our head and cornerstone,Chosen of the Lord and precious,Binding all the Church in one;Holy Zion's help foreverAnd our confidence alone.</verse><verse>To this temple where we call You,Come, O Lord of hosts, and stay;Come, with all Your loving kindness,Hear Your people as they pray;And Your fullest benedictionShed within these walls today.</verse><verse>Grant, we pray to all Your faithfulAll the gifts they ask to gain;What they gain from You foreverWith the blessed to retain;And hereafter in Your gloryEvermore with You to reign.</verse><verse>Praise and honor to the Father,Praise and honor to the Son,Praise and honor to the Spirit,Ever three and ever one:One in might and one in gloryWhile unending ages run!</verse>

data.title: I Love Thee
data.preview: <verse>I love Thee, I love Thee, I love Thee, my Lord;I love
data.data: <verse>I love Thee, I love Thee, I love Thee, my Lord;I love Thee, my Savior, I love Thee, my God.I love Thee, I love Thee, and that Thou dost know;But how much I love Thee my actions will show.</verse><verse>I'm happy, I'm happy, O, wondrous account!My joys are immortal, I stand on the mount!I gaze on my treasure and long to be there,With Jesus and angels, and kindred so dear.</verse><verse>O Jesus, my Savior, with Thee I am blest,My life and salvation, my joy and my rest:Thy name be my theme, and Thy love be my song;Thy grace shall inspire both my heart and my tongue.</verse><verse>O, who's like my Savior? He's Salem's bright King;He smiles, and He loves me, and helps me to sing.I'll praise Him, I'll praise Him, with notes loud and clearWhile rivers of pleasure my spirit do cheer.</verse>

data.title: In the Cross of Christ I Glory
data.preview: <verse>In the cross of Christ I glory, Towering o'er the wre
data.data: <verse>In the cross of Christ I glory, Towering o'er the wrecks of time; All the light of sacred story Gathers round its head sublime. </verse><verse>When the woes of life o'ertake me, Hopes deceive, and fears annoy, Never shall the cross forsake me. Lo! it glows with peace and joy. </verse><verse>When the sun of bliss is beaming Light and love upon my way, From the cross the radiance streaming Adds more luster to the day. </verse><verse>Bane and blessing, pain and pleasure, By the cross are sanctified; Peace is there that knows no measure, Joys that through all time abide.</verse>

data.title: How Sweet the Name!
data.preview: <verse>How sweet the name of Jesus soundsIn a believer's ear
data.data: <verse>How sweet the name of Jesus soundsIn a believer's ear!It soothes his sorrows, heals his wounds,And drives away his fear.</verse><verse>It makes the wounded spirit whole,And calms the troubled breast;'Tis manna to the hungry soul,And to the weary, rest.</verse><verse>Dear name, the rock on which I build,My shield and hiding place,My neverfailing treasury, filledWith boundless stores of grace.</verse><verse>Jesus! my Shepherd, Guardian, Friend,My Prophet, Priest, and King!My Lord, my life, my way, my end!Accept the praise I bring.</verse><verse>Weak is the effort of my heart,And cold my warmest thought;But when I see Thee as Thou art,I'll praise Thee as I ought.</verse>

data.title: Jesus, Priceless Treasure
data.preview: <verse>Jesus, priceless Treasure, Source of purest pleasure,
data.data: <verse>Jesus, priceless Treasure, Source of purest pleasure, Truest Friend to me:Ah! how long I've panted, And my heart has fainted, thirsting, Lord, for Thee.Thine I am, O spotless Lamb, I will suffer naught to hide Thee,Nought I ask beside Thee.</verse><verse>In Thine arms I rest me; foes who would molest me Cannot reach me here.Though the earth be shaking, Every heart be quaking, Jesus calms our fear.Sin and hell in conflict fell, With their bitter storms assail me,Jesus will not fail me.</verse><verse>Hence, all thought of sadness! For the Lord of gladness, Jesus, enters in.Those who love the Father, Though the storms may gather, still have peace within;Yea, whatever we here must bear, Still in Thee lies purest pleasure,Jesus, priceless Treasure!</verse>

data.title: Fairest Lord Jesus
data.preview: <verse>Fairest Lord Jesus, ruler of all nature,O thou of God
data.data: <verse>Fairest Lord Jesus, ruler of all nature,O thou of God and man the Son!Thee will I cherish, Thee will I honor,Thou art my glory, joy, and crown.</verse><verse>Fair are the meadows, fairer still the woodlands,Robed in the blooming garb of spring:Jesus is fairer, Jesus is purerWho makes the woeful heart to sing.</verse><verse>Fair is the sunshine, fairer still the moonlight,And all the twinkling starry host:Jesus shines brighter, Jesus shines purerThan all the angels heaven can boast.</verse><verse>Beautiful Savior! Lord of all the nations,Son of God and Son of Man!Glory and honor, praise, adoration,Now and forevermore be thine!</verse>

data.title: Jesus, the Very Thought of Thee
data.preview: <verse>Jesus, the very thought of thee With sweetness fills
data.data: <verse>Jesus, the very thought of thee With sweetness fills the breast; But sweeter far Thy face to see, And in Thy presence rest.</verse><verse>No voice can sing, no heart can frame,Nor can the memory findA sweeter sound than Jesus' name,The Savior of mankind.</verse><verse>O hope of every contrite heart!O joy of all the meek, To those who fall, how kind Thou art! How good to those who seek!</verse><verse>But what to those who find? Ah, this Nor tongue nor pen can show; The love of Jesus, what it is, None but His loved ones know.</verse><verse>Jesus, our only joy be Thou, As Thou our prize wilt be; Jesus, be Thou our glory now, And through eternity.</verse>

data.title: Jesus, Thou Joy of Loving Hearts
data.preview: <verse>Jesus, Thou joy of loving hearts!Thou fount of life!
data.data: <verse>Jesus, Thou joy of loving hearts!Thou fount of life! Thou light of men!From the best bliss that earth imparts,We turn unfilled to Thee again.</verse><verse>Thy truth unchanged has ever stood;Thou savest those that on Thee call;To them that seek Thee Thou art good,To them that find Thee, all in all.</verse><verse>We taste Thee, O Thou living Bread,And long to feast upon Thee still;We drink of Thee, the Fountainhead,And thirst our souls from Thee to fill!</verse><verse>Our restless spirits yearn for Thee,Where-e'r our changeful lot is cast;Glad, when Thy gracious smile we see,Blest, when our faith can hold Thee fast.</verse><verse>O Jesus, ever with us stay;Make all our moments calm and bright;Chase the dark night of sin away,Shed o'r the world Thy holy light!</verse>

data.title: King of Glory, King of Peace
data.preview: <verse>King of glory, King of peace, I will love Thee;And th
data.data: <verse>King of glory, King of peace, I will love Thee;And that love may never cease, I will move Thee.Thou hast granted my request, Thou hast heard me;Thou didst note my working breast, Thou hast spared me.</verse><verse>Wherefore with my utmost art I will sing Thee,And the cream of all my heart I will bring Thee.Though my sins against me cried, Thou didst clear me;And alone, when they replied, Thou didst hear me.</verse><verse>Seven whole days, not one in seven, I will praise Thee;In my heart, though not in heav'n I can raise Thee.Small it is, in this poor sort to enroll Thee:Ev'n eternity's too short to extol Thee.</verse>

data.title: My Song Shall Be of Jesus
data.preview: <verse>My song shall be of Jesus;His mercy crowns my days,He
data.data: <verse>My song shall be of Jesus;His mercy crowns my days,He fills my cup with blessings,And tunes my heart to praise.My song shall be of Jesus,The precious Lamb of God,Who gave Himself my ransom,And bought me with His blood.</verse><verse>My song shall be of JesusWhen, sitting at His feet,I call to mind His goodnessIn meditation sweet:My song shall be of Jesus,Whatever ill betide;I'll sing the grace that saves me,And keeps me at His side.</verse><verse>My song shall be of JesusWhile pressing on my wayTo reach the blissful kingdomOf pure and perfect day:And when my soul shall enterThat realm of splendor fair,A song of praise to JesusI'll sing forever there.</verse>

data.title: More About Jesus
data.preview: <verse>More about Jesus, I would know,More of His grace to o
data.data: <verse>More about Jesus, I would know,More of His grace to others show;More of His saving fullness see,More of His love who died for me.</verse><chorus>More, more about Jesus,More, more about Jesus;More of His saving fullness see,More of His love who died for me.</chorus><verse>More about Jesus, let me learn,More of His holy will discern;Spirit of God, my teacher be,Showing the things of Christ to me.</verse><verse>More about Jesus, in His word,Holding communion with my Lord;Hearing His voice in every line,Making each faithful saying mine.</verse><verse>More about Jesus, on His throne,Riches in glory all His own;More of His kingdom's sure increase,More of His coming, Prince of Peace.</verse>

data.title: Worthy, Worthy Is the Lamb
data.preview: <verse>Worthy, worthy is the Lamb,Worthy, worthy is the Lamb
data.data: <verse>Worthy, worthy is the Lamb,Worthy, worthy is the Lamb,Worthy, worthy is the Lamb,That was slain.</verse><chorus>Glory, hallelujah!Praise Him, hallelujah!Glory, hallelujah!To the Lamb!</chorus><verse>Savior, let Thy kingdom come!Now the power of sin consume;Bring Thy blessed millennium,Holy Lamb.</verse><verse>Thus may we each moment feel,Love Him, serve Him, praise Him still,Till we all on Zion's hillSee the Lamb.</verse>

data.title: Come, My Way
data.preview: <verse>There is a name I love to hear,I love to sing its wor
data.data: <verse>There is a name I love to hear,I love to sing its worth;It sounds like music in my ear,The sweetest name on earth.</verse><chorus>O, how I love Jesus,O, how I love Jesus,O, how I love Jesus-Because He first loved me!</chorus><verse>It tells me of a Savior's love,Who died to set me free;It tells me of His precious blood,The sinner's perfect plea.</verse><verse>It tells of One whose loving heartCan feel my deepest woe,Who in each sorrow bears a partThat none can bear below.</verse>

data.title: O, How I Love Jesus
data.preview: <verse>There is a Name I love to hear,I love to sing its wor
data.data: <verse>There is a Name I love to hear,I love to sing its worth;It sounds like music in my ears,The sweetest Name on earth.</verse><chorus>O how I love Jesus,O how I love Jesus,O how I love Jesus,Because He first loved me.</chorus><verse>It tells me of a Savior's love,Who died to set me free;It tells me of a Savior's blood,The sinners' perfect plea.</verse><verse>It tells of one whose loving heartCan feel my deepest woe;Who in each sorrow bears a part That none can bear below.</verse>

data.title: Praise Him! Praise Him!
data.preview: <verse>Praise Him! praise Him! Jesus, our blessed Redeemer!S
data.data: <verse>Praise Him! praise Him! Jesus, our blessed Redeemer!Sing, O Earth, His wonderful love proclaim!Hail Him! hail Him! highest archangels in glory;Strength and honor give to His holy Name!Like a shepherd, Jesus will guard His children,In His arms He carries them all day long:</verse><chorus>Praise Him! Praise Him! Tell of His excellent greatness.Praise Him! Praise Him! Ever in joyful song!</chorus><verse>Praise Him! Praise Him! Jesus, our blessed Redeemer!For our sins He suffered, and bled, and died.He our Rock, our hope of eternal salvation,Hail Him! hail Him! Jesus the Crucified.Sound His praises! Jesus who bore our sorrows,Love unbounded, wonderful, deep and strong.</verse><verse>Praise Him! Praise Him! Jesus, our blessed Redeemer!Heavenly portals loud with hosannas ring!Jesus, Savior, reigneth forever and ever.Crown Him! Crown Him! Prophet, and Priest, and King!Christ is coming! over the world victorious,Power and glory unto the Lord belong.</verse>

data.title: O for a Thousand Tongues to Sing
data.preview: <verse>O for a thousand tongues to singMy great Redeemer's p
data.data: <verse>O for a thousand tongues to singMy great Redeemer's praise,The glories of my God and King,The triumphs of His grace!</verse><verse>My gracious Master and my God,Assist me to proclaim,To spread through all the earth abroadThe honors of Thy name.</verse><verse>Jesus! the name that charms our fears,That bids our sorrows cease;'Tis music in the sinner's ears,'Tis life, and health, and peace.</verse><verse>He breaks the power of canceled sin,He sets the prisoner free;His blood can make the foulest clean;His blood availed for me.</verse><verse>He speaks, and listening to His voice,New life the dead receive;The mournful, broken hearts rejoice,The humble poor believe.</verse><verse>Hear him, ye deaf; His praise, ye dumb,Your loosened tongues employ;Ye blind, behold your savior come,And leap, ye lame, for joy.</verse>

data.title: He Lives
data.preview: <verse>I serve a risen Savior,He's in the world today;I know
data.data: <verse>I serve a risen Savior,He's in the world today;I know that He is living,Whatever men may say;I see His hand of mercy,I hear His voice of cheerAnd just the timeI need Him He's always near.</verse><chorus>He lives, He lives,Christ Jesus lives today!He walks with meAnd talks with meAlong life's narrow way.He lives, He lives,Salvation to impart!You ask me how I know He lives?He lives within my heart.</chorus><verse>In all the world around meI see His loving care,And tho' my heart grows wearyI never will despair;I know that He is leadingThru all the stormy blast,The day of His appearingWill come at last.</verse><verse>Rejoice, rejoice, O Christian,Lift up your voice and sing,Eternal hallelujahsTo Jesus Christ the King!The hope of all who seek Him,The help of all who find,None other is so loving,So good and kind.</verse>

data.title: Come, Let Us Sing
data.preview: <verse>Come, let us sing the song of songs-The angels first
data.data: <verse>Come, let us sing the song of songs-The angels first began the strain-The homage which to Christ belongs:"Worthy the Lamb, for He was slain!"</verse><verse>Slain to redeem us by His blood,To cleanse from every sinful stain,And make us kings and priests to God:"Worthy the Lamb, for He was slain!"</verse><verse>To Him who suffered on the tree,Our souls, at His soul's price, to gain,Blessing, and praise, and glory be:"Worthy the Lamb, for He was slain!"</verse><verse>To Him, enthroned by filial rightAll power in heaven and earth proclaim,Honor, and majesty, and might:"Worthy the Lamb, for He was slain!"</verse><verse>Long as we live, and when we die,And while in heaven with Him we reign,This song our song of songs shall be:"Worthy the Lamb, for He was slain!"</verse>

data.title: There's No Other Name Like Jesus
data.preview: <verse>There's no other name like Jesus,'Tis the dearest nam
data.data: <verse>There's no other name like Jesus,'Tis the dearest name we know,'Tis the angel's joy in heaven,'Tis the Christian's joy below.</verse><chorus>Sweet name, (sweet name) dear name, (dear name)There's no other name like Jesus;Sweet name, (sweet name) dear name, (dear name)There's no other name like Jesus.</chorus><verse>There's no other name like JesusWhen the heart with grief is sad,There's no other name like JesusWhen the heart is free and glad.</verse><verse>'Tis the hope that I shall see HimWhen in glory He appears,'Tis the hope to hear His welcomeThat my fainting spirit cheers.</verse><verse>If He wills that I should laborIn His vineyard day by day,Then 'tis well if only JesusBlesses all I do or say.</verse><verse>If He wills that death's cold fingerTouch my feeble, mortal clay,Then 'tis well if only JesusIs my dying trust and stay.</verse>

data.title: The Great Physician Now is Near
data.preview: <verse>The great Physician now is near,The sympathizing Jesu
data.data: <verse>The great Physician now is near,The sympathizing Jesus;He speaks the drooping heart to cheer,Oh! hear the voice of Jesus.</verse><chorus>Sweetest note in seraph song,Sweetest name on mortal tongue;Sweetest carol ever sung,Jesus, blessed Jesus.</chorus><verse>All glory to the dying Lamb!I now believe in Jesus;I love the blessed Savior's name,I love the name of Jesus.</verse><verse>His name dispels my guilt and fear,No other name but Jesus;Oh! how my soul delights to hearThe precious name of Jesus.</verse><verse>And when He comes to bring the crown- The crown of life and glory- Then by His side we will sit down And tell redemption's story </verse>

data.title: I Cannot Tell Why
data.preview: <verse>I cannot tell why He whom angels worshipShould set Hi
data.data: <verse>I cannot tell why He whom angels worshipShould set His love upon the souls of men,Or why as Shepherd He should seek the wanderers,To bring them back, they know not how nor when.But this I know that He was born of MaryWhen Bethlehem's manger was His only home,And that He lived at Nazareth and labored;And so the Savior, Savior of the world, has come.</verse><verse>I cannot tell how silently He sufferedAs with His peace He graced this place of tears,Nor how His heart upon the cross was broken,The crown of pain to three and thirty years.But this I know He heals the broken heartedAnd stays our sin and calms our lurking fear,And lifts the burden from the heavy laden;For still the Savior, Savior of the world, is here.</verse><verse>I cannot tell how He will win the nations,How He will claim His earthly heritage,How satisfy the needs and aspirationsOf east and west, of sinner and of sage.But this I know all flesh shall see His glory,And He shall reap the harvest He has sown,And some glad day His sun will shine in splendorWhen He the Savior, Savior of the world, is known.</verse><verse>I cannot tell how all the lands shall worship,When at His bidding every storm is stilled,Or who can say how great the jubilationWhen all our hearts with love for Him are filled.But this I know the skies shall sound His praises,Ten thousand thousand human voices sing,And earth to heaven, and heaven to earth will answer,At last the Savior, Savior of the world, is King!</verse>

data.title: Ye Servants of God
data.preview: <verse>Ye servants of God, your Master proclaim, And publish
data.data: <verse>Ye servants of God, your Master proclaim, And publish abroad His wonderful name; The name all-victorious of Jesus extol, His kingdom is glorious and rules over all. </verse><verse>God ruleth on high, almighty to save, And still He is nigh, His presence we have; The great congregation His triumph shall sing, Ascribing salvation to Jesus, our King.</verse><verse>"Salvation to God, who sits on the throne!" Let all cry aloud and honor the Son; The praises of Jesus the angels proclaim, Fall down on their faces and worship the Lamb.</verse><verse>Then let us adore and give him His right, All glory and power, all wisdom and might; All honor and blessing with angels above, And thanks never ceasing and infinite love.</verse>

data.title: Come Down, O Love Divine
data.preview: <verse>Come down, O Love divine, seek Thou this soul of mine
data.data: <verse>Come down, O Love divine, seek Thou this soul of mineAnd visit it with Thine own ardor glowing;O Comforter, draw near, within my heart appear,And kindle it, Thy holy flame bestowing.</verse><verse>O let it freely burn, till earthly passions turnTo dust and ashes in its heat consuming;And let Thy glorious light shine ever on my sight,And clothe me round, the while my path illuming.</verse><verse>Let holy charity Mine outward vesture be,And lowliness become my inner clothing;True lowliness of heart which takes the humbler part,And o'er its own shortcomings weeps with loathing.</verse><verse>And so the yearning strong with which the soul will longShall far outpass the power of human telling;For none can guess its grace, till Love create a placeWherein the Holy Spirit makes a dwelling.</verse>

data.title: Baptize Us Anew
data.preview: <verse>Baptize us anew With power from on high,With love, O
data.data: <verse>Baptize us anew With power from on high,With love, O refresh us! Dear Savior, draw nigh.</verse><chorus>We humbly beseech Thee, Lord Jesus, we pray,With love and the Spirit Baptize us today.We praise Thee, we bless Thee, dear Lamb that was slainWe laud and adore Thee, Amen and Amen.</chorus><verse>Unworthy we cry,  Unholy, unclean,O wash us and cleanse us  From sin's guilty stain.</verse><verse>O heavenly Dove,  Descend from on high!We plead Thy rich blessing;  In mercy draw nigh.</verse><verse>O list the glad voice!  From heaven it came:Thou art My beloved,  Well pleased I am.</verse>

data.title: Draw Us in the Spirit's Tether
data.preview: <verse>Draw us in the Spirit's tether,For when humbly in Thy
data.data: <verse>Draw us in the Spirit's tether,For when humbly in Thy name,Two or three are met together,Thou art in the midst of them;Alleluia! Alleluia!Touch we now Thy garment's hem.</verse><verse>As the brethren used to gatherIn the name of Christ to sup,Then with thanks to God the FatherBreak the bread and bless the cup,Alleluia! Alleluia!So knit Thou our friendship up</verse><verse>All our meals and all our livingMake us sacraments of Thee,That by caring, helping, giving,We may true disciples be.Alleluia! Alleluia!We will serve Thee faithfully.</verse>

data.title: Hover O'er Me, Holy Spirit
data.preview: <verse>Hover o'er me, Holy Spirit,Bathe my trembling heart a
data.data: <verse>Hover o'er me, Holy Spirit,Bathe my trembling heart and brow;Fill me with Thy hallowed presence,Come, O come and fill me now.</verse><chorus>Fill me now, fill me now,Jesus, come and fill me now.Fill me with Thy hallowed presence,Come, O come and fill me now.</chorus><verse>Thou canst fill me, gracious Spirit,Though I cannot tell Thee how;But I need Thee, greatly need Thee;Come, O come and fill me now.</verse><verse>I am weakness, full of weakness;At Thy sacred feet I bow;Blest, divine, eternal Spirit,Fill with love, and fill me now.</verse><verse>Cleanse and comfort, bless and save me;Bathe, O, bathe my heart and brow;Thou art comforting and saving,Thou art sweetly filling now.</verse>

data.title: The Spirit of the Lord Revealed
data.preview: <verse>The Spirit of the Lord revealedHis will to saints of
data.data: <verse>The Spirit of the Lord revealedHis will to saints of old;Their heart and mind lips unsealedHis glory to unfold.Amid the gloom of ancient nightThey hailed the dawning Word,And in the coming of the lightProclaimed the coming Lord.</verse><verse>The prophets passed; at length there cameTo sojourn and abide,The Word incarnate, to whose nameThe prophets testified;And He, the twilight overpast,Himself, the Light of light,As man with man, revealed at lastThe Father to our sight.</verse><verse>Eternal Spirit, who dost speakTo mind and conscience still,That we in this our day, may seekTo do our Father's will,To us the word of life impart,Of Christ, the living way;Give us the quiet, humble heartTo hear and to obey.</verse>

data.title: Sweet, Sweet Spirit
data.preview: </verse><verse>There's a sweet, sweet spirit in this place,
data.data: </verse><verse>There's a sweet, sweet spirit in this place,And I know that it's the spirit of the Lord;</verse><chorus>Sweet Holy Spirit, Sweet Heavenly Dove,Stay right here with us Filling us with Your love,And for these blessings we lift our hearts in praise,Without a doubt we'll know that we have been revivedWhen we shall leave this place.</chorus><verse>There are sweet expressions on each faceAnd I know they feel the presence of the Lord.</verse>

data.title: Fire of God, Thou Sacred Flame
data.preview: <verse>Fire of God, Thou sacred flame,Spirit who in splendor
data.data: <verse>Fire of God, Thou sacred flame,Spirit who in splendor came,Let Thy heat my soul refineTill it glows with love divine.</verse><verse>Breath of God, that swept in powerIn the pentecostal hour,Holy Breath, be Thou in meSource of vital energy.</verse><verse>Strength of God, Thy might withinConquers sorrow, pain, and sin:Fortify from evil's artAll the gateways of my heart.</verse><verse>Truth of God, Thy piercing raysPenetrate my secret ways.May the light that shames my sinGuide me holier paths to win.</verse><verse>Love of God, Thy grace profoundKnoweth neither age nor bound:Come, my heart's own guest to be,Dwell forevermore in me.</verse>

data.title: O for That Flame of Living Fire
data.preview: <verse>O for that flame of living fireWhich shone so bright
data.data: <verse>O for that flame of living fireWhich shone so bright in saints of old;Which bade their souls to heaven aspire,Calm in distress, in danger bold!</verse><verse>Where is that spirit, Lord, which dweltIn Abram's breast, and sealed Him Thine?Which made Paul's heart with sorrow melt,And glow with energy divine?</verse><verse>That spirit which from age to ageProclaimed Thy love, and taught Thy ways?Brightened Isaiah's vivid page,And breathed in David's hallowed lays?</verse><verse>Is not Thy grace as mighty nowAs when Elijah felt its power?When glory beamed from Moses' brow,Or Job endured the trying hour?</verse><verse>Remember, Lord, the ancient days;Renew Thy work, Thy grace restore;And while to Thee our hearts we raise,On us Thy Holy Spirit pour.</verse>

data.title: Breathe on Me, Breath of God
data.preview: <verse>Breathe on me, breath of God,Fill me with life anew,T
data.data: <verse>Breathe on me, breath of God,Fill me with life anew,That I may love what Thou dost love,And do what Thou wouldst do.</verse><verse>Breathe on me, breath of God,Until my heart is pure,Until with Thee I will one will,To do and to endure.</verse><verse>Breathe on me, breath of God,Till I am wholly Thine,Until this earthly part of meGlows with Thy fire divine.</verse><verse>Breathe on me, breath of God,So shall I constant be,And live with Thee the perfect lifeOf Thine eternity.</verse>

data.title: Spirit of God
data.preview: <verse>Spirit of God, descend upon my heart;Wean it from ear
data.data: <verse>Spirit of God, descend upon my heart;Wean it from earth; through all its pulses move;Stoop to my weakness, mighty as Thou art,And make me love Thee as I ought to love.</verse><verse>I ask no dream, no prophet ecstasies,No sudden rending of the veil of clay,No angel visitant, no opening skies;But take the dimness of my soul away.</verse><verse>Has thou not bid me love Thee, God and King?All, all Thine own, soul, heart and strength and mind.I see Thy cross; there teach my heart to cling.O let me seek thee, and O let me find.</verse><verse>Teach me to feel that Thou art always nigh;Teach me the struggles of the soul to bear.To check the rising doubt, the rebel sigh,Teach me the patience of unanswered prayer.</verse><verse>Teach me to love thee as Thine angels love,One holy passion filling all my frame;The kindling of the heaven-descended Dove,My heart an altar, and Thy love the flame.</verse>

data.title: Spirit Divine
data.preview: <verse>Spirit divine, attend our prayers,And make this house
data.data: <verse>Spirit divine, attend our prayers,And make this house Thy home;Descend with all Thy gracious powers,O come, great Spirit, come!</verse><verse>Come as the light; to us revealOur emptiness and woe,And lead us in those paths of lifeWhere-on the righteous go.</verse><verse>Come as the fire, and purge our heartsLike sacrificial flame;Let our whole soul an off'ring beTo our Redeemer's name.</verse><verse>Come as the dove, and spread Thy wings,The wings of peaceful love;And let Thy church on earth becomeBlest as the church above.</verse><verse>Spirit divine, attend our prayers,Make a lost world Thy home;Descend with all Thy gracious powers,O come, great Spirit, come!</verse>

data.title: Holy Spirit, Light Divine
data.preview: <verse>Holy Spirit, light divine,Shine upon this heart of mi
data.data: <verse>Holy Spirit, light divine,Shine upon this heart of mine,Chase the shades of night away,Turn my darkness into day.</verse><verse>Holy Spirit, power divine,Cleanse this guilty heart of mine;Long has sin, without control,Held dominion o'er my soul.</verse><verse>Holy Ghost, with joy divine,Cheer this saddened heart of mine,Bid my many woes depart,Heal my wounded, bleeding heart.</verse><verse>Holy Spirit, all divine,Dwell within this heart of mine,Cast down every idol throne,Reign supreme, and reign alone.</verse>

data.title: Come, Holy Spirit
data.preview: <verse>Come, Holy Spirit, heavenly Dove,With all Thy quicken
data.data: <verse>Come, Holy Spirit, heavenly Dove,With all Thy quickening powers;Kindle a flame of sacred loveIn these cold hearts of ours.</verse><verse>O raise our thoughts from things below,From vanities and toys!Then shall we with fresh courage goTo reach eternal joys.</verse><verse>Awake our souls to joyful songs;Let pure devotions rise;Till praise employs our thankful tongues,And doubt forever dies.</verse><verse>Father, we would no longer liveAt this poor, dying rate;To Thee our thankful love we give,For Thine to us is great.</verse><verse>Come, Holy Spirit, heavenly Dove,With all Thy quickening powers;Come, shed abroad a Savior's love,And that shall kindle ours.</verse>

data.title: O Holy Dove of God Descending
data.preview: <verse>O holy Dove of God descending,You are the love that k
data.data: <verse>O holy Dove of God descending,You are the love that knows no ending.All of our shattered dreams You're mending:Spirit, now live in me.</verse><verse>O holy Wind of God now blowing,You are the seed that God is sowing.You are the life that starts us growing:Spirit, now live in me.</verse><verse>O holy Rain of God now falling,You make the Word of God enthralling,You are that inner voice now calling:Spirit, now live in me.</verse><verse>O holy Flame of God now burning,You are the power of Christ returning.You are the answer to our yearning:Spirit, now live in me.</verse>

data.title: Break Thou the Bread of Life
data.preview: <verse>Break Thou the bread of life, dear Lord, to me,As Tho
data.data: <verse>Break Thou the bread of life, dear Lord, to me,As Thou didst break the loaves beside the sea;Beyond the sacred page I seek Thee, Lord;My spirit pants for Thee, O Living Word!</verse><verse>Bless Thou the truth, dear Lord, to me, to me,As Thou didst bless the bread by Galilee;Then shall all bondage cease, all fetters fall;And I shall find my peace, my all in all.</verse><verse>Thou art the bread of life, O Lord, to me;Thy holy Word the truth That saveth me;Give me to eat and live With Thee above;Teach me to love Thy truth, For Thou art love.</verse><verse>Spirit and life are they, Words Thou dost speak;I hasten to obey, But I am weak;Thou art my only help, Thou art my life;Heeding Thy holy Word I win the strife.</verse>

data.title: Give Me the Bible
data.preview: <verse>Give me the Bible,Star of gladness gleaming,To cheer
data.data: <verse>Give me the Bible,Star of gladness gleaming,To cheer the wandererLone and tempest tossed,No storm can hide thatPeaceful radiance beamingSince Jesus cameTo seek and save the lost.</verse><chorus>Give me the Bible--Holy message shining,Thy light shall guide meIn the narrow way.Precept and promise,Law and love combining,'Til night shall vanishIn eternal day.</chorus><verse>Give me the BibleWhen my heart is broken,When sin and grief haveFilled my soul with fear,Give me the preciousWords by Jesus spoken,Hold up faith's lampTo show my Savior near.</verse><verse>Give me the Bible,All my steps enlighten,Teach me the dangerOf these realms below,That lamp of safety,O'er the gloom shall brighten,That light aloneThe path of peace can show.</verse>

data.title: Lord, I Have Made Thy Word My Choice
data.preview: <verse>Lord, I have made Thy word my choice,My lasting herit
data.data: <verse>Lord, I have made Thy word my choice,My lasting heritage;There shall my noblest powers rejoice,My warmest thoughts engage.</verse><verse>I'll read the histories of Thy love,And keep Thy laws in sight;While through Thy promises I rove,With ever fresh delight.</verse><verse>In this broad land of wealth unknown,Where springs of life arise,Seeds of immortal bliss are sown,And hidden glory lies.</verse><verse>The best relief that mourners have,It makes our sorrows blest;Our fairest hope beyond the grave,And our eternal rest.</verse>

data.title: O Word of God Incarnate
data.preview: <verse>O Word of God incarnate, O Wisdom from on high, O Tru
data.data: <verse>O Word of God incarnate, O Wisdom from on high, O Truth unchanged, unchanging, O Light of our dark sky: We praise you for the radiance That from the hallowed page, A lantern to our footsteps, Shines on from age to age. </verse><verse>The church from her dear Master Received the gift divine, And still that light is lifted O'er all the earth to shine. It is the sacred vessel Where gems of truth are stored; It is the heaven-drawn picture Of Christ, the living Word. </verse><verse>It floateth like a banner Before God's host unfurled; It is a shining beaconAbove the darkling world. It is the chart and compass That o'er life's surging tide, Mid mists and rocks and quicksands, Still guides, O Christ, to Thee. </verse><verse>O make Thy church, dear Savior, A lamp of purest gold, To bear before the nations Your true light as of old. O teach your wandering pilgrims By this their path to trace, Till, clouds and darkness ended, They see Thee face to face.</verse>

data.title: O God of Light
data.preview: <verse>O God of light, Your Word, a lamp unfailing,Shall pie
data.data: <verse>O God of light, Your Word, a lamp unfailing,Shall pierce the darkness of our earthbound wayAnd show your grace, Your plan for us unveiling,And guide our footsteps to the perfect day.</verse><verse>From days of old,through blind and willful ages,Though we rebelled, You gently sought again,And spoke through saints, apostles, prophets, sages,Who wrote with eager or reluctant pen.</verse><verse>Undimmed by time, those words are still revealingTo sinful hearts Your justice and Your grace;And questing mortals longing for Your healing,See Your compassion in the Savior's face.</verse><verse>To all the world Your summons You are sending,Through all the earth, to every land and race,That myriad tongues, in one great anthem blending,May praise and celebrate Your gift of grace.</verse>

data.title: Thanks to God
data.preview: <verse>Thanks to God whose Word was spokenIn the deed that m
data.data: <verse>Thanks to God whose Word was spokenIn the deed that made the earth.His the voice that called a nation;His the fires that tried her worth.God has spoken;Praise Him for His open Word.</verse><verse>Thanks to God whose Word incarnateGlorified the flesh of man.Deeds and words and death and risingTell the grace in heaven's plan.God has spoken;Praise Him for His open Word.</verse><verse>Thanks to God whose Word is answeredBy the Spirit's voice wihin.Here we drink of joy unmeasured,Life redeemed from death and sin.God is speaking;Praise Him for His open Word.</verse>

data.title: For Your Holy Book We Thank You
data.preview: <verse>For Your holy book we thank You,And for all who serve
data.data: <verse>For Your holy book we thank You,And for all who served You well,Writing, guarding, and translating,That its pages might forth tellYour strong love and tender careFor Your people everywhere.</verse><verse>For Your holy book we thank You,And for those who work today,That the people of all nations,Reading it and following mayKnow Your love and tender careFor Your people everywhere.</verse><verse>For Your holy book we thank You,May its message be our guide,May we understand the wisdomOf the laws it will provide:And Your love and tender careFor Your people everywhere.</verse><verse>For Your holy book we thank You,May its message in our heartsLead us now to see in JesusAll the grace Your word imparts:All Your love and tender careFor Your people everywhere.</verse>

data.title: Lord Jesus, Once You Spoke to Men
data.preview: <verse>Lord Jesus, once You spoke to menUpon the mountain an
data.data: <verse>Lord Jesus, once You spoke to menUpon the mountain and the plain,O help us listen now as thenAnd wonder at Your words again.</verse><verse>We all have secret fears to face,Our minds and motives to amend.We seek Your truth, we need Your grace,Our living Lord and present friend.</verse><verse>The gospel speaks; and we receiveYour light, Your love, Your own command.O help us live what we believe,In daily word of heart and hand.</verse>

data.title: Only Trust Him
data.preview: <verse>Come, every soul by sin oppressed,There's mercy with
data.data: <verse>Come, every soul by sin oppressed,There's mercy with the Lord,And He will surely give you rest,By trusting in His word.</verse><chorus>Only trust Him, only trust Him,Only trust Him now;He will save you, He will save you,He will save you now.</chorus><verse>For Jesus shed His precious bloodRich blessings to bestow;Plunge now into the crimson floodThat washes white as snow.</verse><verse>Yes, Jesus is the truth, the way,That leads you into rest;Believe in Him without delay,And you are fully blest.</verse><verse>Come, then, and join this holy band, And on to glory go,To dwell in that celestial land,Where joys immortal flow.</verse>

data.title: Come, Ye Sinners
data.preview: <verse>Come, ye sinners poor and needy,Weak and wounded, sic
data.data: <verse>Come, ye sinners poor and needy,Weak and wounded, sick and sore;Jesus ready stands to save you,Full of pity, love, and power.</verse><chorus>I will arise and go to Jesus,He will embrace me in His arms;In the arms of my dear Savior,O there are ten thousand charms.</chorus><verse>Come. ye thirsty, come, and welcome,God's free bounty glorify;True belief and true repentance,Every grace that brings you nigh.</verse><verse>Let not conscience make you linger,Nor of fitness fondly dream;All the fitness He requirethIs to feel your need of Him.</verse><verse>Lo! th' incarnate God, ascended,Pleads the merit of His blood;Venture on Him, venture wholly,Let no other trust intrude.</verse>

data.title: I Gave My Life for Thee
data.preview: <verse>I gave my life for thee,My precious blood I shed,That
data.data: <verse>I gave my life for thee,My precious blood I shed,That thou might'st ransom be,And quickened from the dead;I gave, I gave My life for thee,What hast thou given for Me?I gave, I gave My life for thee,What hast thou given for Me?</verse><verse>My Fathers house of light,My glory circled throne,I left for earthly night,For wanderings sad and lone;I left, I left it all for thee,Hast thou left aught for Me? I left, I left it all for thee,Hast thou left aught for Me? </verse><verse>I suffered much for thee,More than thy tongue can tell,Of bitterest agony,To rescue thee from hell;I've borne, I've borne it all for thee,What hast thou borne for Me?I've borne, I've borne it all for thee,What hast thou borne for Me?</verse>

data.title: I Hear Thy Welcome Voice
data.preview: <verse>I hear Thy welcome voice,That calls me, Lord, to Thee
data.data: <verse>I hear Thy welcome voice,That calls me, Lord, to Thee;For cleansing in Thy precious blood,That flowed on Calvary.</verse><chorus>I am coming, Lord!Coming now to Thee!Wash me, cleanse me, in the bloodThat flowed on Calvary.</chorus><verse>Though coming weak and vile,Thou dost my strength assure;Thou dost my vileness fully cleanse,Till spotless all, and pure.</verse><verse>'Tis Jesus calls me onTo perfect faith and love,To perfect hope, and peace, and trust,For earth and heaven above.</verse><verse>All hail, atoning blood!All hail, redeeming grace!All hail! the gift of Christ, our Lord,Our Strength and Righteousness.</verse>

data.title: O Jesus, Thou Art Standing
data.preview: <verse>O Jesus, Thou art standing,Outside the fast closed do
data.data: <verse>O Jesus, Thou art standing,Outside the fast closed door,In lowly patience waitingTo pass the threshold o'er:O shame, professing Christians,His Name and sign who bear,O shame, thrice shame upon us,To keep Him standing there!</verse><verse>O Jesus, Thou art knocking;And lo, that hand is scarred,And thorns Thy brow encircle,And tears Thy face have marred:O love that passeth knowledge,So patiently to wait!O sin that hath no equal,So fast to bar the gate!</verse><verse>O Jesus, Thou art pleadingIn accents meek and low,"I died for you, My children,And will you treat Me so?"O Lord, with shame and sorrowWe open now the door;Sear Savior, enter, enter,And leave us never more.</verse>

data.title: For You I Am Praying
data.preview: <verse>I have a Savior, He's pleading in glory,A dear, lovin
data.data: <verse>I have a Savior, He's pleading in glory,A dear, loving Savior, though earth friends be few;And now He is watching in tenderness o'er me,But oh that my Savior were your Savior, too.</verse><chorus>For you I am praying, For you I am Praying,For you am I praying, I'm praying for you.</chorus><verse>I have a Father; to me He has givenA hope for eternity, blessed and true;And soon He will call to meet Him in heaven,But oh that He'd let me bring you with me, too!</verse><verse>I have a robe; 'tis resplendent in whiteness,Awaiting in glory my wondering view;Oh, when I receive it, all shining in brightness,Dear friend, could I see you receiving one, too!</verse><verse>When Jesus has found you, tell others the story,That my loving Savior is your Savior, too;Then pray that your Savior will bring them to glory,And prayer will be answered-'twas answered for you! </verse>

data.title: Jesus Calls Us
data.preview: <verse>Jesus calls us o'er the tumultOf our life's wild, res
data.data: <verse>Jesus calls us o'er the tumultOf our life's wild, restless sea;Day by day His sweet voice soundeth,Saying, "Christian, follow me!"</verse><verse>Jesus calls us from the worshipOf the vain world's golden store,From each idol that would keep us,Saying, "Christian, love me more!"</verse><verse>In our joys and in our sorrows,Days of toil and hours of ease,Still He calls, in cares and pleasures,"Christian, love me more than these!"</verse><verse>Jesus calls us! By Thy mercies,Savior, may we hear Thy call,Give our hearts to Thine obedience,Serve and love Thee best of all.</verse>

data.title: Wonderful Words of Life
data.preview: <verse>Sing them over again to me,Wonderful words of life,Le
data.data: <verse>Sing them over again to me,Wonderful words of life,Let me more of their beauty see,Wonderful words of life;Words of life and beautyTeach me faith and duty.</verse><chorus>Beautiful words, wonderful words,Wonderful words of life,Beautiful words, wonderful words,Wonderful words of life.</chorus><verse>Christ, the bless'd One, gives to allWonderful words of life;Sinner, list to the loving call,Wonderful words of life;All so freely given,Wooing us to heaven.</verse><verse>Sweetly echo the Gospel call,Wonderful words of life;Offer pardon and peace to all,Wonderful words of life;Jesus, only Savior,Sanctify forever.</verse>

data.title: Softly and Tenderly
data.preview: <verse>Softly and tenderly Jesus is calling, Calling for you
data.data: <verse>Softly and tenderly Jesus is calling, Calling for you and for me; See, on the portals He's waiting and watching, Watching for you and for me. </verse><chorus>Come home, come home; Ye who are weary come home; Earnestly, tenderly, Jesus is calling, Calling, O sinner, come home! </chorus><verse>Why should we tary when Jesus is pleading, Pleading for you and for me? Why should we linger and heed not His mercies, Mercies for you and for me? </verse><verse>Think of the wonderful love He has promised, Promised for you and for me! Though we have sinned, He has mercy and pardon, Pardon for you and for me. </verse>

data.title: I Am Going to Calvary
data.preview: <verse>I am going to Calvary.Would you like to come with MeA
data.data: <verse>I am going to Calvary.Would you like to come with MeAll the way and back again?You must follow the Leader then.You must follow the Leader,You must follow the Leader,All the way and back again,You must follow the Leader.</verse><verse>If I wear a thorny crown,If the soldiers knock Me downCan I really be a king?Love will answer everythingIf you follow the Leader,If you follow the Leader,Love will answer everythingIf you follow the Leader.</verse><verse>When I go along the road,I shall lift a heavy load.I will carry a cross for you.You will learn to carry it tooWhen you follow the Leader,When you follow the Leader,You will learn to carry it tooIf you follow the Leader.</verse><verse>I am going to stretch My hands,Reaching out to all the lands.Can I really be a king?Love's the Lord of everything,When you follow the Leader,When you follow the Leader,Love's the Lord of everythingWhen you follow the Leader.</verse>

data.title: The Savior Is Waiting
data.preview: <verse>The Savior is waiting to enter your heartWhy don't yo
data.data: <verse>The Savior is waiting to enter your heartWhy don't you let Him come in?There's nothing in this world to keep you apartWhat is your answer to Him?</verse><chorus>Time after timeHe has waited beforeAnd now He is waiting againTo see if you are willingTo open the doorOh, how He wants to come in.</chorus><verse>If you'll take one stepToward the Savior, my friend,You'll find His arms open wide.Receive Him, and all of your darkness will endWithin your heart He'll abide.</verse>

data.title: Turn Your Eyes Upon Jesus
data.preview: <verse>O soul, are you weary and troubled?No light in the da
data.data: <verse>O soul, are you weary and troubled?No light in the darkness you see?There's light for a look at the Savior,And life more abundant and free!</verse><chorus>Turn your eyes upon Jesus,Look full in His wonderful face,And the things of earth will grow strangely dim,In the light of His glory and grace.</chorus><verse>Through death into life everlastingHe passed, and we follow Him there;Over us sin no more hath dominion--For more than conquerors we are!</verse><verse>His Word shall not fail you--He promised;Believe Him, and all will be well:Then go to a world that is dying,His perfect salvation to tell!</verse>

data.title: We Have Not Known Thee
data.preview: <verse>We have not known Thee as we ought,Nor learned Thy wi
data.data: <verse>We have not known Thee as we ought,Nor learned Thy wisdom, grace, and power;The things of earth have filed our thoughts,And trifles of the passing hour.Lord, give us light Thy truth to see,And make us wise in knowing Thee.</verse><verse>We have not feared Thee as we ought,Nor bowed beneath Thine awful eye,Nor guarded deed, and word, and thought,Remembering that God was nigh.Lord, give us faith to know Thee near,And grant the grace of holy fear.</verse><verse>We have not loved Thee as we ought,Nor cared that we are loved by Thee;Thy presence we have coldly sought,And feebly longed Thy face to see.Lord, give a pure and loving heartTo feel and own the love Thou art.</verse><verse>We have not served Thee as we ought;Alas! the duties left undone,The work with little fervor wrought,The battles lost, or scarcely won!Lord, give the zeal, and give the might,For Thee to toil, for Thee to fight.</verse><verse>When shall we know Thee as we ought,And fear, and love, and serve aright!When shall we, out of trial brought,Be perfect in the land of light!Lord, may we day by day prepareTo see Thy face, and serve Thee there.</verse>

data.title: Jesus, I Come
data.preview: <verse>Out of my bondage, sorrow and night,Jesus, I come, Je
