data.data: <verse>Out of my bondage, sorrow and night,Jesus, I come, Jesus, I come;Into Thy freedom, gladness and light,Jesus, I come to Thee;Out of my sickness into Thy health,Out of my want and into Thy wealth,Out of my sin and into Thyself,Jesus, I come to Thee.</verse><verse>Out of my shameful failure and loss,Jesus, I come, Jesus, I come;Into the glorious gain of Thy cross,Jesus, I come to Thee;Out of earth's sorrows into Thy balm,Out of life's storms and into Thy calm,Out of distress to jubilant psalm,Jesus, I come to Thee.</verse><verse>Out of unrest and arrogant pride,Jesus, I come, Jesus, I come;Into Thy blessed will to abide,Jesus, I come to Thee;Out of myself to dwell in Thy love,Out of despair into raptures above,Upward for aye on wings like a dove,Jesus, I come to Thee.</verse><verse>Out of the fear and dread of the tomb,Jesus, I come, Jesus, I come;Into the joy and light of Thy home,Jesus, I come to Thee;Out of the depths of ruin untold,Into the peace of Thy sheltering fold,Ever Thy glorious face to behold,Jesus, I come to Thee.</verse>

data.title: Heavenly Father, Bless Us Now
data.preview: <verse>Heavenly Father, bless us now;At the cross of Christ
data.data: <verse>Heavenly Father, bless us now;At the cross of Christ we bow;Take our guilt and grief away;Hear and heal us now, we pray.</verse><verse>Now, O Lord, this very hour,Send Thy grace and show Thy power;While we rest upon Thy word,Come, and bless us now, O Lord!</verse><verse>Mercy now, O Lord, we pleadIn this hour of utter need;Turn us not away unblest;Calm our anguish into rest.</verse><verse>O Thou loving, blessed One,Rising o'er us like the sun,Light and life art Thou within:Savior, Thou, from every sin!</verse>

data.title: Power in the Blood
data.preview: <verse>Would you be free from the burden of sin?There's pow'
data.data: <verse>Would you be free from the burden of sin?There's pow'r in the blood, pow'r in the blood;Would you o'er evil a victory win?There's wonderful power in the blood.</verse><chorus>There is pow'r, pow'r, wonder working pow'rIn the blood of the Lamb;There is pow'r, pow'r, wonder working pow'rIn the precious blood of the Lamb.</chorus><verse>Would be free from your passion and pride?There's pow'r in the blood, pow'r in the blood;Come for a cleansing to Calvary's tide?There's wonderful power in the blood.</verse><verse>Would you do service for Jesus your King?There's pow'r in the blood, pow'r in the blood;Would you live daily His praises to sing?There's wonderful power in the blood.</verse>

data.title: Chief of Sinners
data.preview: <verse>Chief of sinners though I be,Jesus shed His blood for
data.data: <verse>Chief of sinners though I be,Jesus shed His blood for me;Died that I might live on high,Died that I might never die;As the brance is to the vine,I am His, and He is mine.</verse><verse>O the height of Jesus' love! Higher than the heaven above,Deeper than the deepest sea,Lasting as eternity;Love that found me-wondrous thought!Found me when I sought Him not!</verse><verse>Chief of sinners though I be,Christ is all in all to me;All my wants to Him are known,All my sorrows are His own;Safe with Him from earthly strife,He sustains the hidden life. </verse>

data.title: Lord, I'm Coming Home
data.preview: <verse>I've wandered far away from God, Now I'm coming home;
data.data: <verse>I've wandered far away from God, Now I'm coming home;The paths of sin too long I've trod;Lord, I'm coming home.</verse><chorus>Coming home, coming home Never more to roam;Open wide Thine arms of love; Lord I'm coming home.</chorus><verse>I've wasted many precious years, Now I'm coming home;I now repent with bitter tears;Lord, I'm coming home.</verse><verse>I'm tired of sin and straying Lord,Now I'm coming home;I'll trust Thy love belive Thy word;Lord I'm coming home.</verse><verse>My only hope, my only plea,Now I'm coming home;That Jesus died, and died for me;Lord I'm coming home.</verse><verse>I need His cleansing blood I know,Now I'm coming home;O wash me whiter than the snow; Lord I'm coming home. </verse>

data.title: God Be Merciful to Me
data.preview: <verse>God, be merciful to me,On Thy grace I rest my plea;Pl
data.data: <verse>God, be merciful to me,On Thy grace I rest my plea;Plenteous in compassion Thou,Blot out my transgressions now;Wash me, make me pure within,Cleanse, O cleanse me from my sin,Wash me, make me pure within,Cleanse, O cleanse me from my sin.</verse><verse>I am evil, born in sin;Thou desirest truth within.Thou alone my Savior art,Teach Thy wisdom to my heart;Make me pure, Thy grace bestow,Wash me whiter than the snow,Make me pure, Thy grace bestow,Wash me whiter than the snow.</verse><verse>Gracious God, my heart renew,Make my spirit right and true;Cast me not away from Thee,Let Thy Spirit dwell in me;Thy salvation's joy impart,Steadfast make my willing heart,Thy salvation's joy impart,Steadfast make my willing heart.</verse><verse>Sinners then shall learn from meAnd return, O God, to Thee;Savior, all my guilt remove,And my tongue shall sing Thy love;Touch my silent lips, O Lord,And my mouth shall praise accord,Touch my silent lips, O Lord,And my mouth shall praise accord.</verse>

data.title: I Lay My Sins on Jesus
data.preview: <verse>I lay my sins on Jesus,The spotless Lamb of God;He be
data.data: <verse>I lay my sins on Jesus,The spotless Lamb of God;He bears them all, and frees usFrom the accursed load,From the accursed load.</verse><verse>I bring my guilt to Jesus,To wash my crimson stainsWhite in His blood most precious,Till not a stain remains,Till not a stain remains.</verse><verse>I lay my wants on Jesus,All fullness dwells in Him;He healeth my diseases,He doth my soul redeem,He doth my soul redeem.</verse><verse>I long to be like Jesus,Meek loving, lowly, mild;I long to be like Jesus,The Father's holy child,The Father's holy child.</verse><verse>I long to be with JesusAmid the heav'nly throng,To sing with them His praises,And learn the angels'song,And learn the angels'song.</verse>

data.title: Forgive Our Sins as We Forgive
data.preview: <verse>"Forgive our sins as we forgive,"You taught
data.data: <verse>"Forgive our sins as we forgive,"You taught us, Lord, to pray;But You alone can grant us graceTo live the words we say.</verse><verse>How can Your pardon reach and blessThe unforgiving heartThat broods on wrongs and will not letOld bitterness depart?</verse><verse>In blazing light Your cross revealsThe truth we dimly knew:How trifling others' debts to us;How great our debt to You!</verse><verse>Lord, cleanse the depths within our soulsAnd bid resentment cease;Then, by Your mercy reconciled,Our lives will spread Your peace.</verse>

data.title: Rock of Ages
data.preview: <verse>Rock of Ages, cleft for me,Let me hide myself in Thee
data.data: <verse>Rock of Ages, cleft for me,Let me hide myself in Thee;Let the water and the blood,From Thy riven side which flowed,Be of sin the double cure,Cleanse me from its guilt and power.</verse><verse>Not the labor of my handsCan fulfill Thy law's demands;Could my zeal no respite know,Could my tears forever flow,All for sin could not atone;Thou must save, and Thou alone.</verse><verse>When my pilgrimage I close;Victor o'er the last of foes,When I soar to worlds unknown,And behold Thee on Thy throne,Rock of Ages, cleft for me,Let me hide myself in Thee.</verse>

data.title: Near, Still Nearer
data.preview: <verse>Nearer, still nearer, close to Thy heart,Draw me, my
data.data: <verse>Nearer, still nearer, close to Thy heart,Draw me, my Savior, so precious Thou art;Fold me, O fold me close to Thy breast,Shelter me safe in that haven of rest,Shelter me safe in that haven of rest.</verse><verse>Nearer, still nearer, nothing I bring,Nought as an offering to Jesus my King-Only my sinful now contrite heart,Grant me the cleansing Thy blood doth impart,Grant me the cleansing Thy blood doth impart.</verse><verse>Nearer, still nearer, Lord, to be Thine;Sin, with its follies, I gladly resign,All of its pleasures, pomp and its pride;Give me but Jesus, my Lord crucified,Give me but Jesus, my Lord crucified.</verse><verse>Nearer, still nearer, while life shall last;Till safe in glory my anchor is cast;Through endless ages, ever to be,Nearer, my Savior, still nearer to Thee,Nearer, my Savior, still nearer to Thee. </verse>

data.title: Deeper Yet
data.preview: <verse>In the blood from the cross,I have been washed from s
data.data: <verse>In the blood from the cross,I have been washed from sin;But to be free from dross,Still I would enter in. </verse><chorus>Deeper yet, deeper yet,Into the crimson flood;Deeper yet, deeper yet,Under the precious blood. </chorus><verse>Day by day, hour by hour,Blessings are sent to me;But for more of His power,Ever my prayer shall be. </verse><verse>Near to Christ I would live,Following Him each day;What I ask He will give;So then with faith I pray. </verse><verse>Now I have peace, sweet peace,While in this world of sin;But to pray I'll not ceaseTill I am pure within.</verse>

data.title: Beneath the Cross of Jesus
data.preview: <verse>Beneath the cross of JesusI fain would take my stand,
data.data: <verse>Beneath the cross of JesusI fain would take my stand,The shadow of a mighty rockWithin a weary land;A home within the wilderness,A rest upon the way,From the burning of the noontide heat,And the burden of the day.</verse><verse>Upon that cross of JesusMine eye at times can seeThe very dying form of OneWho suffered there for me;And from my stricken heart with tearsTwo wonders I confess:The wonders of redeeming loveAnd my unworthiness.</verse><verse>I take, O cross, thy shadowFor my abiding place;I ask no other sunshine thanThe sunshine of His face;Content to let the world go by,To know no gain nor loss,My sinful self my only shame,My glory all the cross.</verse>

data.title: Faith of Our Fathers
data.preview: <verse>Faith of our fathers, living still,In spite of dungeo
data.data: <verse>Faith of our fathers, living still,In spite of dungeon, fire and sword;O how our hearts beat high with joyWhenever we hear that glorious Word!Faith of our fathers, holy faith!We will be true to thee till death.</verse><verse>Our fathers, chained in prisons dark,Were still in heart and conscience free:How sweet would be their children's fate.If they, like them, could die for thee!Faith of our fathers, holy faith!We will be true to thee till death.</verse><verse>Faith of our fathers, we will loveBoth friend and foe in all our strife;And preach Thee, too, as love knows howBy kindly words and virtuous life.Faith of our fathers, holy faith!We will be true to thee till death.</verse>

data.title: Give Me Jesus
data.preview: <verse>In the morning, when I riseIn the morning, when I ris
data.data: <verse>In the morning, when I riseIn the morning, when I riseIn the morning, when I rise </verse><chorus>Give me Jesus.Give me Jesus,Give me Jesus.You can have all this world,Just give me Jesus. </chorus><verse>Dark mid-night was my cry,Dark mid-night was my cry,Dark midnight was my cry,Give me Jesus. </verse><verse>Just about the break of day,Just about the break of day,Just about the break of day,Give me Jesus. </verse><verse>Oh, when I come to die,Oh, when I come to die,Oh, when I come to die,Give me Jesus.</verse>

data.title: Draw Me Nearer
data.preview: <verse>I am thine, O Lord, I have heard Thy voice,And it tol
data.data: <verse>I am thine, O Lord, I have heard Thy voice,And it told Thy love to me;But I long to rise in the arms of faithAnd be closer drawn to Thee.</verse><chorus>Draw me nearer, nearer, blessed Lord,To the cross where Thou hast died.Draw me nearer, nearer, nearer, blessed Lord,To Thy precious, bleeding side.</chorus><verse>Consecrate me now to Thy service, Lord,By the power of grace divine;Let my soul look up with a steadfast hope,And my will be lost in Thine.</verse><verse>O the pure delight of a single hourThat before Thy throne I spend,When I kneel in prayer, and with Thee, my God,I commune as friend with friend!</verse>

data.title: I Am Coming to the Cross
data.preview: <verse>I am coming to the cross;I am poor and weak and blind
data.data: <verse>I am coming to the cross;I am poor and weak and blind;I am counting all but dross;I shall full salvation find. </verse><chorus>I am trusting, Lord, in Thee.O thou Lamb of Calvary;Humbly at Thy cross I bow.Save me, Jesus, save me now. </chorus><verse>Long my heart has sighed for Thee;Long has evil reigned within;Jesus sweetly speaks to me:'I will cleanse you from all sin.' </verse><verse>Here I give my all to Thee:Friends and time and earthly store;Soul and body Thine to be,Wholly Thine forevermore. </verse><verse>Jesus comes! He fills my soul!Perfected in Him I am;I am every whit made whole:Glory, glory to the Lamb!</verse>

data.title: Wholly Thine
data.preview: <verse>I would be, dear Savior, wholly Thine;Teach me how, t
data.data: <verse>I would be, dear Savior, wholly Thine;Teach me how, teach me how;I would do Thy will, O Lord, not mine;Help me, help me now.</verse><chorus>Wholly Thine, wholly Thine,Wholly Thine, this is my vow;Wholly Thine, wholly Thine,Wholly Thine, O Lord, just now.</chorus><verse>What is worldly pleasure, wealth or fame,Without Thee, without Thee?I will leave them all for Thy dear Name,This my wealth shall be.</verse><verse>As I cast earth's transient joys behind,Come Thou near, come Thou near;In Thy presence all in all I find,'Tis my comfort here.</verse>

data.title: I Surrender All
data.preview: <verse>All to Jesus I surrender;All to him I freely give;I w
data.data: <verse>All to Jesus I surrender;All to him I freely give;I will ever love and trust Him,In His presence daily live.</verse><chorus>I surrender all, I surrender all,All to Thee, my blessed Savior,I surrender all.</chorus><verse>All to Jesus I surrender;Humbly at His feet I bow,Worldly pleasures all forsaken;Take me, Jesus, take me now.</verse><verse>All to Jesus I surrender;Make me, Savior, wholly thine;Fill me with Thy love and power;Truly know that Thou art mine.</verse><verse>All to Jesus I surrender;Now I feel the sacred flame.O the joy of full salvation!Glory, glory, to His name!</verse>

data.title: I Would Draw Nearer to Jesus
data.preview: <verse>I would draw nearer to Jesus, In His sweet presence a
data.data: <verse>I would draw nearer to Jesus, In His sweet presence abide,Constantly trying to serve Him, Safe and secure at His side.I would draw nearer to Jesus, I would draw nearer to Him;Fully surrendered each moment, I would draw nearer to Him.</verse><verse>I would draw nearer to Jesus, Nothing withholding from Him,Knowing He loves to be gracious, I would draw nearer to Him.I would draw nearer to Jesus, I would draw nearer to Him;Fully surrendered each moment, I would draw nearer to Him.</verse><verse>I would draw nearer to Jesus, Seeking His strength to be true,Willing to tell of His goodness, Gladly His blest will to do.I would draw nearer to Jesus, I would draw nearer to Him;Fully surrendered each moment, I would draw nearer to Him.</verse>

data.title: I Would Be Like Jesus
data.preview: <verse>Earthly pleasures vainly call me;I would be like Jesu
data.data: <verse>Earthly pleasures vainly call me;I would be like Jesus;Nothing worldly shall enthrall me;I would be like Jesus. </verse><chorus>Be like Jesus, this my song,In the home and in the throng;Be like Jesus, all day long!I would be like Jesus. </chorus><verse>He has broken every fetter,I would be like Jesus;That my soul may serve Him better,I would be like Jesus. </verse><verse>All the way from earth to glory,I would be like Jesus;Telling o'er and o'er the story,I would be like Jesus. </verse><verse>That in Heaven He may meet me,I would be like Jesus;That His words 'Well done' may greet me,I would be like Jesus.</verse>

data.title: Near the Cross
data.preview: <verse>Jesus, keep me near the cross; There a precious fount
data.data: <verse>Jesus, keep me near the cross; There a precious fountain, Free to all, a healing stream, Flows from Calvary's mountain. </verse><chorus>In the cross, in the cross, Be my glory ever, Till my raptured soul shall find Rest beyond the river.</chorus><verse>Near the cross, a trembling soul, Love and mercy found me; There the bright and morning star Sheds its beams around me. </verse><verse>Near the cross! O Lamb of God, Bring its scenes before me; Help me walk from day to day With its shadow o'er me. </verse><verse>Near the cross I'll watch and wait, Hoping, trusting ever, Till I reach the golden strand Just beyond the river. </verse>

data.title: Just as I Am
data.preview: <verse>Just as I am, without one plea,But that Thy blood was
data.data: <verse>Just as I am, without one plea,But that Thy blood was shed for me,And that Thou bidst me come to Thee,O Lamb of God, I come, I come.</verse><verse>Just as I am, and waiting notTo rid my soul of one dark blot,To Thee whose blood can cleanse each spot,O Lamb of God, I come, I come.</verse><verse>Just as I am, though tossed aboutWith many a conflict, many a doubt,"Fightings within, and fears without,"O Lamb of God, I come, I come.</verse><verse>Just as I am, poor, wretched, blind;Sight, riches, healing of the mind,Yea, all I need in Thee to find,O Lamb of God, I come, I come.</verse><verse>Just as I am, Thou wilt receive,Wilt welcome, pardon, cleanse, relieve;Because Thy promise I believe,O Lamb of God, I come, I come.</verse><verse>Just as I am, Thy love I ownHas broken every barrier down;Now, to be Thine, and Thine alone,O Lamb of God, I come, I come.</verse>

data.title: Just as I Am
data.preview: <verse>Just as I am, without one plea,But that Thy blood was
data.data: <verse>Just as I am, without one plea,But that Thy blood was shed for me,And that Thou bidst me come to Thee,O Lamb of God, I come, I come.</verse>

data.title: O for a Closer Walk!
data.preview: <verse>O for a closer walk with God,A calm and heavenly fram
data.data: <verse>O for a closer walk with God,A calm and heavenly frame,A light to shine upon the roadThat leads me to the Lamb! </verse><verse>Return, O holy Dove, return,Sweet messenger of rest!I hate the sins that made Thee mournAnd drove Thee from my breast. </verse><verse>What peaceful hours I once enjoyed!How sweet their memory still!But they have left an aching voidThe world can never fill. </verse><verse>The dearest idol I have known,Whate'er that idol beHelp me to tear it from Thy throne,And worship only Thee.</verse>

data.title: Live Out Thy Life Within Me
data.preview: <verse>Live out Thy life within me, O Jesus, King of kings!B
data.data: <verse>Live out Thy life within me, O Jesus, King of kings!Be Thou Thyself the answer To all my questionings;Live out Thy life within me, In all things have Thy way!I, the transparent medium Thy glory to display.</verse><verse>The temple has been yielded, And purified of sin;Let Thy Shekinah glory Now shine forth from within,And all the earth keep silence, The body henceforth beThy silent, gentle servant, Moved only as by Thee.</verse><verse>Its members every moment Held subject to Thy call,Ready to have Thee use them, Or not be used at all;Held without restless longing, Or strain, or stress, or fretOr chafings at Thy dealings, Or thoughts of vain regret.</verse><verse>But restful, calm, and pliant, From bend and bias free,Awaiting Thy decision, When Thou hast need of me.Live out Thy life within me, O Jesus, King of kings!Be Thou the glorious answer To all my questionings.</verse>

data.title: Lead Me to Calvary
data.preview: <verse>King of my life, I crown Thee now,Thine shall the glo
data.data: <verse>King of my life, I crown Thee now,Thine shall the glory be;Lest I forget Thy thorn crowned brow,Lead me to Calvary. </verse><chorus>Lest I forget Gethsemane,Lest I forget Thine agony;Lest I forget Thy love for me,Lead me to Calvary. </chorus><verse>Show me the tomb where Thou wast laid,Tenderly mourned and wept;Angels in robes of light arrayedGuarded Thee whilst Thou slept. </verse><verse>Let me like Mary, through the gloom,Come with a gift to Thee;Show to me now the empty tomb,Lead me to Calvary. </verse><verse>May I be willing, Lord, to bearDaily my cross for Thee;Even Thy cup of grief to share,Thou hast borne all for me.</verse>

data.title: Whiter Than Snow
data.preview: <verse>Lord Jesus, I long to be perfectly whole;I want Thee
data.data: <verse>Lord Jesus, I long to be perfectly whole;I want Thee forever to live in my soul;Break down every idol, cast out every foe;Now wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow. </verse><chorus>Whiter than snow, yes, whiter than snow;Now wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.</chorus><verse>Lord Jesus, look down from Thy throne in the skies,And help me to make a complete sacrifice;I give up myself, and whatever I know;Now wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.</verse><verse>Lord Jesus, for this I most humbly entreat;I wait, blessed Lord, at Thy crucified feet,By faith, for my cleansing; I see Thy blood flow;Now wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.</verse><verse>Lord Jesus, Thou seest I patiently wait;Come now, and within me a new heart create;To those who have sought Thee,Thou never said'st No;Now wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.</verse>

data.title: Lord, I Want to Be a Christian
data.preview: <verse>Lord, I want to be a Christian in my heart, in my hea
data.data: <verse>Lord, I want to be a Christian in my heart, in my heart,Lord, I want to be a Christian in my heart, in my heart.In my heart, in my heart,Lord, I want to be a Christian in my heart, in my heart.</verse><verse>Lord, I want to be more loving in my heart, in my heart,Lord, I want to be more loving in my heart, in my heart.In my heart, in my heart,Lord, I want to be more loving in my heart, in my heart.</verse><verse>Lord, I want to be more holy in my heart, in my heart,Lord, I want to be more holy in my heart, in my heart.In my heart, in my heart,Lord, I want to be more holy in my heart, in my heart.</verse><verse>Lord, I want to be like Jesus in my heart, in my heart,Lord, I want to be like Jesus in my heart, in my heart.In my heart, in my heart,Lord, I want to be like Jesus in my heart, in my heart.</verse>

data.title: Lord of Creation
data.preview: <verse>Lord of creation, to you be all praise!Most mighty yo
data.data: <verse>Lord of creation, to you be all praise!Most mighty your working, most wondrous your ways!Your glory and might are beyond us to tell, And yet in the heart of the humble you dwell. </verse><verse>Lord of all power, I give You my will, In joyful obedience Your tasks to fulfill.Your bondage is freedom; Your service is song; And held in Your keeping, my weakness is strong. </verse><verse>Lord of all wisdom, I give you my mind, Rich truth that surpasses man's knowledge to find;What eye has not seen and what ear has not heardIs taught by Your Spirit and shines from Your Word. </verse><verse>Lord of all being, I give you my all, If I ever disown you, I stumble and fall;But led in Your service Your word to obey,I'll walk in Your freedom to the end of the way.</verse>

data.title: My Jesus, I Love Thee
data.preview: <verse>My Jesus, I love thee, I know Thou art mine; For Thee
data.data: <verse>My Jesus, I love thee, I know Thou art mine; For Thee all the follies of sin I resign. My gracious Redeemer, my Savior art thou; If ever I loved thee, my Jesus, 'tis now. </verse><verse>I love Thee because Thou hast first loved me, And purchased my pardon on Calvary's tree; I love Thee for wearing the thorns on Thy brow; If ever I loved thee, my Jesus, 'tis now. </verse><verse>I'll love Thee in life, I will love Thee 'til death,And praise Thee as long as Thou lendest me breath;And say when the death dew lies cold on my brow,iI ever I loved Thee, my Jesus, 'tis now.</verse><verse>In mansions of glory and endless delight; I'll ever adore Thee in heaven so bright; I'll sing with the glittering crown on my brow; If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus, 'tis now.</verse>

data.title: Nothing Between
data.preview: <verse>Nothing between my soul and my Savior,Naught of this
data.data: <verse>Nothing between my soul and my Savior,Naught of this world's delusive dream;I have renounced all sinful pleasure;Jesus is mine, there's nothing between.</verse><chorus>Nothing between my soul and my Savior,So that His blessed face may be seen;Nothing preventing the least of His favor;Keep the way clear! let nothing between.</chorus><verse>Nothing between, like worldly pleasure;Habits of life, though harmless they seem,Must not my heart from Him ever sever;He is my all, there's nothing between.</verse><verse>Nothing between, e'en many hard trials,Though the whole world against me convene;Watching with prayer and much self denial,I'll triumph at last, there's nothing between.</verse>

data.title: O for a Heart to Praise My God!
data.preview: <verse>O for a heart to praise my God,A heart from sin set f
data.data: <verse>O for a heart to praise my God,A heart from sin set free,A heart that always feels Thy bloodSo freely shed for me. </verse><verse>A heart resigned, submissive, meek,My dear Redeemer's throne,Where only Christ is heard to speak,Where Jesus reigns alone. </verse><verse>A heart in every thought renewedAnd full of love divine,Perfect and right and pure and good,A copy, Lord, of Thine. </verse><verse>Thy nature, gracious Lord, impart;Come quickly from above;Write Thy new name upon my heart,Thy new, best name of Love.</verse>

data.title: Just as I Am, Thine Own to Be
data.preview: <verse>Just as I am, Thine own to be,Friend of the young, wh
data.data: <verse>Just as I am, Thine own to be,Friend of the young, who lovest me,To consecrate myself to Thee,O Jesus Christ, I come. </verse><verse>In the glad morning of my day,My life to give, my vows to pay,With no reserve and no delay,With all my heart I come. </verse><verse>I would live ever in the light,I would work ever for the right;I would serve Thee with all my might;Therefore, to Thee I come. </verse><verse>Just as I am, young, strong, and free,To be the best that I can beFor truth, and righteousness, and Thee,Lord of my life, I come.</verse>

data.title: Jesus, I My Cross Have Taken
data.preview: <verse>Jesus, I my cross have taken, all to leave and follow
data.data: <verse>Jesus, I my cross have taken, all to leave and follow Thee.All things else I have forsaken, Thou from hence my all shall be.Perish every fond ambition, all I've sought or hoped or known.Yet how rich is my condition! God and Heaven are still mine own. </verse><verse>Let the world despise and leave me, they have left my Savior, too.Human hearts and looks deceive me; Thou art faithful, Thou art true.O, 'tis not in grief to harm me, while Thy love is left to me;O, 'twere not in joy to charm me, If that love be hid from me. </verse><verse>Soul, then know thy full salvation; rise o'er sin, and fear, and care;Joy to find in every station something still to do or bear:Think what Spirit dwells within thee; Think what Father's smiles are thine;Think that Jesus died to win thee, child of heaven, canst thou repine? </verse><verse>Haste then on from grace to glory, armed by faith, and winged by prayer,Heaven's eternal day's before thee, God's own hand shall guide thee there.Soon shall close thy earthly mission, soon shall pass thy pilgrim days;Hope soon change to glad fruition, faith to sight, and prayer to praise.</verse>

data.title: Open My Eyes That I May See
data.preview: <verse>Open my eyes, that I may seeGlimpses of truth Thou ha
data.data: <verse>Open my eyes, that I may seeGlimpses of truth Thou hast for me;Place in my hands the wonderful keyThat shall unclasp and set me free.Silently now I wait for Thee,Ready, my God, Thy will to see;Open my eyes,Illumine me, Spirit Divine!</verse><verse>Open my ears that I may hearVoices of truth Thou sendest clear;And while the wavenotes fall on my ear,Everything false will disappear.Silently now I wait for Thee,Ready, my God, Thy will to see;Open my ears, illumine me, Spirit Divine!</verse><verse>Open my mouth, and let me bearGladly the warm truth everywhere;Open my heart, and let me prepareLove with Thy children thus to share.Silently now I wait for Thee,Ready, my God, Thy will to see;Open my heart, illumine me, Spirit Divine! </verse>

data.title: I'd Rather Have Jesus
data.preview: <verse>I'd rather have Jesus than silver or gold;I'd rather
data.data: <verse>I'd rather have Jesus than silver or gold;I'd rather be His than have riches untold;I'd rather have Jesus than houses or land;I'd rather be led by His nail-pierced hand:</verse><chorus>Than to be the king of a vast domain or be held in sin's dread sway!I'd rather have Jesus than anything this world affords today.</chorus><verse>I'd rather have Jesus than men's applause;I'd rather be faithful to His dear cause;I'd rather have Jesus than world-wide fame;I'd rather be true to His holy name:</verse><verse>He's fairer than lilies of rarest bloom;He's sweeter than honey from out the coomb;He's all that my hungering spirit needs -I'd rather have Jesus and let Him lead:</verse>

data.title: Must Jesus Bear the Cross Alone
data.preview: <verse>Must Jesus bear the cross alone, And all the world go
data.data: <verse>Must Jesus bear the cross alone, And all the world go free? No, there's a cross for everyone, And there's a cross for me. </verse><verse>The consecrated cross I'll bear Till He shall set me free; And then go home my crown to wear, For there's a crown for me. </verse><verse>Upon the crystal pavement, down At Jesus' pierced feet,With joy I'll cast my golden crown,And His dear name repeat. </verse>

data.title: Take the World, but Give Me Jesus
data.preview: <verse>Take the world, but give me Jesus;All its Joys are bu
data.data: <verse>Take the world, but give me Jesus;All its Joys are but a name,But His love abideth ever,Through eternal years the same.</verse><chorus>Oh, the height and depth of mercy!Oh, the length and breadth of love!Oh, the fullness of redemption,Pledge of endless life above.</chorus><verse>Take the world, but give me Jesus, Sweetest comfort of my soul;With my Savior watching o'er me,I can sing, though billows roll.</verse><verse>Take the world, but give me Jesus;Let me view His constant smile;Then throughout my pilgrim journeyLight will cheer me all the while.</verse><verse>Take the world, but give me Jesus;In His cross my trust shall be,Till, with clearer, brighter visionFace to face my Lord I see.</verse>

data.title: Take My Life and Let It Be
data.preview: <verse>Take my life, and let it beConsecrated, Lord, to Thee
data.data: <verse>Take my life, and let it beConsecrated, Lord, to Thee;Take my hands, and let them moveAt the impulse of Thy love;At the impulse of Thy love.</verse><verse>Take my feet, and let them beSwift and beautiful for Thee.Take my voice, and let me singAlways, only, for my King;Always, only, for my King.</verse><verse>Take my lips, and let them beFilled with messages from Thee.Take my silver and my gold:Not a mite would I withhold;Not a mite would I withhold.</verse><verse>Take my will, and make it Thine,It shall be no longer mine;Take my heart, it is Thine own,It shall be Thy royal throne.It shall be Thy royal throne.</verse><verse>Take my love, my Lord, I pourAt Thy feet its treasure store;Take myself, and I will be,Ever, only, all for Thee.Ever, only, all for Thee.</verse>

data.title: O Jesus, I Have Promised
data.preview: <verse>O Jesus, I have promised To serve Thee to the end; Be
data.data: <verse>O Jesus, I have promised To serve Thee to the end; Be Thou forever near me, My Master and my Friend. I shall not fear the battle If Thou art by my side, Nor wander from the pathway If Thou wilt be my Guide. </verse><verse>O let me feel Thee near me! The world is ever near; I see the sights that dazzle, The tempting sounds I hear; My foes are ever near me, Around me and within; But Jesus, draw Thou nearer, And shield my soul from sin. </verse><verse>O Jesus, Thou hast promised To all who follow Thee That where Thou art in glory There shall Thy servant be. And Jesus, I have promised To serve Thee to the end; O give me grace to follow, My Master and my Friend.</verse>

data.title: The Cleansing Wave
data.preview: <verse>Oh now I see the crimson wave,The fountain deep and w
data.data: <verse>Oh now I see the crimson wave,The fountain deep and wide;Jesus, my Lord, mighty to save,Points to His wounded side.</verse><chorus>The cleansing stream I see, I see,I plunge, and O, it cleanseth me!O praise the Lord! it cleanseth me,It cleanseth me, yes, cleanseth me.</chorus><verse>I see the new creation rise,I hear the speaking blood;It speaks polluted nature dies,Sinks 'neath the cleansing flood.</verse><verse>I rise to walk in heaven's own light,Above the world and sin;With heart made pure and garments white,And Christ enthroned within.</verse><verse>Amazing grace! 'tis heaven belowTo feel the blood applied,And Jesus, only Jesus, know,My Jesus crucified.</verse>

data.title: On Jordan's Banks the Baptist's Cry
data.preview: <verse>On Jordan's banks the Baptist's cryAnnounces that the
data.data: <verse>On Jordan's banks the Baptist's cryAnnounces that the Lord is nigh;Awake and hearken, for he bringsGlad tidings of the King of kings!</verse><verse>Then cleansed be every life from sin;Make straight the way for God within,And let us all our hearts prepareFor Christ to come and enter there.</verse><verse>We hail You as our Savior, Lord,Our refuge and our great reward;Without Your grace we waste awayLike flow'rs that wither and decay.</verse><verse>Stretch forth Your hand, our health restore,And make us rise to fall no more;Oh, let Your face upon us shineAnd fill the world with love divine.</verse>

data.title: Come, Thou Fount of Every Blessing
data.preview: <verse>Come, Thou Fount of every blessing,Tune my heart to s
data.data: <verse>Come, Thou Fount of every blessing,Tune my heart to sing Thy grace;Streams of mercy, never ceasing,Call for songs of loudest praise.Teach me ever to adore Thee,May I still Thy goodness prove,While the hope of endless gloryFills my heart with joy and love.</verse><verse>Here I raise mine Ebenezer;Hither by Thy help I've come;And I hope, by Thy good pleasure,Safely to arrive at home.Jesus sought me when a stranger,Wandering from the fold of God;He, to rescue me from danger,Interposed His precious blood.</verse><verse>O, to grace how great a debtorDaily I'm constrained to be!Let Thy goodness, like a fetter,Bind me closer still to Thee.Prone to wander, Lord, I feel it,Prone to leave the God I love;Here's my heart--O, take and seal it,Seal it for Thy courts above.</verse>

data.title: What a Wonderful Savior
data.preview: <verse>Christ has for sin atonement made,What a wonderful Sa
data.data: <verse>Christ has for sin atonement made,What a wonderful Saviour!We are redeemed! The price is paid!What a wonderful Savior!</verse><chorus>What a wonderful SaviorIs Jesus, my Jesus!What a wonderful SaviorIs Jesus, my Lord!</chorus><verse>I praise Him for the cleansing blood,What a wonderful Saviour!That reconciled my soul to God;What a wonderful Saviour!</verse><verse>He walks beside me all the way,What a wonderful Saviour!And keeps me faithful day by day;What a wonderful Saviour!</verse><verse>He gives me overcoming power,What a wonderful Saviour!And triumph in each trying hour;What a wonderful Saviour! </verse>

data.title: There Is a Fountain
data.preview: <verse>There is a fountain filled with blood drawn from Emma
data.data: <verse>There is a fountain filled with blood drawn from Emmanuel's veins;And sinners plunged beneath that flood lose all their guilty stains.Lose all their guilty stains, lose all their guilty stains;And sinners plunged beneath that flood lose all their guilty stains.</verse><verse>The dying thief rejoiced to see that fountain in his day;And there may I, though vile as he, wash all my sins away.Wash all my sins away, wash all my sins away;And there may I, though vile as he, wash all my sins away.</verse><verse>Thou dying Lamb, Thy precious blood shall never lose its powerTill all the ransomed church of God are saved, to sin no more.Are saved, to sin no more, are saved, to sin no more;Till all the ransomed church of God are saved, to sin no more.</verse><verse>E'er since, by faith, I saw the stream Thy flowing wounds supply,Redeeming love has been my theme, and shall be till I die.And shall be till I die, and shall be till I die;Redeeming love has been my theme, and shall be till I die.</verse><verse>Lord, I believe Thou hast prepared, unworthy though I be,For me a blood-bought free reward, a golden harp for me!A golden harp for me! A golden harp for me!For me a blood-bought free reward, a golden harp for me!</verse><verse>There in a nobler, sweeter song, I'll sing Thy power to save,When this poor lisping, stammering tongue is ransomed from the the grave.Is ransomed from the grave, is ransomed from the grace;When this poor lisping, stammering tongue is ransomed from the the grave.</verse>

data.title: Redeemed!
data.preview: <verse>Redeemed, how I love to proclaim it!Redeemed by the b
data.data: <verse>Redeemed, how I love to proclaim it!Redeemed by the blood of the Lamb;Redeemed through His infinite mercy,His child and forever I am.</verse><chorus>Redeemed, redeemed,Redeemed by the blood of the Lamb;Redeemed, redeemed,His child and forever I am.</chorus><verse>Redeemed, and so happy in Jesus,No language my rapture can tell;I know that the light of His presenceWith me doth continually dwell.</verse><verse>I know there's a crown that is waitingIn yonder bright mansion for me;And soon, with the spirit made perfect,At home with the Lord I shall be.</verse>

data.title: Redeemed!
data.preview: <verse>Redeemed, how I love to proclaim it!Redeemed by the b
data.data: <verse>Redeemed, how I love to proclaim it!Redeemed by the blood of the Lamb;Redeemed thro' His infinite mercy,His child, and forever, I am.</verse><chorus>Redeemed, redeemed,Redeemed by the blood of the Lamb;Redeemed, how I love to proclaim it!His child and forever I am.</chorus><verse>I think of my blessed Redeemer,I think of Him all the day long;I sing, for I cannot be silent;His love is the theme of my song.</verse><verse>I know I shall see in His beautyThe King in whose law I delight,Who lovingly guardeth my footsteps,And giveth me songs in the night.</verse>

data.title: God Is My Strong Salvation
data.preview: <verse>God is my strong salvation,What foe have I to fear?In
data.data: <verse>God is my strong salvation,What foe have I to fear?In darkness and temptation,My Light, my Help, is near:Though hosts encamp around me,Firm in the fight I stand;What terror can confound me,With God at my right hand?</verse><verse>Place on the reliance;My soul with courage wait;His truth be thine affiance,When faint and desolate.His might thy heart shall strengthen,His love thy joy increase;Mercy thy days shall lengthen;The Lord will give thee peace.</verse>

data.title: Jesus Saves
data.preview: <verse>We have heard a joyful sound,Jesus saves, Jesus saves
data.data: <verse>We have heard a joyful sound,Jesus saves, Jesus saves;Spread the gladness all around,Jesus saves, Jesus saves;Bear the news to every land,Climb the steeps and cross the waves,Onward, 'tis our Lord's command,Jesus saves, Jesus saves.</verse><verse>Waft it on the rolling tide,Jesus saves, Jesus saves;Tell to sinners, far and wide,Jesus saves, Jesus saves;Sing, ye islands of the sea.Echo back, ye ocean caves,Earth shall keep her jubilee,Jesus saves, Jesus saves.</verse><verse>Sing above the battle's strife,Jesus saves, Jesus saves;By His death and endless life,Jesus saves, Jesus saves;Sing it softly through the gloom,When the heart for mercy craves,Sing in triumph o'er the tomb,Jesus saves, Jesus saves.</verse><verse>Give the winds a mighty voice,Jesus saves, Jesus saves;Let the nations now rejoice,Jesus saves, Jesus saves;Shout salvation full and free,Highest hills and deepest caves,This our song of victory,Jesus saves, Jesus saves.</verse>

data.title: To God Be the Glory
data.preview: <verse>To God be the glory, great things He hath done!So lov
data.data: <verse>To God be the glory, great things He hath done!So loved He the world that He gave us His Son,Who yielded His life an atonement for sin,And opened the lifegate that all may go in.</verse><chorus>Praise the Lord, praise the Lord,Let the earth hear His voice!Praise the Lord, praise the Lord,Let the people rejoice!O come to the Father thru Jesus the Son,And give Him the glory, great things He hath done!</chorus><verse>O perfect redemption, the purchase of blood,To every believer the promise of God;The vilest offender who truly believes,That moment from Jesus a pardon receives.</verse><verse>Great things He hath taught us, great things He hath done,And great our rejoicing thru Jesus the Son;But purer, and higher, and greater will beOur wonder, our transport, when Jesus we see.</verse>

data.title: Is This a Day of New Beginnings?
data.preview: <verse>Is this a day of new beginnings,Time to remember and
data.data: <verse>Is this a day of new beginnings,Time to remember and move on,Time to believe what love is bringing,Laying to rest the pain that's gone?</verse><verse>How can the seasons of a planetMindlessly spinning round its sunWith just a human name and numberSay that some new thing has begun?</verse><verse>Yet through the life and death of JesusLove's mighty Spirit, now as then,Can make for us a world of differenceAs faith and hope are born again.</verse><verse>Then let us, with the Spirit's daring,Step from the past and leave behindIts disappointment, guilt, and grieving,Seeking new paths, and sure to find.</verse><verse>Christ is alive, and goes before usTo show and share what love can do.This is a day of new beginnings;Our God is making all things new.</verse>

data.title: I Will Sing of My Redeemer
data.preview: <verse>I will sing of my Redeemer,And His wondrous love to m
data.data: <verse>I will sing of my Redeemer,And His wondrous love to me;On the cruel cross He suffered,From the curse to set me free.</verse><chorus>Sing, oh sing, of my Redeemer,With His blood, He purchased me.On the cross, He sealed my pardon,Paid the debt, and made me free.</chorus><verse>I will tell the wondrous story,How my lost estate to save,In His boundless love and mercy,He the ransom freely gave.</verse><verse>I will sing of my Redeemer,And His heavenly love to me;He from death to life hath brought me,Son of God with Him to be.</verse>

data.title: I Love Your Kingdom, Lord
data.preview: <verse>I love Thy kingdom, Lord, The house of Thine abode, T
data.data: <verse>I love Thy kingdom, Lord, The house of Thine abode, The church our blest Redeemer saved With His own precious blood. </verse><verse>I love Thy church, O God! Her walls before Thee stand Dear as the apple of Thine eye, And graven on Thy hand. </verse><verse>Beyond my highest joy I prize her heavenly ways, Her sweet communion, solemn vows, Her hymns of love and praise. </verse><verse>Sure as Thy truth shall last, To Zion shall be given The brightest glories earth can yield, And brighter bliss of heaven. </verse>

data.title: Christ Is the World's True Light
data.preview: <verse>Christ is the world's true light,Its captain of salva
data.data: <verse>Christ is the world's true light,Its captain of salvation,The daystar clear and brightOf every man and nation;New life, new hope awakesWhere'er men own His sway:Freedom her bondage breaks,And night is turned to day.</verse><verse>In Christ all races meet,Their ancient feuds forgeting,The whole round world complete,From sunrise to its setting:When Christ is throned as Lord,Men shall forsake their fear,To plowshare beat the sword,To pruning hook the spear.</verse><verse>One Lord, in one great nameUnite us all who own Thee,Cast out our pride and shameThat hinder to enthrone Thee;The world has waited long,Has travailed long in pain,To heal its ancient wrong,Come, Prince of Peace, and reign.</verse>

data.title: Lord, Who Dost Give to Thy Church
data.preview: <verse>Lord, who dost give to Thy church for its healingGift
data.data: <verse>Lord, who dost give to Thy church for its healingGifts, and the grace to sustain and renew,Hear as we pray that today and each morrowWe to Thy purpose may show ourselves true.</verse><verse>Clear be the voices of preachers and prophetsFearlessly speaking the word of the Lord,Word of redemption thro' God's Son incarnate,Blessing for cursing, and peace for the sword.</verse><verse>Tender and wise be the hearts of the pastors,Guiding and guarding the souls in their care,Firm with the wayward, a strength to the doubting,Helping the needy their burdens to bear.</verse><verse>May those who teach grow in knowledge and patience,Guiding to wisdom the young and the old,Training for worship and witness and service,Foes to all falsehood, in truthfulness bold.</verse><verse>Lord, ever give to us gifts in due measure,Each needing other, and all having worth;So to the Father, the Son, and the Spirit,Glory be shown by the church here on earth.</verse>

data.title: Built on the Rock
data.preview: <verse>Built on the Rock the Church shall stand,Even when st
data.data: <verse>Built on the Rock the Church shall stand,Even when steeples are falling;Crumbled have spires in every land,Bells still are chiming and calling-Calling the young and old to rest,Calling the souls of those distressed,Longing for life everlasting.</verse><verse>Not in our temples made with handsGod, the Almighty, is dwelling;High in the heav'ns  His temple stands,All earthly temples exceling.Yet He who dwells in heav'n aboveDeigns to abide with us in love,Making our bodies His temple.</verse><verse>We are God's house of living stones,Built for His own habitation;He fills our hearts, His humble thrones,Granting us life and salvation.Were two or three to seek His face,He in their midst would show His grace,Blessings upon them bestowing.</verse><verse>Yet in this house, an earthly frame,Jesus His children is blessing;Hither we come to praise His name,Faith in our Savior confessing.Jesus to us His Spirit sent,Making with us His covenant,Granting His children the kingdom.</verse><verse>Thro' all the passing years, O Lord,Grant that, when church bells are ringing,Many may come to hear God's WordWhere He this promise is bringing:I know My own, My own know Me:You, not the world, My face shall see;My peace I leave with you. Amen.</verse>

data.title: The Church Has One Foundation
data.preview: <verse>The church has one foundationTis Jesus Christ her Lor
data.data: <verse>The church has one foundationTis Jesus Christ her Lord;She is His new creationBy water and the Word.From heaven He came and sought herTo be His holy bride;With His own blood He bought her,And for her life He died. </verse><verse>Elect from every nation,Yet one o'er all the earth;Her charter of salvation,One Lord, one faith, one birth;One holy name she blesses,Partakes one holy food,And to one hope she presses,With every grace endued.</verse><verse>Though with a scornful wonderWe see her sore oppressed,By schisms rent asunder,By heresies distressed,Yet saints their watch are keeping;Their cry goes up, "How long?"And soon the night of weepingShall be the morn of song.</verse><verse>'Mid toil and tribulation,And tumult of her war,She waits the consummationOf peace forevermore;Till, with the vision glorious,Her longing eyes are blest,And the great church victoriousShall be the church at rest.</verse>

data.title: God is Love
data.preview: <verse>Here in Christ we gather,Love of Christ our calling.C
data.data: <verse>Here in Christ we gather,Love of Christ our calling.Christ, our love, is with us,Gladness be His greetingLet us fear Him, yes, and love Him,God eternal.Loving Him, let each loveChrist in all his brethren.</verse><chorus>God is love, and where true love isGod Himself is there.</chorus><verse>When we Christians gather, Members of one body,Let there be in us noDiscord but one spirit.Banished now be anger,Strife, and every quarrel.Christ, our God, be alwaysPresent here among us.</verse><verse>Grant us love's fulfillment,Joy with all the blessed,When we see Your face,O Savior, in its glory.Shine on us, O purestLight of all creation,Be our bliss while endlessAges sing Your praises.</verse>

data.title: Blest Be the Tie That Binds
data.preview: <verse>Blest be the tie that bindsOur hearts in Christian lo
data.data: <verse>Blest be the tie that bindsOur hearts in Christian love;The fellowship of kindred mindsIs like to that above.</verse><verse>Before our Father's throneWe pour our ardent prayers;Our fears, our hopes, our aims are one,Our comforts and our cares.</verse><verse>We share each other's woes,Our mutual burdens bear;And often for each other flowsThe sympathizing tear.</verse><verse>When we asunder part,It gives us inward pain;But we shall still be joined in heart,And hope to meet again.</verse>

data.title: Thy Hand, O God Has Guided
data.preview: <verse>Thy hand, O God, has guidedThy flock from age to age;
data.data: <verse>Thy hand, O God, has guidedThy flock from age to age;The wondrous tale is writtenFull clear on every page;Our fathers owned Thy goodness,And we their deeds record;And both of this bear witness,One church, one faith, one Lord.</verse><verse>Thy heralds brought glad tidingsTo greatest as to least;They bade men rise and hastenTo share the great King's feast:And this was all their teaching,In every deed and word,To all alike proclaimingOne church, one faith, one Lord.</verse><verse>When shadows thick were falling,And all seemed sunk in night,Thou, Lord, did send Thy servants,Thy chosen sons of light.On them and on Thy peopleThy plenteous grace was poured,And this was still their message:One church, one faith, one Lord.</verse><verse>Thy mercy will not fail us,Nor leave Thy work undone;With Thy right hand to help us,The vict'ry shall be won;And then by men and angelsThy name shall be adored,And this shall be their anthem:One church, one faith, one Lord.</verse>

data.title: This Is My Will
data.preview: <verse>This is My will, My one command,That love should dwel
data.data: <verse>This is My will, My one command,That love should dwell among you all.This is My will that you should loveAs I have shown that I love you.</verse><verse>No greater love a man can haveThan that he die to save his friends.You are My friends if you obeyWhat I command that you should do.</verse><verse>You chose not Me, but I chose youThat you should go and bear much fruit.I chose you out that you in MeShould bear much fruit that will abide.</verse><verse>All that I ask My Father, dear,For My name's sake you shall receive.This is My will, My one command,That love should dwell in each, in all.</verse>

data.title: Father, Help Your People
data.preview: <verse>Father, help Your people in this world to buildSometh
data.data: <verse>Father, help Your people in this world to buildSomething of Your kingdom and to do Your will,Lead us to discover partnership in love;Bless our ways of sharing and our pride remove.</verse><verse>Lord of desk and altar, bind our lives in one,That in work and worship love may set the tone.Give us grace to listen, clarity of speech;Make us truly thankful for the gifts of each.</verse><verse>Holy is the setting of each room and yard,Lecture hall and kitchen, office, shop, and ward.Holy is the rhythm of our working hours;Hallow then our purpose, energy, and pow'rs.</verse><verse>Strengthen, Lord, for service hand and heart and brain;Help us good relations daily to maintain.Let the living presence of the servant ChristHeighten our devotion, make our life a feast.</verse>

data.title: Thy Love, O God
data.preview: <verse>Thy love, O God, has all mankind created,And led Thy
data.data: <verse>Thy love, O God, has all mankind created,And led Thy people to this present hour;In Christ we see life's glory consummated;Thy Spirit manifests His living power.</verse><verse>From out the darkness of our hope's frustration,From all the broken idols of our pride,We turn to seek Thy truth's illumination,And find Thy mercy waiting at our side.</verse><verse>In pity look upon Thy children's strivingFor life and freedom, peace and brotherhood,Till at the fullness of Thy truth arriving,We find in Christ the crown of every good.</verse><verse>Inspire Thy church, mid earth's discordant voices,To preach the gospel of her Lord above,Until the day this warring world rejoicesTo hear the mighty harmonies of love.</verse>

data.title: Where Cross the Crowded Ways of Life
data.preview: <verse>Where cross the crowded ways of life,Where sound the
data.data: <verse>Where cross the crowded ways of life,Where sound the cries of race and clan,Above the noise of selfish strife,We hear your voice, O Son of Man.</verse><verse>From tender childhood's helplessness,From woman's grief, man's burdened toil,From famished souls, from sorrow's stress,Your heart has never known recoil.</verse><verse>The cup of water given for You stillHolds the freshness of Your grace;Yet long these multitudes to viewThe sweet compassion of Your face.</verse><verse>O Master, from the mountainsideMake haste to heal these hearts of pain;Among these restless throngs abide;O tread the city's streets again.</verse><verse>Till all the world shall learn Your loveAnd follow where Your feet have trod,Till, glorious from Your heaven above,Shall come the city of our God.</verse>

data.title: All Who Love and Serve Your City
data.preview: <verse>All who love and serve your city,All who bear its dai
data.data: <verse>All who love and serve your city,All who bear its daily stress,All who cry for peace and justice,All who curse and all who bless.</verse><verse>In your day of loss and sorrow,In your day of helpless strife,Honor, peace, and love retreating,Seek the Lord, who is your life.</verse><verse>For all days are days of judgment,And the Lord is waiting still,Drawing near His friends who spurn Him,Off'ring peace from Calv'ry's hill.</verse><verse>Risen Lord, shall yet the cityBe the city of despair?Come today, our Judge, our Glory;Be its name "The Lord is there!"</verse>

data.title: Come, Labor On
data.preview: <verse>Come, labor on.Who dares stand idle on the harvest pl
data.data: <verse>Come, labor on.Who dares stand idle on the harvest plainWhile all around him waves the golden grain?And to each servant does the Master say,"Go work today."</verse><verse>Come, labor on.Claim the high calling angels cannot share;To young and old the gospel gladness bear;Redeem the time; its hours too swiftly fly.The night draws nigh.</verse><verse>Come, labor on.No time for rest; till glows the western sky,Till the long shadows o'er our pathway lie,And a glad sound comes with the setting sun,"Well done, well done!"</verse>

data.title: Far and Near the Fields Are Teeming
data.preview: <verse>Far and near the fields are teemingWith the sheaves o
data.data: <verse>Far and near the fields are teemingWith the sheaves of ripened grain;Far and near their gold is gleamingO'er the summy slope and plain.</verse><chorus>Lord of harvest, send forth reapers!Hear us Lord, to Thee we cry;Send them now the sheaves to gather,Ere the harvest-time pass by.</chorus><verse>Send them forth with morn's first beaming,Send them in the noon-tides's glare;When the sun's last rays are streaming,Bid them gather everywhere.</verse><verse>O thou, whom thy Lord is sending,Gather now the sheaves of gold;Heavenward then at evening wendingThou shalt come with joy untold.</verse>

data.title: Hark! the Voice of Jesus Calling
data.preview: <verse>Hark! the voice of Jesus calling,"Who will go an
data.data: <verse>Hark! the voice of Jesus calling,"Who will go and work today?Fields are white, the harvest waiting,Who will bear the sheaves away?"Loud and long the Master calleth,Rich reward He offers free;Who will answer, gladly saying,"Here am I, O Lord, send me"?</verse><verse>If you cannot cross the oceanAnd the heathen lands explore,You can find the heathen nearer,You can help them at your door;If you cannot speak like angels,If you cannot preach like Paul,You can tell the love of Jesus,You can say He died for all.</verse><verse>If you cannot be the watchman,Standing high on Zion's wall,Pointing out the path to heaven,Offering life and peace to all;With your prayers and with your bountiesYou can do what Heaven demands,You can be like faithful Aaron,Holding up the prophet's hands.</verse><verse>While the souls of men are dying,And the Master calls for you,Let none hear you idly saying,"There is nothing I can do!"Gladly take the task He gives you,Let His work your pleasure be;Answer quickly when He calleth,"Here am I, O Lord, send me."</verse>

data.title: From the Eastern Mountains
data.preview: <verse>From the eastern mountains Pressing on they come,Wise
data.data: <verse>From the eastern mountains Pressing on they come,Wise men in their wisdom, To His humble home;Stirred by deep devotion, Hasting from afar,Ever journeying onward, Guided by a star.</verse><verse>There their Lord and Savior Meek and lowly,Wondrous light that led them Onward on their way,Ever now to lighten Nations from afar,As they journey homeward By that guiding star.</verse><verse>Gather in the outcasts All who've gone astray,Throw Thy radiance o'er them, Guide them on their way;Those who never knew Thee, Those who've wandered far,Guide them by the brightness  Of Thy guiding star.</verse><verse>Until every nation, Whether bond or free,'Neath Thy starlit banner, Jesus follows thee.O'er the distant mountains To that heavenly home,Where no sin nor sorrow Evermore shall come.</verse>

data.title: Hark! 'Tis the Shepherd's Voice I Hear
data.preview: <verse>Hark! 'tis the Shepherd's voice I hear,Out in the des
data.data: <verse>Hark! 'tis the Shepherd's voice I hear,Out in the desert dark and drear,Calling the sheep who've gone astray,Far from the Shepherd's fold away.</verse><chorus>Bring them in, Bring them in,Bring them in from the fields of sin;Bring them in, Bring them in,Bring the wanderers to Jesus.</chorus><verse>Who'll go and help the Shepherd kind,Help Him the wandering ones to find?Who'll bring them back into the fold,Where they'll be sheltered from the cold?</verse><verse>Out in the desert hear their cry,Out on the mountain wild and high,Hark! 'tis the Master speaks to thee,"Go, find My sheep where 'er they be."</verse>

data.title: Lift High the Cross
data.preview: </verse><chorus>Lift high the cross, the love of Christ proc
data.data: </verse><chorus>Lift high the cross, the love of Christ proclaim,Till all the world adore His sacred Name.<verse>Come, Christians, follow where our Captain trod,Our King victorious, Christ, the Son of God.</chorus><verse>Led on their way by this triumphant sign,The hosts of God in conquering ranks combine.</verse><verse>All newborn soldiers of the CrucifiedBear on their brows the seal of Him Who died.</verse><verse>O Lord, once lifted on the glorious tree,As Thou hast promised, draw us all to Thee.</verse><verse>So shall our song of triumph ever be:Praise to the Crucified for victory!</verse>

data.title: Lord, Whose Love in Humble Service
data.preview: <verse>Lord, whose love in humble serviceBore the weight of
data.data: <verse>Lord, whose love in humble serviceBore the weight of human need,Who upon the cross, forsaken,Worked Your mercy's perfect deed:We, Your servants, bring the worshipNot of voice alone, but heart;Consecrating to Your purposeEvery gift which You impart.</verse><verse>Still Your children wander homeless;Still the hungry cry for bread;Still the captives long for freedom;Still in grief we mourn our dead.As you, Lord, in deep compassionHealed the sick and freed the soul,By Your Spirit send Your powerTo our world to make it whole.</verse><verse>As we worship, grant us vision,Till your love's revealing lightIn its height and depth and greatnessDawns upon our quickened sight,Making known the needs and burdensYour compassion bids us bear,Stirring us to ardent service,Your abundant life to share.</verse>

data.title: O Jesus Christ, to You
data.preview: <verse>O Jesus Christ, to You may hymns be risingIn every ci
data.data: <verse>O Jesus Christ, to You may hymns be risingIn every city for Your love and care;Inspire our worship, grant the glad surprisingThat Your blest Spirit brings men everywhere.</verse><verse>Grant us new courage, sacrificial, humble,Strong in Your strength to venture and to dare,To lift the fallen, guide the feet that stumbe,Seek out the lonely and God's mercy share.</verse><verse>Show us Your Spirit, brooding o'er each city,As You did weep above Jerusalem,Seeking to gather all in love and pity,And healing those who touch Your garment's hem.</verse>

data.title: O Zion, Haste
data.preview: <verse>O Zion, haste, thy mission high fulfilling, To tell t
data.data: <verse>O Zion, haste, thy mission high fulfilling, To tell to all the world that God is light, That He who made all nations is not willing One soul should perish, lost in shades of night. </verse><chorus>Publish glad tidings, tidings of peace;Tidings of Jesus, redemption and release. </chorus><verse>Proclaim to every people, tongue, and nation That God, in whom they live and move, is love; Tell how He stooped to save His lost creation, And died on earth that we might live above. </verse><verse>Give of thine own to bear the message glorious; Give of thy wealth to speed them on their way; Pour out thy soul for them in prayer victorious; O Zion, haste to bring the brighter day. </verse><verse>He comes again; O Zion, ere thou meet Him,Make known to every heart His saving grace;Let none whom He hath ransomed fail to greet Him,Through thy neglect, unfit to see His face.</verse>

data.title: O Where Are the Reapers?
data.preview: <verse>O where are the reapers that garner inThe sheaves of
data.data: <verse>O where are the reapers that garner inThe sheaves of the good from the fields of sin?With sickles of truth must the work be done,And no one may rest till the "harvest home."</verse><chorus>Where are the reapers? O who will comeAnd share in the glory of the "harvest home"?O who will help us to garner inThe sheaves of good from the fields of sin?</chorus><verse>The fields all are ripening, and far and wideThe world now is waiting the harvest tide:But reapers are few, and the work is great,And much will be lost should the harvest wait.</verse><verse>So come with your sickles, ye sons of men,And gather together the golden grain;Toil on till the Lord of the harvest come,Then share ye His joy in the "harvest home."</verse>

data.title: Rescue the Perishing
data.preview: <verse>Rescue the perishing, care for the dying,Snatch them
data.data: <verse>Rescue the perishing, care for the dying,Snatch them in pity from sin and the grave;Weep o'er the erring one, lift up the fallen,Tell them of Jesus, the mighty to save.</verse><chorus>Rescue the perishing, care for the dying;Jesus is merciful, Jesus will save.</chorus><verse>Though they are slighting Him, still He is waiting,Waiting the penitent child to receive;Plead with them earnestly, plead with them gently;He will forgive if they only believe.</verse><verse>Rescue the perishing, duty demands it;Strength for thy labor the Lord will provide;Back to the narrow way patiently win them;Tell the poor wanderer a Savior has died.</verse>

data.title: Watchman, Blow the Gospel Trumpet
data.preview: <verse>Watchman, blow the gospel trumpet,Every soul a warnin
data.data: <verse>Watchman, blow the gospel trumpet,Every soul a warning give;Whosoever hears the messageMay repent, and, turn and live.</verse><chorus>Blow the trumpet, trusty watchman,Blow it loud o'er land and sea;God commissions, sound the message!Every captive may be free.</chorus><verse>Sound it loud o'er every hilltop,Gloomy shade and sunny plain;Ocean depths repeat the message,Full salvation's glad refrain.</verse><verse>Sound it in the hedge and highway,Earth's dark spots where exiles roam;Let it tell all things are ready,Father waits to welcome home.</verse><verse>Sound it for the heavy laden,Weary, longing to be free;Sound a Savior's invitation,Sweetly saying, "Come to me."</verse>

data.title: Bringing in the Sheaves
data.preview: <verse>Sowing in the morning, sowing seeds of kindness,Sowin
data.data: <verse>Sowing in the morning, sowing seeds of kindness,Sowing in the noontide and the dewy eve,Waiting for the harvest and the time of reaping -We shall come rejoicing, bringing in the sheaves.</verse><chorus>Bringing in the sheaves, bringing in the sheaves,We shall come rejoicing, bringing in the sheaves.Bringing in the sheaves, bringing in the sheaves,We shall come rejoicing, bringing in the sheaves.</chorus><verse>Sowing in the sunshine, sowing in the shadows,Fearing neither clouds nor winter's chilling breeze;By and by the harvest and the labor ended -We shall come rejoicing, bringin in the sheaves.</verse><verse>Going forth with weeping, sowing for the Master,Tho the loss sustained our spirit often grieves;When our weeping's over He will bid us welcome -We shall come rejoicing, bringing in the sheaves</verse>

data.title: Christ for the World
data.preview: <verse>Christ for the world we sing,The world to Christ we b
data.data: <verse>Christ for the world we sing,The world to Christ we bring,With loving zeal;The poor, and them that mourn,The faint and overborne,Sinsick and sorrow-worn,Whom Christ doth heal.</verse><verse>Christ for the world we sing,The world to Christ we bring,With fervent prayer;The wayward and the lost,By restless passions tossed,Redeemed at countless cost,From dark despair.</verse><verse>Christ for the world we sing,The world to Christ we bring,With joyful song;The newborn souls, whose days,Reclaimed from error's ways,Inspired with hope and praise,To Christ belong.</verse>

data.title: Lift Him Up
data.preview: <verse>Lift Him up, 'tis He that bids you,Let the dying look
data.data: <verse>Lift Him up, 'tis He that bids you,Let the dying look and live;To all weary, thirsting sinners,Living waters will He give;And though once so meek and lowly,Yet the Prince of heaven was He;And the blind, who grope in darkness,Through the blood of Christ shall see.</verse><chorus>Lift Him up, the risen Savior,High amid the waiting throng;Lift Him up, 'tis He that speaketh,Now He bids you flee from wrong.</chorus><verse>Lift Him up, this precious Savior,Let the multitude behold;They with willing hearts shall seek Him,He will draw them to His fold;They shall gather from the wayside,Hastening on with joyous feet,They shall bear the cross of Jesus,And shall find salvation sweet.</verse><verse>Lift Him up in all His glory,'Tis the Son of God on high;Lift Him up, His love shall draw them,E'en the careless shall draw nigh;Let them hear again the storyOf the cross, the death of shame;And from tongue to tongue repeat it;Mighty throngs shall bless His name.</verse><verse>O then lift Him up in singing,Lift the Savior up in prayer;He, the glorious Redeemer,All the sins of men did bear;Yes, the young shall bow before Him,And the old their voices raise;All the deaf shall hear hosannah;And the dumb shall shout His praise.</verse>

data.title: How Beauteous Are Their Feet
data.preview: <verse>How beauteous are their feetWho stand on Zion's hill;
data.data: <verse>How beauteous are their feetWho stand on Zion's hill;Who bring salvation on their tongues,And words of peace reveal!</verse><verse>How charming is their voice,So sweet the tidings are:"Zion, behold thy Savior King;He reigns and triumphs here!"</verse><verse>How happy are our ears,That hear the joyful soundWhich kings and prophets waited for,And sought, but never found!</verse><verse>How blessed are our eyes,That see this heavenly light;Prophets and kings desired it long,But died without the sight!</verse><verse>The watchmen join their voice,And tuneful notes employ;Jerusalem breaks forth in songs,And deserts learn the joy.</verse>

data.title: Seeking the Lost
data.preview: <verse>Seeking the lost, yes, kindly entreatingWanderers on
data.data: <verse>Seeking the lost, yes, kindly entreatingWanderers on the mountain astray;"Come unto Me," His message repeating,Words of the Master speaking today.</verse><chorus>Going afar (going afar)Upon the mountain (upon the mountain)Bringing the wanderer back again, back again,Into the fold (into the fold)Of my Redeemer (of my Redeemer)Jesus the Lamb for sinners slain, for sinners slain.</chorus><verse>Seeking the lost and pointing to JesusSouls that are weak and hearts that are sore,Leading them forth in ways of salvation,Showing the path to life evermore.</verse><verse>Thus would I go on missions of mercy,Following Christ from day unto day,Cheering the faint and raising the fallen,Pointing the lost to Jesus, the Way.</verse>

data.title: Jesus, With Thy Church Abide
data.preview: <verse>Jesus, with Thy church abide;Be her Savior, Lord, and
data.data: <verse>Jesus, with Thy church abide;Be her Savior, Lord, and Guide,While on earth her faith is tried:We beseech Thee, hear us.</verse><verse>May her voice be ever clear,Warning of a judgment near,Telling of a Savior dear:We beseech Thee, hear us.</verse><verse>May she guide the poor and blind,Seek the lost until she find,And the broken hearted bind:We beseech Thee, hear us.</verse><verse>May she holy triumps win,Overthrow the hosts of sin,Gather all the nations in:We beseech Thee, hear us.</verse>

data.title: Work, for the Night Is Coming
data.preview: <verse>Work for the night is coming,Work through the morning
data.data: <verse>Work for the night is coming,Work through the morning hours;Work while the dew is sparkling;Work 'mid springing flow'rs.Work when the day grows brighter,Work in the glowing sun;Work for the night is coming,When man's work is done.</verse><verse>Work for the night is coming,Work thro' the sunny noon;Fill brightest hours with labor,Rest comes sure and soon.Give every flying minuteSomething to keep in store;Work for the night is coming,When man works no more.</verse><verse>Work for the night is coming,Under the sunset skies;While their bright tints are glowing,Work for daylight flies.Work till the last beam fadeth,Fadeth to shine no more;Work while the night is dark'ning,When man's work is o'er.</verse>

data.title: All Things Are Thine
data.preview: <verse>All things are Thine; no gift have we,Lord of all gif
data.data: <verse>All things are Thine; no gift have we,Lord of all gifts, to offer Thee;And hence with grateful hearts today,Thine own before Thy feet we lay.</verse><verse>Thy will was in the builder's thought;Thy hand unseen amidst us wrought;Thro' mortal motive, scheme and plan,Thy wise, eternal purpose ran.</verse><verse>No lack Thy perfect fullness knew;For human needs and longings grewThis house of prayer- this home of rest.Here may Thy saints be often blessed.</verse><verse>In weakness and in want we callOn Thee, for whom the heav'ns are small;Thy glory is Thy children's good,Thy joy Thy tender Fatherhood.</verse><verse>O Father! deign these walls to bless;Make this the abode of righteousness,And let these doors a gateway beTo lead us from ourselves to Thee!</verse>

data.title: Go Forth, Go Forth With Christ
data.preview: <verse>Go forth, go forth with Christ,Who called you to this
data.data: <verse>Go forth, go forth with Christ,Who called you to this day,He who has led, will leadAnd keep you in His way:His word is fast, His promise sureTo all who serve Him and endure.</verse><verse>Go forth, go forth with Christ,With purpose not your own,Each vict'ry you shall gainThrough Him your Lord alone:To guard you in fidelityHis Spirit shall your strength'ner be.</verse><verse>Go forth, go forth with Christ,His Priesthood you shall share,Who bought us by His bloodTo be His servants here:Walk in the way your Savior trod,Go forth with Him, go forth with God.</verse>

data.title: Go, Preach My Gospel
data.preview: <verse>"Go, preach My gospel," saith the Lord;&quo
data.data: <verse>"Go, preach My gospel," saith the Lord;"Bid the whole world My grace receive;He shall be saved who trusts My word,And they condemned who disbelieve.</verse><verse>"I'll make your great commission known,And ye shall prove My gospel trueBy all the works that I have done,By all the wonders ye shall do.</verse><verse>"Teach all the nations My commands;I'm with you till the world shall end;All power is vested in My hands;I can destroy, and I defend."</verse><verse>He spake, and light shone round His head;On a bright cloud to heaven He rode;They to the farthest nations spreadThe grace of their ascended Lord.</verse>

data.title: We Give This Child to You
data.preview: <verse>We give this child to You,Our precious gift of love.H
data.data: <verse>We give this child to You,Our precious gift of love.Help us to lead each step arightWith guidance from above.</verse><verse>O bless each child of Yours,And grant when they are grown,They will have learned to love Your way,And choose it for their own.</verse><verse>We give ourselves to You,And may Your Spirit fillOur hearts and home, that all we doBe subject to Your will.</verse>

data.title: Welcome, Day of Sweet Repose
data.preview: <verse>Welcome, day of sweet repose!Blessed be thy sacred ho
data.data: <verse>Welcome, day of sweet repose!Blessed be thy sacred hours!We would trust the One who knowsAll our weak and failing powers.</verse><verse>Welcome, day in Eden born!Holy rest for sinless man!Like the dawning of fair mornCome thy hours to us again.</verse><verse>Welcome, day blessed by our Lord!Toil shall cease and anxious care.Day commanded by His word,Day for song and praise and prayer.</verse><verse>Welcome, day our Savior kept!Keeping, wrought our righteousness,Day God bids us ne'er forget,Day of days His name to bless.</verse>

data.title: Holy Sabbath Day of Rest
data.preview: <verse>Holy Sabbath day of rest,By our Master richly blest,G
data.data: <verse>Holy Sabbath day of rest,By our Master richly blest,God created and divine,Set aside for holy time.</verse><chorus>Yes, the holy Sabbath rest,By our God divinely blest,It to us a sign shall beThroughout all eternity.</chorus><verse>Seek not pleasures of this earth,With its folly, noise, and mirth,There are better things in store,Over on the other shore.</verse><verse>As the Sabbath draweth onFriday eve at set of sun,Christian household then should meet,Sing and pray at Jesus'feet.</verse><verse>Asking Him for saving grace,Also vict'ry in the race,And to help us by His pow'r,To keep holy every hour.</verse>

data.title: O Day of Rest and Gladness
data.preview: <verse>O day of rest and gladness,O day of joy and light,O b
data.data: <verse>O day of rest and gladness,O day of joy and light,O balm of care and sadness,Most beautiful, most bright;On thee, the high and lowly,Who bend before throne,Sing, "Holy, holy, holy,"To the Eternal One.</verse><verse>Thou art a port protectedFrom storms that round us rise;A garden intersectedWith streams of paradise;Thou art a cooling fountainIn life's dry, dreary sand;From thee, like Pisgah's mountain,We view our promised land.</verse><verse>A day of sweet reflection,Thou art a day of love,A day to raise affectionFrom earth to things above.New graces ever gainingFrom this our day of rest,We reach the rest remainingIn mansions of the blessed.</verse>

data.title: O Day of Rest and Gladness
data.preview: <verse>O day of rest and gladness,O day of joy and light,O b
data.data: <verse>O day of rest and gladness,O day of joy and light,O balm of care and sadness,Most beautiful, most bright,On thee the high and lowlyWho bend before the throneSing, "Holy, holy, holy,"To the Eternal One.</verse><verse>Thou art a port protectedFrom storms that round us rise;A garden intersectedWith streams of paradise;Thou art a cooling fountainIn life's dry dreary sand;From Thee, like Pisgah's mountain,We view our promised land.</verse><verse>A day of sweet reflectionThou art, a day of love,A day to raise affectionFrom earth to things above.New graces ever gainingFrom this our day of rest,We seek the rest remainingIn mansions of the blest.</verse>

data.title: Safely Through Another Week
data.preview: <verse>Safely through another weekGod has brought us on our
data.data: <verse>Safely through another weekGod has brought us on our way;Let us now a blessing seek,Waiting in His courts today;Day of all the week the best,Emblem of eternal rest:Day of all the week the best,Emblem of eternal rest.</verse><verse>While we seek supplies of grace,Thro' the dear Redeemer's name,Show Thy reconciling face;Take away the sin and shame:From our worldly cares set free,May we rest this day in Thee:From our worldly cares set free,May we rest this day in Thee.</verse><verse>When the morn shall bid us rise,May we feel Thy presence near;May Thy glory meet our eyes,While we in Thy house appear:Here afford us, Lord, a tasteOf our everlasting feast:Here afford us, Lord, a tasteOf our everlasting feast.</verse><verse>May the gospel's joyful soundConquer sinners, comfort saints;Make the fruits of grace abound,Bring relief to all complaints:Thus may all our Sabbaths be,Till we we rise to reign with Thee.Thus may all our Sabbaths be,Till we we rise to reign with Thee.</verse>

data.title: Crowning Jewel of Creation
data.preview: <verse>Crowning jewel of creation,Blest and hallowed, sancti
data.data: <verse>Crowning jewel of creation,Blest and hallowed, sanctified;Time and changes all transcending,Shared forever, glorified.</verse><chorus>Blessed Sabbath made for man,Gift from the Creator's hand.</chorus><verse>Sin and sickness, prayer and weepingCease at close of earthly days;But Thy Sabbath is eternal,Joyful thanks to Thee we raise!</verse><verse>Teach us Lord, in storm or sunshineHow to truly rest in Thee,May Thy Sabbath peace enfold usAnd our shelter ever be.</verse>

data.title: The Sacred Anthem
data.preview: <verse>The sacred anthem slowly rangAcross the fields of pra
data.data: <verse>The sacred anthem slowly rangAcross the fields of praise,When earth's first Sabbath made completeAll creatures and all days.Walking with God, there,Woman and man together shareThe blessed Sabbath mood;And in that green and golden worldKnow all God's works are good.</verse><verse>But now in our diminished livesWe sing a blemished song;The earth is worn and disarrayedAnd all our work goes wrong.Still in our worship,Joining in praise and fellowship,By Sabbath radiance blessed,We put our doubt and fear awayAnd rest within God's rest.</verse><verse>And arching over time and spaceThe Lord of Sabbaths willsRenewal for the weary earthAnd healing for our ills.Hearts will rejoice then;There will be no more weeping, whenWe know and shall be known.With hosts of the redeemed we'll singAround God's shining throne.</verse>

data.title: Come, O Sabbath Day
data.preview: <verse>Peace and healing on thy wing;And to every troubled b
data.data: <verse>Peace and healing on thy wing;And to every troubled breastSpeak of the divine behest:Thou shalt rest, Thou shalt rest!</verse><verse>Earthly longings bid retire,Quench the passions' hurtful fire;To the wayward, sin oppressed,Bring thou thy divine behest:Thou shalt rest, Thou shalt rest!</verse><verse>Wipe from every cheek the tear,Banish care and silence fear;All things working for the best,Teach us the divine behest:Thou shalt rest, Thou shalt rest!</verse>

data.title: Don't Forget the Sabbath
data.preview: <verse>Don't forget the Sabbath,The Lord our God hath blest,
