data.data: <verse>Don't forget the Sabbath,The Lord our God hath blest,Of all the week the brightest,Of all the week the best;It brings repose from labor,It tells of joy divine,Its beams of light descending,With heavenly beauty shine.</verse><chorus>Welcome, welcome, ever welcome,Blessed Sabbath day,Welcome, welcome, ever welcome,Blessed Sabbath day.</chorus><verse>Keep the Sabbath holy,And worship Him today,Who said to His disciples,"I am the living way;"And if we meekly followOur Savior here below,He'll give us of the fountainWhose streams eternal flow.</verse><verse>Day of sacred pleasure!Its golden hours we'll spendIn thankful hymns to Jesus,The children's dearest Friend;O gentle loving, Savior,How good and kind Thou art,How precious is Thy promiseTo dwell in every heart!</verse>

data.title: Light of Light, Enlighten Me
data.preview: <verse>Light of light, enlighten me,Now anew the day is dawn
data.data: <verse>Light of light, enlighten me,Now anew the day is dawning;Sun of grace, the shadows flee;Brighten Thou my Sabbath morning;With Thy joyous sunshine blest,Happy is my day of rest.</verse><verse>Let me with my heart today,Holy, holy, holy, singing,Rapt awhile from earth away,All my soul to Thee up springing,Have a foretaste inward givenHow they worship Thee in heaven.</verse><verse>Hence all care, all vanity!For the day to God is holy;Come, Thou glorious Majesty,Deign to fill this temple lowly;Nought today my soul shall move,Simply resting in Thy love.</verse>

data.title: We Love Thy Sabbath, Lord
data.preview: <verse>We love Thy Sabbath, Lord,And worship at Thy will;Oh
data.data: <verse>We love Thy Sabbath, Lord,And worship at Thy will;Oh may these hours sweet peace affordAnd deeper faith instill.</verse><verse>Thine angels sang for joyCreation's work to see;We too, this day, would raise our heartsIn grateful praise to Thee.</verse><verse>Praise for Thy wondrous love,That sealed this sacred day,A sign that all may understandWe own Thy sovereign sway.</verse><verse>O great Creator King,Through Thy redeeming grace,Renew and sanctify our heartsThat we may see Thy face.</verse><verse>And with the white-robed throng,Upon Mount Sion be,And joyful sing our Sabbath songThrough all eternity.</verse>

data.title: Welcome, Welcome, Day of Rest
data.preview: <verse>Welcome, welcome, day of rest, To the world in kindne
data.data: <verse>Welcome, welcome, day of rest, To the world in kindness given;Welcome to this humble breast,As the beaming light from heaven.</verse><verse>Day of calm and sweet repose,Gently now thy moments run;Balm to soothe our cares and woes,Till our labor here is done.</verse><verse>Holy day that most we prize,Day of solemn praise and prayer,Day to make the simple wise,O, how great thy blessings are!</verse><verse>Welcome, welcome, day of rest,With thy influence all divine;May thy hallowed hours be blessedTo this waiting heart of mine.</verse>

data.title: Dear Lord, We Come at Set of Sun
data.preview: <verse>Dear Lord, we come at set of sun,And at Your feet we
data.data: <verse>Dear Lord, we come at set of sun,And at Your feet we kneelTo worship You, Creator, King,This day, Your sign and seal.</verse><verse>Our earthly tasks we lay aside,According to Your Word,To enter now Your holy rest,The Sabbath of the Lord.</verse><verse>Sweet Sabbath rest, your sacred hoursAre as a golden chainThat reaches back to Eden's gateAnd points us home again.</verse><verse>And when this earth shall be renewed,And sin and death destroyed,Shall all redeemed each Sabbath dayStill meet to praise their God.</verse>

data.title: Lord of the Sabbath
data.preview: <verse>Lord of the Sabbath and its light,I hail Thy hallowed
data.data: <verse>Lord of the Sabbath and its light,I hail Thy hallowed day of rest;It is my weary soul's delight,The solace of my careworn breast,The solace of my careworn breast.</verse><verse>O sacred day of peace and joy,Thy hours are ever dear to me;Ne'er may a sinful thought destroyThe holy calm I find in thee,The holy calm I find in thee.</verse><verse>How sweetly now they glide along!How hallowed is the calm they yield!Transporting is their rapturous song,And heavenly visions seem revealed,And heavenly visions seem revealed.</verse><verse>O Jesus, let me ever hailThy presence with the day of rest;Then will Thy servant never failTo deem Thy Sabbath doubly blest,To deem Thy Sabbath doubly blest.</verse>

data.title: Far From All Care
data.preview: <verse>Far from all care we hail the Sabbath morning;O'er wa
data.data: <verse>Far from all care we hail the Sabbath morning;O'er waving fields and from the distant seaSwell notes of praise in harmony resoundingAs all creation turns her heart to Thee.</verse><verse>Though man alone, Lord, of Thy great creationFails now to laud Thee for Thy love and power,Yet still a remnant love Thee and rememberThy holy law and each sweet Sabbath hour.</verse><verse>Lord of the Sabbath, Savior and Creator,Calm now the throbbings of each troubled breast.Speak to our hearts the peace of Thy commandments,Breathe on each soul fair Eden's hallowed ret.</verse><verse>Strong in Thy might and quiet in Thy meekness,May we Thine image bear from day to day.Then may we enter pearly gates eternalAnd sing redemption's song each Sabbath day.</verse>

data.title: As Birds Unto the Genial Homeland
data.preview: <verse>As birds unto the genial homeland fly,The winter's co
data.data: <verse>As birds unto the genial homeland fly,The winter's cold and low'ring skies to flee,So seeks my soul Thy gracious presence hereAnd finds, O God, its rest and peace in Thee.</verse><verse>Here at Thy shrine we leave all vexing care,Forget the disappointment, grief and tear,And on the wings of hopeful song and prayerWe rise, and rising feel Thy Spirit here.</verse><verse>Bless all who spend this night in pain and woe,The burdened heart, the fainting, and distressed,Thy comfort send to darkened homes bereaved,Thy saving help to those by want oppressed.</verse><verse>Come, Sabbath joy, each trusting heart now fill,And blissful peace within our homes abide,May thankful praise each grateful heart now thrill,And to God's loving care their lives confide.</verse>

data.title: Lord God, Your Love Has Called Us Here
data.preview: <verse>Lord God, Your love has called us here,As we, by love
data.data: <verse>Lord God, Your love has called us here,As we, by love, for love were made.Your living likeness still we bearTho'marred, dishonored, disobeyed.We come, with all our heart and mindYour call to hear, Your love to find.</verse><verse>We come with self inflicted painsOf broken trust and chosen wrong,Half free, half bound by inner chains,By social forces swept along,By powers and systems close confined,Yet seeking hope for human kind.</verse><verse>Lord God, in Christ You call our name,And then receive us as Your own,Not thro' some merit, right, or claim,But by Your gracious love alone.We strain to glimpse Your mercy seat,And find You kneeling at our feet.</verse><verse>Then take the towel, and break the bread,And humble us, and call us friends.Suffer and serve till all are fedAnd show how grandly love intendsTo work till all creation sings,To fill all worlds, to crown all things.</verse><verse>Lord God, in Christ You set us freeYour life to live, Your joy to share.Give us Your Spirit's libertyTo turn from guilt and dull despairAnd offer all that faith can do,While love is making all things new.</verse>

data.title: An Upper Room
data.preview: <verse>An upper room did our Lord prepareFor those loved unt
data.data: <verse>An upper room did our Lord prepareFor those loved until the end:And His disciples still gather there,To celebrate their risen Friend.</verse><verse>And after supper He washed their feet,For service, too, is sacrament.In Him our joy shall be made completeSent out to serve, as He was sent.</verse><verse>A lasting gift Jesus gave His own:To share His bread, His loving cup.Whatever burdens may bow us down,He by His cross shall lift us up.</verse><verse>No end there is! we depart in peace.He loves beyond our uttermost:In every room in our Father's house,He will be there, as Lord and host.</verse>

data.title: Bread of the World
data.preview: <verse>Bread of the world in mercy broken,Wine of the soul i
data.data: <verse>Bread of the world in mercy broken,Wine of the soul in mercy shed,By whom the words of life are spoken,And in whose death our sins are dead;</verse><verse>Look on the heart by sorrow broken,Look on the tears by sinners shed;And be Thy feast to us the tokenThat by Thy grace our souls are fed. Amen.</verse>

data.title: Beneath the Forms of Outward Rite
data.preview: <verse>Beneath the forms of outward riteThy supper, Lord, is
data.data: <verse>Beneath the forms of outward riteThy supper, Lord, is spreadIn every quiet upper roomWhere fainting souls are fed.</verse><verse>The bread is always consecrateWhich men divide with men;And every act of brotherhoodRepeats Thy feast again.</verse><verse>The blessed cup is only passedTrue memory of Thee,When life anew pours out its wineWith rich sufficiency.</verse><verse>O Master, through these symbols shared,Thine own dear self impart,That in our daily life may flameThe passion of Thy heart.</verse>

data.title: I Come With Joy
data.preview: <verse>I come with joy to meet my Lord,Forgiven, loved and f
data.data: <verse>I come with joy to meet my Lord,Forgiven, loved and free,In awe and wonder to recallHis life laid down for me,His life laid down for me.</verse><verse>I come with Christians far and nearTo find, as all are fed,Our true community of loveIn Christ's communion bread,In Christ's communion bread.</verse><verse>As Christ breaks bread for us to shareEach proud division ends.That love that made us makes us one,And strangers now are friends,And strangers now are friends.</verse><verse>And thus with joy we meet our Lord.His presence always near,Is in such friendship better known:We see and praise Him here,We see and praise Him here.</verse><verse>Together met, together bound,We'll go our diff'rent ways,And as His people in the world,We'll live and speak His praise,We'll live and speak His praise.</verse>

data.title: In Imitation, Lord of Thee
data.preview: <verse>In imitation, Lord, of Thee,This solemn service we re
data.data: <verse>In imitation, Lord, of Thee,This solemn service we repeat;For Thine example full of grace,Has made this humble duty sweet. </verse><verse>Renew each sacred spark of love,And vitalize the holy flame;May union strong our hearts uniteWhile this we do in Jesus' name. </verse><verse>Our great example Thou shalt be,In washing Thy disciples feet;And as we follow Thy command,Make Thou our fellowship complete. </verse>

data.title: By Christ Redeemed
data.preview: <verse>By Christ redeemed, In Christ restored,We keep the me
data.data: <verse>By Christ redeemed, In Christ restored,We keep the memory adored,And show the death of our dear Lord,Until He come.</verse><verse>His broken body in our stead Is here,In this memorial bread;And so our feeble love is fed,Until He come.</verse><verse>His fearful drops of agony,His life blood shed for us we see;The wine shall tell the mystery,Until He come.</verse><verse>And thus that dark betrayal night,With the last advent unite----The shame, the glory, by this rite,Until He come.</verse>

data.title: Let Us Break Bread Together
data.preview: <verse>Let us break bread together on our knees,Let us break
data.data: <verse>Let us break bread together on our knees,Let us break bread together on our knees.When I fall on my knees with my face to the rising sun,O Lord, have mercy on me.</verse><verse>Let us drink wine together on our knees,Let us drink wine together on our knees.When I fall on my knees with my face to the rising sun,O Lord, have mercy on me.</verse><verse>Let us praise God together on our knees,Let us praise God together on our knees.When I fall on my knees with my face to the rising sun,O Lord, have mercy on me.</verse>

data.title: Now Let Us From This Table Rise
data.preview: <verse>Now let us from this table riseRenewed in body, mind,
data.data: <verse>Now let us from this table riseRenewed in body, mind, and soul;With Christ we die and live again,His selfless love has made us whole. </verse><verse>With minds alert, upheld by grace,To spread the word in speech and deed,We follow in the steps of Christ,At one with all in hope and need. </verse><verse>To fill each human house with love,It is the sacrament of care;The work that Christ began to doWe humbly pledge ourselves to share. </verse><verse>Then grant us courage, Father God,To choose again the pilgrim wayAnd help us to accept with joyThe challenge of tomorrow's day.</verse>

data.title: O God, Unseen, Yet Ever Near
data.preview: <verse>O God, unseen, yet ever near,Reveal Thy presence nowW
data.data: <verse>O God, unseen, yet ever near,Reveal Thy presence nowWhile we in love that hath no fear,Before Thy glory bow.</verse><verse>Here may Thy faithful people knowThe blessings of Thy love,The streams that thro'  the dessert  flow,The manna from above.</verse><verse>We come, obedient to Thy WordTo  feast on heav'nly food,Our meat, the body of our Lord,Our drink, His precious blood.</verse><verse>Thus may we all Thy words obey,For we, O God, are Thine,And go rejoicing on our way,Renewed by strength divine.</verse>

data.title: Love Consecrates the Humblest Act
data.preview: <verse>Love consecrates the humblest actAnd haloes mercy's d
data.data: <verse>Love consecrates the humblest actAnd haloes mercy's deeds;It sheds a benediction sweetAnd hallows human needs.</verse><verse>When in the shadow of the crossChrist knelt and washed the feetOf His disciples, He gave usA sign of love complete.</verse><verse>Love serves and willing, stoops to serve;What Christ in love so trueHas freely done for one and all,Let us now gladly do!</verse>

data.title: Sent Forth by God's Blessing
data.preview: <verse>Sent forth by God's blessing, Our true faith confessi
data.data: <verse>Sent forth by God's blessing, Our true faith confessing,The people of God from His dwelling take leave.The supper is ended. Oh, now be extendedThe fruits of this service In all who believe.The seed of His teaching, Receptive souls reaching,Shall blossom in action For God and for all.His grace did invite us, His love shall unite usTo work for God's kingdom And answer His call.</verse><verse>With praise and thanks giving To God ever living,The tasks of our everyday Life we will face.Our faith ever sharing, In love ever caring,Embracing His children of Each tribe and race.With Your feast You feed us, With Your light now lead us;Unite us as one in this life That we share.Then may all the living With praise and thanks givingGive honor to Christ and His name that we bear.</verse>

data.title: Lord, Enthroned in Heavenly Splendor
data.preview: <verse>Lord, enthroned in heav'nly splendor,First begotten f
data.data: <verse>Lord, enthroned in heav'nly splendor,First begotten from the dead,You alone, our strong defender,Lifting up Your people's head.Alleluia, Jesus, true and  living Bread!</verse><verse>Tho' the lowliest form now veil YouAs of old in Bethlehem,Here as there Your angels hail YouBranch and flow'r of Jesse's stem.Alleluia, We in worship join with them.</verse><verse>Paschal Lamb, Your off'ring finishedOnce for all when You were slain,In its fullness undiminishedShall forever more remain.Alleluia, Cleansing souls from every stain.</verse><verse>Life imparting heav'nly manna,Stricken rock with streaming side,Heav'n and earth with loud hosannaWorship You the Lamb who died.Alleluia, Ris'n, ascended, glorified!</verse>

data.title: Jesus Invites His Saints
data.preview: <verse>Jesus invites His saintsTo meet around His board,And
data.data: <verse>Jesus invites His saintsTo meet around His board,And sup in memory of the deathAnd sufferings of their Lord.</verse><verse>We take the bread and wineAs emblems of Thy death;Lord, raise our souls above the sign,To feast on Thee by faith.</verse><verse>Faith eats the bread of life,And drinks the living wine;It looks beyond this scene of strifeUnites us to the Vine.</verse><verse>Soon shall the night be gone,Our Lord will come again;The marriage supper of the LambWill usher in His reign.</verse>

data.title: Thy Broken Body, Gracious Lord
data.preview: <verse>Thy broken body, gracious Lord,Is shadowed by this br
data.data: <verse>Thy broken body, gracious Lord,Is shadowed by this broken bread;The wine which in this cup is poured,Points to the blood which Thou hast shed.</verse><verse>And while we meet together thus,We show that we are one in Thee;Thy precious blood was shed for us,Thy death, O Lord, hast set us free!</verse><verse>We have one hope that Thou wilt come,Thee in the air we wait to see;When Thou wilt give Thy saints a home,And we shall ever reign with Thee.</verse>

data.title: The Son of God Proclaim
data.preview: <verse>The Son of God proclaim,The Lord of time and space;Th
data.data: <verse>The Son of God proclaim,The Lord of time and space;The God who bade the light break forthNow shines in Jesus' face.</verse><verse>Behold His out stretched  hands,Though all was in His powerHe took the towel and basin then,And serves us in this hour.</verse><verse>He, God's creative word,The church's Lord and head,Here bids us gather as His friends,And share His wine and bread.</verse><verse>The Lord of life and deathWith wondering praise we sing;We break the bread at His command,And name Him God and King.</verse><verse>We take this cup in hope:For He, who gladly boreThe shameful cross, is ris'n again,And reigns forevermore.</verse>

data.title: Cover With His Life
data.preview: <verse>Look upon Jesus, sinless is He;Father, impute His lif
data.data: <verse>Look upon Jesus, sinless is He;Father, impute His life unto me.My life of scarlet, my sin and woe,Cover with His life, whiter than snow.</verse><chorus>Cover with His life, whiter than snow;Fullness of His life then shall I know;My life of scarlet, my sin and woe,Cover with His life, whither than snow.</chorus><verse>Deep are the wounds transgression has made;Red are the stains; my soul is afraid.O to be covered, Jesus, with Thee,Safe from the law that now judgeth me!</verse><verse>Longing the joy of pardon to know;Jesus holds out a robe white as snow;"Lord, I accept it! Leaving my own,Gladly I wear Thy pure life alone."</verse><verse>Reconciled by His death for my sin,Justified by His life pure and clean,Sanctified by obeying His word,Glorified when returneth my Lord.</verse>

data.title: God Has Spoken by His Prophets
data.preview: <verse>God has spoken by His prophets,Spoken His unchanging
data.data: <verse>God has spoken by His prophets,Spoken His unchanging Word,Each from age to age proclaimingGod, the one, the righteous Lord.Mid the world's despair and turmoil,One firm anchor holding fast;God is King, His throne eternal,God the first, and God the last.</verse><verse>God has spoken by Christ Jesus,Christ, the everlasting Son,Brightness of the Father's glory,With the Father ever one;Spoken by the Word incarnate,God of God, ere time began,Light of light, to earth descending,Man, revealing God to man.</verse><verse>God yet speaks by His own SpiritSpeaking to the hearts of men,In the age-long Word expoundingGod's own message, now as then;Through the rise and fall of nationsOne sure faith yet standing fast,God is King, His Word unchanging,God the first, and God the last.</verse>

data.title: Fruitful Trees, the Spirit's Sowing
data.preview: <verse>Fruitful trees, the Spirit's sowing,May we ripen and
data.data: <verse>Fruitful trees, the Spirit's sowing,May we ripen and increase,Fruit to life eternal growing,Rich in love and joy and peace.</verse><verse>Laden branches freely bearingGifts the Giver loves to bless;Here is fruit that grows by sharing,Patience, kindness, gentleness.</verse><verse>Rooted deep in Christ, our Master,Christ, our pattern and our goal,Teach us, as the years fly faster,Goodness, faith, and self control.</verse><verse>Fruitful trees, the Spirit's tending,May we grow till harvests cease;Till we taste, in life unending,Heaven's love and joy and peace.</verse>

data.title: Christ the Lord, All Power Possessing
data.preview: <verse>Christ, the Lord, all power possessing,Parting, mount
data.data: <verse>Christ, the Lord, all power possessing,Parting, mounted heaven's height,Gracious hands outstretched in blessing,Clouds received Him from their sight.Christ ascended, Christ ascended,Christ ascended on the clouds. (on the clouds)Christ ascended on the clouds.</verse><verse>Daniel views earth's judgment hour,Angels gathering open books.God enthroned in flaming powerFor His Son's arrival looks.Christ approaches, Christ approaches,Christ approaches on the clouds. (on the clouds)Christ approaches on the clouds.</verse><verse>Revelation's word fulfilling,Trumpet, voices pierce the air.Saint and sinner fainting, thrilling,Every eye behold Him there.Christ is coming, Christ is coming,Christ is coming on the clouds. (on the clouds)Christ is coming on the clouds.</verse>

data.title: The Judgment Has Set
data.preview: <verse>The judgment has set, the books have been opened;How
data.data: <verse>The judgment has set, the books have been opened;How shall we stand in that great day,When every thought, and word, and action,God, the righteous Judge, shall weigh?</verse><chorus>How shall we stand in that great day?How shall we stand in that great day?Shall we be found before Him wanting?Or with our sins all washed away?</chorus><verse>The work is begun with those who are sleeping,Soon will the living here be tried,Out of the books of God's remembrance,His decision to abide.</verse><verse>O, how shall we stand that moment of searching,When all our sins those books reveal?When from that court, each case decided,Shall be granted no appeal?</verse>

data.title: O Solemn Thought
data.preview: <verse>O solemn thought and can it beThe hour o judgment now
data.data: <verse>O solemn thought and can it beThe hour o judgment now is comeWhich soon must fix our destiny,And seal the sinner's fearful doom?Yes, it is so; the judgment hourIs swiftly hastening to its close;Then will the Judge, in mighty power,Descend in vengeance on His foes.</verse><verse>He who came down to earth to dieAn offering for the sins of men,And then ascended up on high,And will e'er long return again,Is standing now before the ark,And mercy seat and cherubim,To plead His blood for saints, and makeThe last remembrance of their sin.</verse><verse>The solemn moment is at handWhen we who have His name confessed,Each in his lot must singly standAnd pass the final, searching test.Jesus! we hope in Thee alone;In mercy now upon us look,Confess our names before the throne,And blot our sins from out Thy book.</verse><verse>O blessed Savior! may we feelThe full importance of this hour.Inspire our hearts with holy zeal,And aid us by Thy Spirit's power,That we may in Thy strength be strong,And brave the conflict valiantly;Then, on Mount Zion, join the song,And swell the notes of victory.</verse>

data.title: Day of Judgment, Day of Wonders!
data.preview: <verse>Day of judgement, day of wonders!Hark the trumpet's a
data.data: <verse>Day of judgement, day of wonders!Hark the trumpet's awful sound,Louder than a thousand thunders,Shakes the vast creation round!How the summonsWill the sinner's heart confound!</verse><verse>See the Lord in the glory nearing,Clothed in majesty divine,You who long for His appearing,Then shall say, "This God is mine!"Gracious Savior, Gracious Savior,Own me in that day as Thine.</verse><verse>At His call the dead awaken,Rise to life form earth and sea!All the powers of nature shakenBy His looks prepare to flee.Careless sinner, Careless sinner,What will then become of thee?</verse><verse>But to those who have confessedLoved and served the Lord below,He will say, "Come near, ye blessed,See the kingdom I bestow;You forever, You foreverShall my love and glory know."</verse>

data.title: Soon Shall the Trump of God
data.preview: <verse>Soon shall the trump of GodGive out the welcome sound
data.data: <verse>Soon shall the trump of GodGive out the welcome sound,That shakes death's silent chamber walls,And breaks the turf sealed ground.</verse><verse>You dwellers in the dust,Awake, come forth, and sing;Sharp has your frost of winter been,But bright shall be your spring.</verse><verse>'Twas sown in weakness here;'Twill then be raised in power;That which was sown in earthly seed  Shall rise a heav'nly flower.</verse>

data.title: Jerusalem, My Happy Home
data.preview: <verse>Jerusalem, my happy home,O how I long for thee!When w
data.data: <verse>Jerusalem, my happy home,O how I long for thee!When will my sorrows have an end,The joys when shall I see?</verse><verse>The walls are all of precious stone,Most glorious to behold;Thy gates are richly set with pearl,Thy streets are paved with gold.</verse><verse>Thy garden and thy pleasant walksMy study long have been;Such dazzling views by human sightHave never yet been seen.</verse><verse>Lord, help us by Thy mighty grace,To keep in view the prize,Till Thou dost come to take us homeTo that blessed paradise.</verse>

data.title: For All the Saints
data.preview: <verse>For all the saintsWho from their labors rest,Who Thee
data.data: <verse>For all the saintsWho from their labors rest,Who Thee by faithBefore the world confessed.Thy name, O Jesus,Be forever blest.Alleluia!Alleluia!</verse><verse>Thou wast their Rock,Their Fortress and their Might;Thou, Lord, their CaptainIn the well-fought fight;Thou, in the darkness drear,Their one true Light.Alleluia!Alleluia!</verse><verse>O may Thy soldiers,Faithful, true, and bold,Fight as the saintsWho nobly fought of old,And win with themThe victor's crown of gold.Alleluia!Alleluia!</verse><verse>And when the strife is fierce,The warfare long,Steals on the earThe distant triumph song,And hearts are brave again,And arms are strong.Alleluia!Alleluia!</verse><verse>From earth's wide bounds,From ocean's farthest coast,Thro' gates of pearlStreams in the countless host,Singing to Father,Son, and Holy Ghost,Alleluia!Alleluia!</verse>

data.title: Marching to Zion
data.preview: <verse>Come, we that love the Lord,And let our joys be known
data.data: <verse>Come, we that love the Lord,And let our joys be known;Join in a song with sweet accord,Join in a song with sweet accord,And thus surround the throne,And thus surround the throne.</verse><chorus>We're marching to Zion,Beautiful, beautiful Zion;We're marching upward to Zion,The beautiful city of God.</chorus><verse>Let those refuse to singWho never knew our God;But children of the heav'nly King,But children of the heav'nly KingMay speak their joys abroad,May speak their joys abroad.</verse><verse>The hill of Zion yieldsA thousand sacred sweetsBefore we reach the heav'nly fields,Before we reach the heav'nly fieldsOr walk the golden streets,Or walk the golden streets.</verse><verse>Then let our songs aboundAnd ev'ry tear be dry;We're marching thru Immanuel's ground,We're marching thru Immanuel's groundTo fairer worlds on high,To fairer worlds on high.</verse>

data.title: Glorious Things of Thee Are Spoken
data.preview: <verse>Glorious things of thee are spoken,Zion, city of our
data.data: <verse>Glorious things of thee are spoken,Zion, city of our God;He whose word cannot be brokenFormed thee for His own abode;On the Rock of Ages founded,What can shake thy sure repose?With salvation's wall surrounded,Thou mayest smile at all thy foes.</verse><verse>See the streams of living watersSpringing from eternal love,Well supply thy sons and daughters,And all fear and want remove;Who can faint when such a riverEver flows their thirst to assuage?Grace, which, like the Lord, the Giver,Never fails from age to age.</verse><verse>Round each habitation hovering,See the cloud and fire appearFor a glory and a covering,Showing that the Lord is near;Blest inhabitants of Zion,Washed in the Redeemer's blood;Jesus, whom their souls rely on,Makes them kings and priests to God.</verse><verse>Savior, if of Zion's cityI, through grace, a member am,Let the world deride or pity,I will glory in Thy name;Fading is the worldling's pleasure,All his boasted pomp and show;Solid joys and lasting treasureNone but Zion's children know.</verse>

data.title: For Thee, O Dear, Dear Country
data.preview: <verse>For thee, O dear country,Mine eyes their vigils keep
data.data: <verse>For thee, O dear country,Mine eyes their vigils keep;For very love beholdingThy holy name, they weep.The mention of thy gloryIs unction to the breast,And medicine in sickness,And love, and life, and rest.</verse><verse>O one, O only mansion!O Paradise of joy!Where tears are ever banish'dAnd smiles have no alloy;Thy loveliness oppressesAll human thought and heart,And none, O Peace, O Sion,Can sing thavas thou art.</verse><verse>With jasper glow thy bulwarks,Thy streets with emeralds blaze;The sardius and the topazUnite in thee  their rays;Thine ageless walls are bondedWith amethyst unpriced;The saints shall build thy fabric,And the cornerstone is Christ.</verse><verse>The cross is all thy splendor,The Crucified thy praise;His laud and benedictionThy ransom'd saints shall raise;Upon the Rock of AgesThey build thy holy tower;Thine is the victor\'s laurel,And thine the golden dower.</verse><verse>O sweet and blessed country,The home of God's elect!O sweet and blessed countryThat eager hearts expect!Jesus, in mercy bring usTo that dear land of rest,Who art, with God the Father,And Spirit, ever blest.</verse>

data.title: Holy, Holy, Is What the Angels Sing
data.preview: <verse>There is singing up in heavenSuch as we have never kn
data.data: <verse>There is singing up in heavenSuch as we have never known,Where the angels sing the praisesOf the Lamb upon the throne;Their sweet harps are ever tunefulAnd their voices always clear,O that we might be more like themWhile we serve the Master here!</verse><chorus>Holy, holy, is what the angels sing,And I expect to help them makeThe courts of heaven ring;But when I sing redemption's story,They will fold their wings,For angels never felt the joysThat our salvation brings.</chorus><verse>But I hear another anthem,Blending voices clear and strong,"Unto Him who hath redeemed usAnd hath bought us," is the song;We have come thro' tribulationsTo this land so fair and bright,In the fountain freely flowingHe hath made our garments white.</verse><verse>Then the angels stand and listen,For they cannot join that song,Like the sound of many waters,By that happy, blood-washed throng;For they sing about great trials,Battles fought and vict'ries won,And they praise their great Redeemer,Who hath said to them, "Well done."</verse><verse>So, although I'm not an angel,Yet I know that over thereI will join  a blessed chorusThat the angels cannot share;I will sing about my Savior,Who upon dark CalvaryFreely pardoned my transgressions,Died to set the sinner free.</verse>

data.title: I Shall See the King
data.preview: <verse>I shall see the King Where the angels sing,I shall se
data.data: <verse>I shall see the King Where the angels sing,I shall see the King some day, In the better land,On that golden strand,And with Him shall ever stay.</verse><chorus>In His glory, I shall see the King,And forever endless praises sing;'Twas on Calvary Jesus died for me;I shall see the King someday.</chorus><verse>In the land of song, In the glory throng,Where there never comes a night,With my Lord once slain I shall ever reignIn the glory land of light.</verse><verse>I shall see the King, All my tributes bring,And shall look upon His face;Then my song shall be How He ransomed meAnd has kept me by His grace.</verse>

data.title: No Night There
data.preview: <verse>In the land of fadeless dayLies "the city four-s
data.data: <verse>In the land of fadeless dayLies "the city four-square;"It shall never pass away,And there is "no night there."</verse><chorus>God shall "wipe away all tears;"There's no death, no pain, nor fears;And they count not time by years,For there is "no night there."</chorus><verse>All the gates of pearl are made,In "the city four-square;"All the streets with gold are laid,And there is "no night there."</verse><verse>And the gates shall never closeTo "the city four-square;"There life's crystal river flows,And there is "no night there."</verse><verse>There they need no sunshine bright,In "that city four-square;"For the Lamb is all the light,And there is "no night there."</verse>

data.title: Sweet By and By
data.preview: <verse>There's a land that is fairer than day,And by faith w
data.data: <verse>There's a land that is fairer than day,And by faith we can see it afar;For the Father waits over the wayTo prepare us a dwelling place there.</verse><chorus>In the sweet (in the sweet<)br/>By and by (by and by),We shall meet on that beautiful shore;In the sweet (in the sweet)By and by (by and by)We shall meet on that beautiful shore.</chorus><verse>We shall sing on that beautiful shoreThe melodious songs of the blest,And our spirits shall sorrow no moreNot a sigh for the blessing of rest.</verse><verse>To our bountiful Father aboveWe will offer our tribute of praise;For the glorious gift of His loveAnd the blessings that hallow our days.</verse>

data.title: Jerusalem the Golden
data.preview: <verse>Jerusalem the golden,With milk and honey blest,Beneat
data.data: <verse>Jerusalem the golden,With milk and honey blest,Beneath thy contemplationSink heart and voice oppressed.I know not, O I know notWhat holy joys are there;What radiancy of glory,What bliss beyond compare.</verse><verse>They stand, those halls of Zion,All jubilant with song,And bright with many an angel,And all the martyr throng.The Prince is ever in them,The daylight is serene;The pastures of the blessedAre decked in glorious sheen.</verse><verse>There is the throne of David,And there, from care released,The shout of them that triumph,The song of them that feast;And they who, with their Leader,Have conquered in the fight,Forever and foreverAre clad in robes of white.</verse><verse>O sweet and blessed country,The home of God's elect!O sweet and blessed country,That eager hearts expect!Jesus, in mercy bring usTo  that dear land of rest;Who art, with God the Father,And Spirit, ever blest.</verse>

data.title: Joy By and By
data.preview: <verse>O there'll be joy when the work is done,Joy when the
data.data: <verse>O there'll be joy when the work is done,Joy when the reapers gather home,Bringing the sheaves at set of sunTo the New Jerusalem.</verse><chorus>Joy, (joy) joy, there'll be joy by and by,Joy, (joy) joy, where the joys never die;Joy, (joy) joy, for the day draweth nighWhen the workers gather home.</chorus><verse>Sweet are the songs that we hope to sing,Grateful the thanks our hearts shall bring,Praising forever Christ our KingIn the New Jerusalem.</verse><verse>Pure are the joys that await us there,Many the golden mansions fair;Jesus Himself doth them prepare,In the New Jerusalem.</verse>

data.title: Over Yonder
data.preview: <verse>Come let us sing of homeland,Down by the crystal sea;
data.data: <verse>Come let us sing of homeland,Down by the crystal sea;Wonderful land where JesusBuildeth a mansion for me.</verse><chorus>Over yonder, down by the crystal sea,Over yonder, there's where I long to be,No more sorrow, toil, grief, nor care,In the homeland bright and fair,Over, over there.</chorus><verse>Water of life there floweth,Fruit in abundant store;Citizens of that countryHunger and thirst never more.</verse><verse>Come go with me to homeland,Jesus invites you there;Help spread the invitation,Tell it to men everywhere.</verse>

data.title: Shall We Gather at the River
data.preview: <verse>Shall we gather at the river,Where bright angel feet
data.data: <verse>Shall we gather at the river,Where bright angel feet have trod,With its crystal tide foreverFlowing by the throne of God?</verse><chorus>Yes, we'll gather at the river,The beautiful, the beautiful river;Gather with the saints at the riverThat flows by the throne of God.</chorus><verse>On the margin of the river,Washing up its silver spray,We will walk and worship ever,All the happy golden day.</verse><verse>Ere we reach the shining river,Lay we every burden down;Grace our spirits will deliver,And provide a robe and crown.</verse><verse>Soon we'll reach the shining river,Soon our pilgrimage will cease;Soon our happy hearts will quiverWith the melody of peace.</verse>

data.title: Ten Thousand Times Ten Thousand
data.preview: <verse>Ten thousand times ten thousand,In sparkling raiment
data.data: <verse>Ten thousand times ten thousand,In sparkling raiment bright,The armies of the ransomed saintsThrong up the steeps of light.'Tis finished, all is finished,Their fight with death and sin.Fling open wide the golden gates,And let the victors in.</verse><verse>What rush of hallelujahsFills all the earth and sky!The ringing of a thousand harpsProclaims the triumph high.O day for which creationAnd all its tribes were made!O joy, for all its former woesA thousandfold repaid!</verse><verse>O then what raptured greetingsOn Canaan's happy shore!What knitting severed friendship whereDeath partings are no more!Then eyes with joy shall sparkle,That brimmed with tears of late;Orphans no longer fatherless,Nor widows desolate.</verse><verse>Bring near Thy great salvation,Thou Lamb for sinners slain,Fill up the roll of Thine elect,Then take Thy power and reign!Appear, Desire of nations,Thine exiles long for home;Show in the heavens Thy promised sign;Thou Prince and Savior come!</verse>

data.title: We Speak of the Realms
data.preview: <verse>We speak of the realms of the blest,That country so b
data.data: <verse>We speak of the realms of the blest,That country so bright and so fair,And oft are its glories confessed-But what must it be to be there!We speak of its pathway of gold-Its walls decked with jewels so rare,Its wonders and pleasures untold-But what must it be to be there!</verse><verse>We speak of its freedom of sin,From sorrow, temptation and care,From trials without and within---But what must it be to be there!We speak of its service of love,Of the robes which the glorified wear,Of the church of the First Born above-But what must it  be to be there!</verse><verse>Our mourning is all at an end,When, raised by the life-giving word,We see the new city descend,Adorned as a bride for her Lord;The city so holy and clean,No sorrow can breathe in the air;No gloom of affliction or sin,No shadow of evil, is there.</verse><verse>Do Thou, midst temptation and woe,For heaven my spirit prepare;And shortly I also shall knowAnd feel what it is to be there.Then o'er the bright fields we shall roam,In glory celestial and fair,With saints and with angels at home,And Jesus Himself will be there.</verse>

data.title: The Glory Song
data.preview: <verse>When all my labors and trails are o'er,And I am safe
data.data: <verse>When all my labors and trails are o'er,And I am safe on that beautiful shore,Just to be near the Lord I adore,Will through the ages be glory for me.</verse><chorus>O that will beGlory for me, Glory for me,Glory for me; When by His graceI shall look on His face,That will be glory, be glory for me.</chorus><verse>When, by the gift of His infinite grace,I am accorded in heaven a place,Just to be there and to look on His face,Will through the ages be glory for me.</verse><verse>Friends will be there I have loved long ago;Joy like a river around me will flow,Yet, just a smile form my Savior, I know,Will through the ages be glory for me.</verse>

data.title: The Homeland
data.preview: <verse>The homeland! O the homeland!The land of the free bor
data.data: <verse>The homeland! O the homeland!The land of the free born!There's no night in the homeland,But aye the fadeless morn;I'm sighing for homeland,My heart is aching here;There is no pain in the homelandTo which I'm drawing near;There is no pain in the homelandTo which I'm drawing near.</verse><verse>My Lord is in the homeland,With angels bright and fair;There's no sin in the homeland,And no temptation there;The music of the homelandIs ringing in my ears;And when I think of the homelandMy eyes are filled with tears;And when I think of the homelandMy  ears are filled with tears.</verse><verse>The dwellers in the homelandAre beckoning me to come,Where neither death nor sorrowInvades their holy name;O dear, dear native country!O rest and peace above!Christ bring us all to the homelandOf Thy redeeming love;Christ bring us all to the homelandOf  Thy redeeming love</verse>

data.title: I'm Going Home
data.preview: <verse>My heav'nly home is bright and fair,Nor pain nor deat
data.data: <verse>My heav'nly home is bright and fair,Nor pain nor death can enter there;It's glitt'ring tow'rs the sun outshine,That heav'nly mansion shall me mine.</verse><chorus>I'm going home, I'm going home,I'm going home to die no more;To die no more; to die no more-I'm going home to die no more.</chorus><verse>My Father's house is built on high,Far, far above the starry sky;When from this earthly prison free,That heav'nly mansion mine shall be.</verse><verse>Let others seek a home below,Which flames devour or waves o'er flow;Be mine a happier lot to ownA heav'nly mansion near the throne.</verse>

data.title: You Will See Your Lord A-Coming
data.preview: </verse><chorus>Hear the band of music,Hear the band of musi
data.data: </verse><chorus>Hear the band of music,Hear the band of music,Hear the band of musicWhich is sounding thro' the air.<verse>You will see your Lord acoming,You will see your Lord acoming,You will see your Lord acomingIn a few more days.</chorus><verse>Gabriel sounds his mighty trumpet,Gabriel sounds his mighty trumpet,Gabriel sounds his mighty trumpetIn a few more days.</verse><verse>You will see the saints arising,You will see the saints arising,You will see the saints arisingIn a few more days.</verse><verse>Angels bear them to the Savior,Angels bear them to the Savior,Angels bear them to the SaviorIn a few more days.</verse><verse>Then we'll shout, our suff'ring over,Then we'll shout, our suff'ring over,Then we'll shout, our suff'ring overIn a few more days.</verse>

data.title: How Far From Home?
data.preview: <verse>How far from home? I asked, as onI bent my steps-the
data.data: <verse>How far from home? I asked, as onI bent my steps-the watchman spake:"The long, dark night is almost gone,The morning soon  will break.Then weep no more, but speed thy flight,With Hope's bright star guiding ray,Till thou shalt reach the realms of light,In everlasting days."</verse><verse>I asked the warrior on the field;This was his soul-inspiring song:"With courage, bold, the sword I'll wield,The battle is not long.Then weep no more, but well endureThe conflict, till thy work is done;For this we know, the prize is sure,When victory is won."</verse><verse>I asked again; earth, sea, and sunSeemed, with one voice, to make reply:"Time's wasting sands are nearly run,Eternity is nigh.Then weep no more-with warning tones,Portentous signs are thickening round,The whole creation, waiting, groans,To hear the trumpet sound."</verse><verse>Not far from home! O blessed thought!The traveler's lonely heart to cheer;Which oft a healing balm has brought,And dried the mourner's tear.Then weep no more, since we shall meetWhere weary footsteps never roam-Our trials past, our joys complete,Safe in our Father's home.</verse>

data.title: How Cheering Is the Christian's Hope
data.preview: <verse>How cheering is the Christian's hope,While toiling he
data.data: <verse>How cheering is the Christian's hope,While toiling here below!It bouys us up while this passing throughThis wilderness of woe,</verse><verse>It bouys us up while passing throughThis wilderness of woe,It bouys us up while passing throughThis wilderness of woe.</verse><verse>It points us to a land of rest,Where saints with Christ will reign;Where we shall meet the loved of earth,And never part again.</verse><verse>Fly, lingering moments, fly, O, fly,Dear Savior, quickly come!We long to see Thee as Thou art,And reach that blissful home.</verse>

data.title: I Saw One Weary
data.preview: <verse>I saw one weary, sad, and torn,With eager steps press
data.data: <verse>I saw one weary, sad, and torn,With eager steps press on the way,Who long the hallowed cross had borne,Still looking for the promised day;While many a line of grief and care,Upon his brow was furrowed there;I asked what buoyed his spirits up,"O this"  said he-"the blessed hope."</verse><verse>And one I saw, with sword and shield,Who boldly braved the world's cold frown,And fought, unyielding, on the field,To win an everlasting crown.Though worn with toil, oppressed by foes,No murmur from his heart arose;I asked what buoyed his spirits up,"O this!" said he-"the blessed hope."</verse><verse>And there was one who left behindThe cherished friends of early years,And honor, pleasure, wealth re-signed,To tread the path be-dewed with tears.Through trials deep and conflicts sore,Yet still a smile of joy he wore;O! what can bouy the spirit up?'Tis this alone-the blessed hope.</verse><verse>While pilgrims here we journey onIn this dark vale of sin and gloom,Through tribulation, hate, and scorn,Or through the portals of the tomb,Till our returning King shall comeTo take His exile captives home,O! what can bouy the spirits up?'Tis this alone-- the blessed hope.</verse>

data.title: How Sweet Are the Tidings
data.preview: <verse>How sweet  are the tidings that greet the pilgrim's e
data.data: <verse>How sweet  are the tidings that greet the pilgrim's ear,As he wanders in exile from home!Soon, soon will the Savior in glory appear,And soon will the kingdom come.</verse><chorus>He's coming, coming, coming soon I know,Coming back to this earth again;And the weary pilgrims will to glory go,When the Savior comes to reign.</chorus><verse>The mossy old graves where the pilgrims sleepShall be open as wide as before,And the millions that sleep in the mighty deepShall live on this earth once more.</verse><verse>There we'll meet ne'er to part in our happy Eden home,Sweet songs of redemption we'll sing;From the north, from the south, all the ransomed shall come,And worship our heavenly King.</verse><verse>Hallelujah, Amen! Hallelujah again!Soon, if faithful, we all shall be there;O, be watchful, be hopeful, be joyful till then,And a crown of bright glory we'll wear.</verse>

data.title: There'll Be No Sorrow There
data.preview: <verse>There'll be no night in heaven,In that blest world ab
data.data: <verse>There'll be no night in heaven,In that blest world above;No anxious toil, no weary hours;For labor there is love.</verse><chorus>There'll be no sorrow there,There'll be no sorrow there;In heaven above, where all is love,There'll be no sorrow there.</chorus><verse>There'll be no grief in heaven;For life is one glad day,And tears are those of former thingsWhich all have passed away.</verse><verse>There'll be no sin in heaven;Behold that blessed throng,All holy in their spotless robes,All holy in their  song.</verse>

data.title: I'm a Pilgrim
data.preview: <verse>I'm a pilgrim, and I'm a stranger;I can tarry, I can
data.data: <verse>I'm a pilgrim, and I'm a stranger;I can tarry, I can tarry but a night;Do not detain me, for I am goingTo where the fountains are ever flowing.</verse><chorus>I'm a pilgrim, and I'm a stranger;I can tarry, I can tarry but a night.</chorus><verse>There the glory is ever shining!O, my longing heart, my longing heart is there;Here in this country so dark and dreary,I long have wandered forlorn and weary.</verse><verse>There's the city to which I journey;My Redeemer, my Redeemer is its light!There is no sorrow, nor any sighing,Nor any tears there, or any dying.</verse>

data.title: I'm But a Stranger Here
data.preview: <verse>I'm but a stranger here,Heav'n is my home;Earth is a
data.data: <verse>I'm but a stranger here,Heav'n is my home;Earth is a desert drear,Heav'n is my home.Danger and sorrow standRound me on every hand;Heav'n is my fatherland,Heav'n is my home.</verse><verse>What though the tempest rage,Heav'n is my home;Short is my pilgrimage,Heav'n is my home;And time's wild wintry blastSoon shall be over past;I shall reach home at last,Heav'n is my home.</verse><verse>There at my Savior's sideHeav'n is my home;I shall be glorified,Heav'n is my home;There are the good and blest,Those I love most and best;And there I, too, shall rest,Heav'n is my home.</verse>

data.title: Lo, What a Glorious Sight Appears
data.preview: <verse>Lo, what a glorious sight appearsTo our believing eye
data.data: <verse>Lo, what a glorious sight appearsTo our believing eyes!The earth and seas are passed awayAnd the old rolling skies.And the old rolling skies,And the old rolling skies;The earth and seas are passed away,And the old rolling skies.</verse><chorus>O that will be joyful, joyful, joyful!O that will be joyfulWhen we meet to part no more!When we meet to part no moreOn Canaan's happy shore;'Tis there we'll meet at Jesus' feet,When we meet to part no more!</chorus><verse>Attending angels shout for joyAnd the bright armies sing-Mortals! Behold the sacred seatOf your descending King.Of your descending King,Of your descending King;Mortals! Behold the sacred seatOf your descending King.</verse><verse>His own soft hand shall wipe the tearsFrom every weeping eye;And pains, and groans, and griefs, and fears,And death itself shall die!And death itself shall die,And death itself shall die;And pains, and groans, and griefs, and fears,And death itself shall die.</verse><verse>How long, dear Savior! Oh, how longShall this bright hour delay?Fly swifter round, ye wheels of time!And bring the welcome day.And bring the welcome day,And bring the welcome day;Fly swifter round, ye wheels of  time!And bring  the welcome day.</verse>

data.title: Long Upon the Mountains
data.preview: <verse>Long upon the mountains weary,Have the scattered floc
data.data: <verse>Long upon the mountains weary,Have the scattered flocks been torn;Dark the desert paths, and dreary;Grievous trials have they borne.Now the gathering call is sounding,Solemn in its warning voice;Union, faith, and love, abounding,Bid the little flock rejoice.</verse><verse>Now the light of truth they're seeking,In its onward track pursue;All the ten commandments keeping,They are holy, just, and true.On the words of life they're feeding,Precious to their taste so sweet;All their Master's precepts heeding,Bowing humbly to His feet.</verse><verse>In that light of light and beauty,In that golden city fair,Soon its pearly gates they'll enter,And of all its glories share.There, divine the soul's expansions;Free from sin, and death, and pain;Tear will never dim those mansionsWhere the souls immortal reign.</verse><verse>Soon He comes! With clouds descending;All His saints, entombed arise;The redeemed, in anthems blending,Shout their vict'ry thro' the skies.O, we long for Thine appearing;Come, O Savior, quickly come!Blessed hope! Our spirits cheering,Take Thy ransomed children home.</verse>

data.title: O, When Shall I See Jesus
data.preview: <verse>O, when shall I see Jesus and reign with Him above,An
data.data: <verse>O, when shall I see Jesus and reign with Him above,And shall hear the trumpet sound in that morning?And from the flowing fountain drink everlasting love,And shall hear the trumpet sound in that morning.</verse><chorus>O, shout, glory! For I shall mount above the skies,When I hear the trumpet sound in that morning.</chorus><verse>Gird on the gospel armor of faith and hope and love,And you'll hear the trumpet  sound in that morning.And when the combat's ended He'll carry you above,And you'll hear the trumpet sound in that morning.</verse><verse>Our ears shall hear with transport the host of heaven sing,And shall hear the trumpet sound in that morning.Our tongues shall chant the glories of our immortal King.And shall hear the trumpet sound in that morning,</verse>

data.title: Never Part Again
data.preview: <verse>There is a land of pure delight,Where bliss eternal r
data.data: <verse>There is a land of pure delight,Where bliss eternal reigns,Infinite day excludes the night And pleasures banish pain.</verse><chorus>We're trav'ling to Immanuel's land,We soon shall hear the trumpet sound,And soon we shall with Jesus reign,And never, never part again.What! Never part again? No, never part again,What! Never part again? No, never part again,And soon we shall with Jesus reign,And never, never part again.</chorus><verse>There everlasting spring abides,And never with'ring flowers,And but a little space dividesThis heav'nly land from ours.</verse><verse>Could we but stand where Moses stood,And view the landscape o'er,Not all this world's pretended goodCould ever charm us more.</verse>

data.title: Beautiful Zion
data.preview: <verse>Beautiful Zion, built above,Beautiful city that I lov
data.data: <verse>Beautiful Zion, built above,Beautiful city that I love,Beautiful gates of pearly white,Beautiful temple, God its light.</verse><verse>Beautiful trees forever there,Beautiful fruit they always bear,Beautiful rivers gliding by,Beautiful fountains never dry.</verse><verse>Beautiful crowns on every brow,Beautiful palms the conquerors show,Beautiful robes the ransomed wear,Beautiful all who enter there.</verse>

data.title: Together Let Us Sweetly Live
data.preview: <verse>Together let us sweetly live,I am bound for the land
data.data: <verse>Together let us sweetly live,I am bound for the land of Canaan.Together love to Jesus give;I am bound for the land of Canaan.</verse><chorus>O Canaan, bright Canaan,I am bound for the land of Canaan.O Canaan, it is my happy home,I am bound for the land of Canaan.</chorus><verse>Together let us watch and pray;I am bound for the land of Canaan.And wait redemption's joyous day;I am bound for the land of Canaan.</verse><verse>Our songs of praise shall fill the skies;I am bound for the land of Canaan.While higher still our joys shall rise;I am bound for the land of Canaan.</verse><verse>Then come with me, beloved friend;I am bound for the land of Canaan.The joys to come shall never end;I am bound for the land of Canaan.</verse>

data.title: What Heavenly Music
data.preview: <verse>What heavenly music steals over the sea!Entrancing th
data.data: <verse>What heavenly music steals over the sea!Entrancing the senses like sweet melody!'Tis the voice of the angels borne soft on the air;For me they are singing; their welcome I hear.</verse><verse>On the banks of old Jordan, here gazing I stand,And earnestly longing, I stretch forth my hand;Send a convoy of angels, dear Jesus, I pray!Let me join that sweet music; come, take me away.</verse><verse>Though dark are the waters and rough is the wave,If Jesus permit, the wild surges I'll brave;For that heavenly music hath ravished me so,I must join in that chorus! I'll go! let me go!</verse>

data.title: We Have Heard
data.preview: <verse>We have heard from the bright, the holy, land;We have
data.data: <verse>We have heard from the bright, the holy, land;We have heard, and our hearts are glad;For we were a lonely pilgrim band,And weary, and worn, and sad.They tell us the saints have a dwelling there-No longer are homeless ones;And we know that the goodly land is fair,Where life's pure river runs.</verse><verse>They say green fields are waving there,That never a blight shall know;And the deserts wild are blooming fair,And the roses of Sharon grow.There are lovely birds in the bowers green,Their songs are blithe and sweet;And their warblings, gushing ever new,The angels' harpings greet.</verse><verse>We have heard of the palms, the robes, the crowns,And the silvery band in white;Of the city fair, with pearly gates,All radiant with light.We have heard of the angels there, and saints,With their harps of gold, how they sing;Of the mount with the fruitful tree of life,Of the leaves that healing bring.</verse><verse>The King of that country, He is fair,He's the joy and light of the place;In His beauty we shall behold Him there,And bask in His smiling face,We'll be there, we'll be there in a little while,We'll join the pure and the blest;We'll have the palm, the robe, the crown,And forever be at rest.</verse>

data.title: Don't You See My Jesus Coming
data.preview: <verse>Don't you see my Jesus coming,See Him come in yonder
data.data: <verse>Don't you see my Jesus coming,See Him come in yonder cloud?With ten thousand angels round Him,How they do my Jesus crowd!</verse><chorus>I am bound for the kingdom,Will you go to glory with me?Hallelujah! O praise ye the Lord!</chorus><verse>Don't you see the saints ascending,Hear them shouting thro' the air.Jesus smiling, trumpets sounding,Now His glory they shall share.</verse>

data.title: Immortal Love, Forever Full
data.preview: <verse>Immortal Love, forever full,Forever flowing free,Fore
data.data: <verse>Immortal Love, forever full,Forever flowing free,Forever shared, forever whole,A never ebbing sea!</verse><verse>We may not climb the heavenly steepsTo bring the Lord Christ down;In vain we search the lowest deeps,For him no depths can drown.</verse><verse>But warm, so tender, even yetA present help is He;And faith has still its Olivet,And love its Galilee.</verse><verse>The healing of His seamless dressIs by our beds of pain;We touch Him in life's throng and press,And we are whole again.</verse><verse>Through Him the first fond prayers are said,Our lips of childhood frame;The last low whispers of our deadAre burdened with His name.</verse><verse>O Lord and Master of us all:Whate'er our name or sign,We own Thy sway, we hear Thy call,We test our lives by Thine!</verse>

data.title: My Lord and I
data.preview: <verse>I have a Friend so precious,So very dear to me,He lov
data.data: <verse>I have a Friend so precious,So very dear to me,He loves me with such tender love,He loves so faithfully;I could not live apart form Him,I love to feel Him nigh,And so we dwell together,My Lord and I.</verse><verse>Sometimes I'm faint and weary,He knows that I am weak,And as He bids me lean on Him,His help I gladly seek;He leads me in the paths of light,Beneath a sunny sky,And so we walk together,My Lord and I.</verse><verse>I tell Him all my sorrows,I tell Him all my joys,I tell Him all that pleases me,I tell Him what annoys;He tells me what I ought to do,He tells me how to try,And so we talk together,My Lord and I.</verse><verse>He knows that I am longingSome weary soul to win,And so He bids me go and speakThe loving word for Him;He bids me tell His wondrous love,And why He came to die,And so we work together,My Lord and I.</verse>

data.title: I Love to Tell the Story
data.preview: <verse>I love to tell the story Of unseen things above, Of J
data.data: <verse>I love to tell the story Of unseen things above, Of Jesus and His glory, Of Jesus and His love. I love to tell the story, Because I know 'tis true; It satisfies my longings As nothing else can do. </verse><chorus>I love to tell the story, 'Twill be my theme in glory, To tell the old, old story Of Jesus and His love.</chorus><verse>I love to tell the story; More wonderful it seems Than all the golden fancies Of all our golden dreams. I love to tell the story, It did so much for me; And that is just the reason I tell it now to thee. </verse><verse>I love to tell the story; 'Tis pleasant to repeat What seems, each time I tell it, More wonderfully sweet. I love to tell the story, For some have never heard The message of salvation From God's own Holy Word. </verse><verse>I love to tell the story, For those who know it best Seem hungering and thirsting To hear it like the rest. And when, in scenes of glory, I sing the new, new song, 'Twill be the old, old story That I have loved so long.</verse>

data.title: More Love to Thee
data.preview: <verse>More love to Thee, O Christ, More love to Thee!Hear t
data.data: <verse>More love to Thee, O Christ, More love to Thee!Hear thou the prayer I make on bended knee.This is my earnest plea: More love, O Christ, to Thee;More love to Thee, More love to Thee!</verse><verse>Once earthly joy I craved, Sought peace and rest;Now Thee alone I seek, Give what is best.This all my prayer shall be: More love, O Christ, to Thee;More love to Thee, More love to Thee!</verse><verse>Let sorrow do its work, Send grief or pain;Sweet are Thy messengers, Sweet their refrain,When they can sing with me: More love, O Christ, to Thee;More love to Thee, More love to Thee!</verse><verse>Then shall my latest breath Whisper Thy praise;This be the parting cry My heart shall raise;This still its prayer shall be: More love, O Christ, to Thee;More love to Thee, More love to Thee!</verse>

data.title: As the Bridegroom to His Chosen
data.preview: <verse>As the bridegroom to his chosen,As the king to his re
data.data: <verse>As the bridegroom to his chosen,As the king to his realm,As the keep unto the castle,As the pilot to the helm,So, Lord, art Thou to me.</verse><verse>As the fountain in the garden,As the candle in the dark,As the treasure in the coffer,As the manna in the ark,So, Lord, art Thou to me.</verse><verse>As the ruby in the setting,As the honey in the comb,As the light within the lantern,As the father in the home,So, Lord, art Thou to me.</verse><verse>As the sunshine in the heavens,As the image in the glass,As the fruits up in the fig tree,As the dew upon the grass,So, Lord, art Thou to me.</verse>

data.title: As Water to the Thirsty
data.preview: <verse>As water to the thirsty,As beauty to the eyes,As stre
data.data: <verse>As water to the thirsty,As beauty to the eyes,As strength that follows weakness,As truth instead of lies;As songtime and springtime and summertime to be,So is my Lord, my living Lord,So is my Lord to me.</verse><verse>Like calm in place of clamorLike peace that follows pain,Like meeting after parting,Like sunshine after rain;Like moonlight and starlight and sunlight on the sea,So is my Lord, my living Lord,So is my Lord to me.</verse><verse>As sleep that follows fever,As gold instead of grey,As freedom after bondage,As sunrise to the day;As home to the trav'ler and all he longs to see,So is my Lord, my Living,So is my Lord to me.</verse>

data.title: Be Still, My Soul
data.preview: <verse>Be still, my soul: the Lord is on thy side;Bear patie
data.data: <verse>Be still, my soul: the Lord is on thy side;Bear patiently the cross of grief or pain;Leave to thy God to order and provide;In every change He faithful will remain.Be still, my soul: thy best, thy heavenly friendThrough thorny ways leads to a joyful end.</verse><verse>Be still, My soul: thy God doth undertakeTo guide the future as He has the past.Thy hope, thy confidence let nothing shake;All now mysterious shall be bright at last.Be still, my soul: the waves and winds still knowHis voice who ruled them while He dwelt below.</verse><verse>Be still, my soul: the hour is hastening onWhen we shall be forever with the Lord,When disappointment, grief, and fear are gone,Sorrow forgot, love's purest joys restored.Be still, my soul: when change and tears are past,All safe and blessed we shall meet at last.</verse>

data.title: Blessed Assurance, Jesus is Mine!
data.preview: <verse>Blessed assurance, Jesus is mine!O what a foretaste o
data.data: <verse>Blessed assurance, Jesus is mine!O what a foretaste of glory divine!Heir of salvation, purchase of God,Born of His Spirit, washed in His blood.</verse><chorus>This is my story, this is my song,Praising my Savior all the day long;This is my story, this is my song,Praising my Savior all the day long.</chorus><verse>Perfect submission, perfect delight,Visions of rapture now burst on my sight;Angels descending bring from aboveEchoes of mercy, whispers of love.</verse><verse>Perfect submission, all is at rest;I in my Savior am happy and blest,Watching and waiting, looking above,Filled with His goodness, lost in His love.</verse>

data.title: Peace, Perfect Peace
data.preview: <verse>Peace, perfect peace, in this dark world of sin?The b
data.data: <verse>Peace, perfect peace, in this dark world of sin?The blood of Jesus whispers peace within.</verse><verse>Peace, perfect peace, by thronging duties pressed?To do the will of Jesus: this is rest.</verse><verse>Peace, perfect peace, with loved ones far away?In Jesus' keeping we are safe, and they.</verse><verse>Peace, perfect peace, our future all unknown?Jesus we know, and He is on the throne. </verse>

data.title: When I Can Read My Title Clear
data.preview: <verse>When I can read my title clearTo mansions in the skie
data.data: <verse>When I can read my title clearTo mansions in the skiesI'll bid farewell to every fear,And wipe my weeping eyes;And wipe my weeping eyes,And wipe my weeping eyes,I'll bid farewell to every fear,And wipe my weeping eyes.</verse><verse>Should earth against my soul engage,And fiery darts be hurled,Then I can smile at Satan's rage,And face a frowning world;And face a frowning world,And face a frowning world,Then I can smile at Satan's rage,And face a frowning world.</verse><verse>Let cares like a wild deluge come,And storms or sorrow fall!May I but safely reach my home,My God, my heav'n, my all;My God. my heav'n, my all,My God, my heav'n, my all,May I but safely reach my home,My God, my heav'n, my all.</verse>

data.title: I Heard the Voice of Jesus
data.preview: <verse>I heard the voice of Jesus say,"Come unto Me and
data.data: <verse>I heard the voice of Jesus say,"Come unto Me and rest;Lay down, thou weary one, lay downThy head upon My breast."I came to Jesus as I was,Weary and worn and sad;I found in Him a resting place,And He has made me glad.</verse><verse>I heard the voice of Jesus say,"Behold, I freely giveThe living water; thirsty one,Stoop down and drink and live."I came to Jesus, and I drankOf that life giving stream;My thirst was quench'd, my soul revived,And now I live in Him.</verse><verse>I heard the voice of Jesus say,"I am this dark world's light;Look unto Me, thy morn shall rise,And all thy day be bright."I looked to Jesus, and I foundIn Him my star, my sun;And in that light of  life I'll walk,Till trav'ling  days are done.</verse>

data.title: Wonderful Peace
data.preview: <verse>Far away in the depths of my spirit tonight,Rolls a m
data.data: <verse>Far away in the depths of my spirit tonight,Rolls a melody sweeter than psalm;In celestial like strains it unceasingly fallsO'er my soul like an infinite calm.</verse><chorus>Peace! Peace! wonderful peace,Coming down from the Father above;Sweep over my spirit forever, I pray,In fathomless billows of love.</chorus><verse>What a treasure I have in this wonderful peace,Buried deep in my inner most soul,So secure that no power can mine it away,While the years of eternity roll!</verse><verse>I believe when I rise to that city of peace,Where the Author of peace I shall see,That one strain of the song which the ransomed will sing,In that heavenly kingdom will be-</verse><verse>Weary soul, without gladness or comfort or rest,Passing down the rough pathway of time!Make the Savior your friend ere the shadows grow dark;O accept of this peace so sublime.</verse>

data.title: Life Is Great! So Sing About It
data.preview: <verse>Life is great! So sing about it,As we can and as we s
data.data: <verse>Life is great! So sing about it,As we can and as we should-Shop and buses, towns and people,Village, farmland, field and wood,Life is great and life is given;Life is lovely, free and good.</verse><verse>Life is great!- what ever happens,Snow or sunshine, joy or pain,Hardship, grief or disillusion,Suffering that I can't explain-Life is great if someone loves me,Holds my hand and calls my name.</verse><verse>Love is great!- the love of lovers,Whispered words and longing eyes;Love that gazes at the cradleWhere a child of loving lies;Love that lasts when youth has faded,Bends with age, but never dies.</verse><verse>Love is giving and receiving-Boy and girl, or friend with friend;Love is bearing and forgivingAll the hurts that hate can send;Love's the greatest way of living,Hoping, trusting to the end.</verse><verse>God is great! in Christ He loved us,As we should, but never can-Love that suffered, hoped and trustedWhen disciples turned and ran,Love that broke through death forever.Praise that loving, living Man!</verse>

data.title: A Child of the King
data.preview: <verse>My Father is rich in houses and lands,He holdeth the
data.data: <verse>My Father is rich in houses and lands,He holdeth the wealth of the world in His hands!Of rubies and diamonds, of silver and gold,His coffers are full, He has riches untold.</verse><chorus>I'm a child of the King,A child of the King:With Jesus my Savior,I'm a child of the King.</chorus><verse>My Father's own Son, the Savior of men,Once wandered on earth as the poorest of them;But now He is pleading our pardon on high,That we may be His when He comes by and by.</verse><verse>I once was an outcast, a stranger on earth,A sinner by choice, an alien by birth,But I've been adopted, my name's written down,An heir to a mansion, a robe and a crown.</verse><verse>A tent or a cottage, O why should I care?They're building a palace for me over there;Though exiled from home, yet still may I sing:All glory to God, I'm a child of the King.</verse>

data.title: Leaning on the Everlasting Arms
data.preview: <verse>What a fellowship, what a joy divine,Leaning on the e
data.data: <verse>What a fellowship, what a joy divine,Leaning on the everlasting arms;What a blessedness, what a peace is mine,Leaning on the everlasting arms.</verse><chorus>Leaning, leaning,Safe and secure from all alarms;Leaning, leaning,Leaning on the everlasting arms.</chorus><verse>O how sweet to walk in this pilgrim way,Leaning on the everlasting arms;O how bright the path grows from day to day,Leaning on the everlasting arms.</verse><verse>What have I to dread, what have I to fear,Leaning on the everlasting arms?I have blessed peace with my Lord so near,Leaning on the everlasting arms.</verse>

data.title: There's Sunshine in My Soul Today
data.preview: <verse>There's sunshine in my soul today, More glorious and
data.data: <verse>There's sunshine in my soul today, More glorious and brightThan glows in any earthly sky, For Jesus is my light.</verse><chorus>O there's sunshine, blessed sunshine, When the peaceful, happy moments rollWhen Jesus shows His smiling face There is sunshine in the soul.</chorus><verse>There's music in my soul today, A carol to my King,And Jesus, listening, can hear The songs I cannot sing.</verse><verse>There's springtime in my soul today, For when the Lord is near,The dove of peace sings in my heart, The flowers of grace appear.</verse><verse>Theres gladness in my soul today, And hope, and praise, and love,For blessings which He gives me now, For joys "laid up" above.</verse>

data.title: Grant Us Your Peace
data.preview: <verse>Dona nobis pacem, pacem; Dona nobis pacem.Dona nobis
data.data: <verse>Dona nobis pacem, pacem; Dona nobis pacem.Dona nobis pacem; Dona nobis pacem.Dona nobis pacem; Dona nobis pacem.</verse><verse>Father grant us, grant us Your peace;Oh, loving Father, grant us Your peace.Grant us, grant us peace;Grant us, grant us, grant Your peace;Grant us, grant us peace;Loving Father, grant us Your peace.</verse><verse>Accordenous ta paix, ta paix, Accordenous ta paix.Accordenous ta paix; Accordenous ta paix.Accordenous ta paix, Accordenous ta paix.</verse><verse>Padre, danos tupaz, tupaz; Padre, danos, danos tupazPadre, danos, tupaz. Padre, danos, danos tupazPadre, danos, tupaz. Padre, danos, danos tupaz.</verse>

data.title: A Song of Heaven and Homeland
data.preview: <verse>Sometimes I hear strange music,Like none e'er heard b
data.data: <verse>Sometimes I hear strange music,Like none e'er heard before,Come floating softly earthwardAs thro' heav'n's open door:It seems like angel voices,In strains of joy and love,That swell the mighty chorusAround the throne above.</verse><chorus>O sweet, celestial music,Heard from a land afar-The song of Heav'n and Homeland,Thro' doors God leaves ajar!</chorus><verse>Now soft, and low, and restful,It floods my soul with peace,As if God's benedictionBade all earth's troubles cease.Then grander than the voices,Of wind, and wave, and sea-It fills the dome of heavenWith glorious harmony.</verse><verse>This music haunts me ever,Like something heard in dreams-It seems to catch the cadenceOf heav'nly winds and streams,My heart is filled with rapture,To think, some day to come,I'll sing it with the angels-The song of heav'n and home.</verse>

data.title: Nearer My God, to Thee
data.preview: <verse>Nearer, my God, to Thee, Nearer to Thee! E'en though
data.data: <verse>Nearer, my God, to Thee, Nearer to Thee! E'en though it be a cross That raiseth me, Still all my song shall be, Nearer, my God, to Thee; Nearer, my God, to Thee, nearer to Thee! </verse><verse>Though like the wanderer, The sun gone down, Darkness be over me, My rest a stone; Yet in my dreams I'd be Nearer, my God, to Thee; Nearer, my God, to Thee, Nearer to Thee! </verse><verse>There let the way appear, Steps unto heaven; All that Thou sendest me, In mercy given; Angels to beckon me Nearer, my God, to Thee; Nearer, my God, to Thee, Nearer to Thee! </verse><verse>Then, with my waking thoughts Bright with Thy praise, Out of my stony griefs Bethel I'll raise; So by my woes to be Nearer, my God, to Thee; Nearer, my God, to Thee, Nearer to Thee! </verse><verse>Or if, on joyful wing Cleaving the sky, Sun, moon, and stars forgot, Upward I fly, Still all my song shall be, Nearer, my God, to Thee; Nearer, my God, to Thee, Nearer to Thee! </verse>

data.title: Take the Name of Jesus With You
data.preview: <verse>Take the Name of Jesus with you,Child of sorrow and o
data.data: <verse>Take the Name of Jesus with you,Child of sorrow and of woe,It will joy and comfort give you;Take it then, where'er you go.</verse><chorus>Precious Name, O how sweet!Hope of earth and joy of Heav'n.Precious Name, O how sweet!Hope of earth and joy of Heav'n.</chorus><verse>Take the Name of Jesus ever,As a shield from every snare;If temptations round you gather,Breathe that holy Name in prayer.</verse><verse>O the precious Name of Jesus!How it thrills our souls with joy,When His loving arms receive us,And His songs our tongues employ!</verse><verse>At the Name of Jesus bowing,Falling prostrate at His feet,King of kings in heav'n we'll crown Him,When our journey is complete.</verse>

data.title: Balm in Gilead
data.preview: <verse>There is a balm in GileadTo make the wounded whole;Th
data.data: <verse>There is a balm in GileadTo make the wounded whole;There is a balm in GileadTo heal the sin-sick soul.</verse><verse>Sometimes I feel discouraged,And think my work's in vain,But then the Holy SpiritRevives my soul again.</verse><verse>If you can not preach like Peter,If you can not pray like Paul,You can tell the love of Jesus,And say He died for all.</verse>

data.title: Burdens Are Lifted at Calvary
data.preview: <verse>Days are filled with sorrow and care,Hearts are lonel
data.data: <verse>Days are filled with sorrow and care,Hearts are lonely and drear;Burdens are lifted at Calvary,Jesus is very near.</verse><chorus>Burdens are lifted at Calvary,Calvary, Calvary,Burdens are lifted at Calvary,Jesus is very near.</chorus><verse>Cast your care on Jesus today,Leave your worry and fear;Burdens are lifted at Calvary,Jesus is very near.</verse><verse>Troubled soul, the Saviour can see,Ev'ry heartache and tear;Burdens are lifted at CalvaryJesus is very near.</verse>

data.title: Come, Ye Disconsolate
data.preview: <verse>Come, ye disconsolate, where'er ye languish.Come to t
data.data: <verse>Come, ye disconsolate, where'er ye languish.Come to the mercy seat, fervently kneel.Here bring your wounded hearts, here tell your anguish;Earth has no sorrow that heaven cannot heal.</verse><verse>Joy of the comfortless, light of the straying,Hope of the penitent, fadeless and pure!Here speaks the Comforter, tenderly saying,"Earth has no sorrow that heaven cannot cure."</verse><verse>Here see the bread of life; see waters flowingForth from the throne of God, pure from above.Come to the feast of love; come, ever knowingEarth has no sorrow but heaven can remove.</verse>

data.title: Sweet Hour of Prayer
data.preview: <verse>Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer! That call
data.data: <verse>Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer! That calls me from a world of care, And bids me at my Father's throne Make all my wants and wishes known. In seasons of distress and grief, My soul has often found relief, And oft escaped the tempter's snare By thy return, sweet hour of prayer! </verse><verse>Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer! Thy wings shall my petition bear To Him whose truth and faithfulness Engage the waiting soul to bless. And since He bids me seek His face, Believe His word, and trust His grace, I'll cast on Him my every care, And wait for thee, sweet hour of prayer! </verse><verse>Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer! May I thy consolation shareTill from Mount Pisgah's lofty heightI view my home and take my flight.In my immortal flesh I'll riseTo seize the everlasting prize.And shout while passing through the air,"Farewell, farewell, sweet hour of prayer!" </verse>

data.title: Tread Softly
data.preview: <verse>Be silent, be silent,A whisper is heard;Be silent, an
data.data: <verse>Be silent, be silent,A whisper is heard;Be silent, and listen,Oh treasure each word.</verse><chorus>Tread softly, tread softly, The Master is here;Tread softly, tread softly, He bids us draw near.</chorus><verse>Be silent, be silent,For holy this place,This altar that echoesThe message of grace.</verse><verse>Be silent, be silent,Breathe humbly our prayer;A foretaste of EdenThis moment we share.</verse><verse>Be silent, be silent,His mercy record;Be silent, be silent,And wait on the Lord.</verse>

data.title: Dear Lord and Father
data.preview: <verse>Dear Lord and Father of mankind,Forgive our foolish w
data.data: <verse>Dear Lord and Father of mankind,Forgive our foolish ways;Reclothe us in our rightful mind,In purer lives Thy service find,In deeper reverence, praise.</verse><verse>In simple trust like theirs who heard,Beside the Syrian sea,The gracious calling of the Lord,Let us, like them, without a word,Rise up and follow Thee.</verse><verse>O Sabbath rest by Galilee,O calm of hills above,Where Jesus knelt to share with TheeThe silence of eternity,Interpreted by love!</verse><verse>Drop Thy still dews of quietness,Till all our strivings cease;Take from our souls the strain and stress,And let our ordered lives confessThe beauty of Thy peace.</verse><verse>Breathe through the heats of our desireThy coolness and Thy balm;Let sense be dumb, Let flesh retire;Speak through the earthquake, wind, and fire,O still, small voice of calm.</verse>

data.title: Dear Lord and Father
data.preview: <verse>Dear Lord and Father of mankind,Forgive our foolish w
data.data: <verse>Dear Lord and Father of mankind,Forgive our foolish ways;Reclothe us in our rightful mind,In purer lives Thy service find,In deeper reverence, praise.</verse>

data.title: Father, Lead Me Day by Day
data.preview: <verse>Father, lead me day by day,Ever in Thine own sweet wa
data.data: <verse>Father, lead me day by day,Ever in Thine own sweet way;Teach me to be pure and true;Show me what I ought to do.</verse><verse>When in danger, make me brave;Make me know that Thou canst save;Keep me safe by Thy dear side;Let me in Thy love abide.</verse><verse>When I'm tempted to do wrong,Make me steadfast, wise, and strong;And when all alone I stand,Shield me with Thy mighty hand.</verse><verse>May I do the good I know,Be Thy loving child below,Then at last go home to Thee,Evermore Thy child to be.</verse>

data.title: I Need Thee Every Hour
