data.data: <verse>When the church of Jesus Shuts its outer door,Lest the roar of traffic Drown the voice of prayer:May our prayers, Lord make us Ten times more awareThat the world we banish Is our Christian care. </verse><verse>If our hearts are lifted Where devotion soarsHigh above this hungry Suffering world of ours:Lest our hymns should drug us To forget its needs,Forge our Christian worship Into Christian deeds. </verse><verse>Lest the gifts we offer, Money, talents, time,Serve to salve our conscience To our secret shame:Lord, reprove, inspire us By the way You give;Teach us, dying Savior, How true Christians live.</verse>

data.title: Working, O Christ, With Thee
data.preview: <verse>Working, O Christ, with Thee, Working with Thee,Unwor
data.data: <verse>Working, O Christ, with Thee, Working with Thee,Unworthy, sinful, weak, Though we may be;Our all to Thee we give, For Thee alone we live,And by Thy grace achieve, Working with Thee.</verse><verse>Along the city's waste, Working with Thee,Our eager footsteps haste, Like Thee to be;The poor we gather in, The outcasts raise from sin,And labor souls to win, Working with Thee.</verse><verse>Savior, we weary not, Working with Thee,As hard as Thine our lot Can never be;Our joy and comfort this, "Thy grace sufficent is;"This changes toil to bliss, Working with Thee.</verse><verse>So let us labor on, Working with Thee,Till earth to Thee is won, From sin set free;Till men, from shore to shore, Receive Thee, and adore,And join us evermore, Working with Thee.</verse>

data.title: You That Know the Lord
data.preview: <verse>You that know the Lord is gracious,You for whom a cor
data.data: <verse>You that know the Lord is gracious,You for whom a cornerstone Stands, of God elect and precious,Laid that you may build there-on,See that on that sure foundation You a living temple raise.Towers that may tell forth salvation, Walls that may re-echo praise. </verse><verse>Living stones by God appointedEach to his allotted place,Kings and priests, by God anointed,Shall you not declare His grace?You, a royal generation, Tell the tidings of your birth,Tidings of a new creationTo an old and weary earth. </verse><verse>Tell the praise of Him who called youOut of darkness into light,Broke the fetters that enthralled you,Gave you freedom, peace, and sight:Tell the tale of sins forgiven,Strength renewed and hope restored,Till the earth, in tune with heaven, Praise and magnify the Lord.</verse>

data.title: There's a Spirit in the Air
data.preview: <verse>There's a Spirit in the air, Telling Christians every
data.data: <verse>There's a Spirit in the air, Telling Christians everywhere'Praise the love that Christ revealed, Living, working in our world.' </verse><verse>Lose your shyness, find your tongue; Tell the world what God has done:God in Christ has come to stay, We can see His pow'r today. </verse><verse>When believers break the bread, When a hungry child is fed:Praise the love that Christ revealed, Living, working in our world.</verse><verse>Still His Spirit leads the fight, Seeing wrong and setting right:God in Christ has come to stay, We can see His pow'r today.</verse><verse>When a stranger's not alone, Where the homeless find a home,Praise the love that Christ revealed, Living, working in our world.</verse><verse>May His Spirit fill our praise, Guide our thoughts and change our ways.God in Christ has come to stay, We can see His power today.</verse><verse>There's a Spirit in the air, Calling people everywhere;Praise the love that Christ revealed: Living, working in our world.</verse>

data.title: When Christ Was Lifted From the Earth
data.preview: <verse>When Christ was lifted from the earth His arms stretc
data.data: <verse>When Christ was lifted from the earth His arms stretched out aboveThrough every culture, every birth, To draw an answering love. </verse><verse>Still east and west His love extends And always, near or far,He calls and claims us as His friends And loves us as we are. </verse><verse>Where generation, class, or race Divides us to our shame,He sees not labels but a face, A person and a name. </verse><verse>Thus freely loved, tho' fully known, May I in Christ be freeTo welcome and accept His own As Christ accepted me.</verse>

data.title: What Joy It Is to Worship Here
data.preview: <verse>What joy it is to worship here,And find ourselves at
data.data: <verse>What joy it is to worship here,And find ourselves at home,Where God, who uses every gift,Has room for all who come! </verse><verse>Yet are no two of us alikeOf all the human race,And we must seek a common groundIf we would share His grace.</verse>

data.title: In Christ There Is No East nor West
data.preview: <verse>In Christ there is no east nor west,In Him no south o
data.data: <verse>In Christ there is no east nor west,In Him no south or north;But one great fellowship of loveThroughout the whole wide earth.</verse><verse>In Him shall true heart everywhereTheir high communion find;His service is the golden cordClose binding all mankind.</verse><verse>Join hands, then, brothers of the faith,Whate'er your race may be.Who serves my Father as a sonIs surely kin to me.</verse><verse>In Christ now meet both east and west,In Him meet south and north;All Christly souls are one in HimThroughout the whole wide earth.</verse>

data.title: Lord of All Nations
data.preview: <verse>Lord of all nations, grant me graceTo love all people
data.data: <verse>Lord of all nations, grant me graceTo love all people, every race,And in each person may I seeMy kindred loved, redeemed by Thee.</verse><verse>Break down the wall that would divideThy children, Lord, on every side.My neighbor's good let me pursue;Let Christian love bind warm and true.</verse><verse>Forgive me, Lord, where I have erredBy loveless act and thoughtless word.Make me to see the wrong I doWill crucify my Lord anew.</verse><verse>Give me Thy courage, Lord, to speakWhenever strong oppress the weak.Should I myself the victim be,Help me forgive, remembering Thee.</verse><verse>With Thine own love may I be filledAnd by Thy Holy Spirit willed,That all I touch, where'er I be,May be divinely touched by Thee.</verse>

data.title: Holy Spirit, Gracious Guest
data.preview: <verse>Holy Spirit, gracious guest,Hear and grant our heart'
data.data: <verse>Holy Spirit, gracious guest,Hear and grant our heart's requestFor that gift supreme and best:Holy heav'nly love. </verse><verse>Faith that mountains could remove,Tongues of earth or heaven above,Knowledge, all things, empty proveIf I have no love. </verse><verse>Though I as a martyr bleed,Give my goods the poor to feed,All is vain if love I need:Therefore give me love. </verse><verse>Love is kind and suffers long,Love is pure and thinks no wrong,Love than death itself more strong:Therefore give us love. </verse><verse>Prophecy will fade away,Melting in the light of day;Love will ever with us stay:Therefore give us love. </verse><verse>Faith and hope and love we seeJoining hand in hand agree-But the greatest of the three,And the best is love.</verse>

data.title: Trust and Obey
data.preview: <verse>When we walk with the LordIn the light of His word,Wh
data.data: <verse>When we walk with the LordIn the light of His word,What a glory He sheds on our way!While we do His good will,He abides with us still,And with all who will trust and obey.</verse><chorus>Trust and obey, for there's no other wayTo be happy in Jesus, but to trust and obey.</chorus><verse>Not a shadow can rise,Not a cloud in the skies,But His smile quickly drives it away;Not a doubt nor a fear,Not a sigh nor a tear,Can abide while we trust and obey.</verse><verse>Not a burden we bear,Not a sorrow we share,But our toil He doth richly repay;Not a grief or a loss,Not a frown or a cross,But is blest if we trust and obey.</verse><verse>But we never can proveThe delights of His loveUntil all on the altar we lay;For the favor He shows,And the joy He bestows,Are for them who will trust and obey.</verse><verse>Then in fellowship sweetWe will sit at His feet,Or we'll walk by His side in the way;What He says we will do,Where He sends we will go;Never fear, only trust and obey.</verse>

data.title: In Our Work and in Our Play
data.preview: <verse>In our work and in our play,Jesus, ever with us stay;
data.data: <verse>In our work and in our play,Jesus, ever with us stay;May be always strive to beTrue and faithful unto Thee.Then we truthfully can sing,We are children of the King.</verse><verse>May we in Thy strength subdueEvil tempers, words untrue,Thoughts impure, and deeds unkind,All things hateful to Thy mind.Then we truthfully can sing,We are children of the King.</verse><verse>Children of the King are we!May we loyal to Him be;Try to please Him every day,In our work and in our play.Then we truthfully can sing,We are children of the King. </verse>

data.title: Watchman, Tell Us of the Night
data.preview: <verse>Watchman, tell us of the night What its signs of prom
data.data: <verse>Watchman, tell us of the night What its signs of promise are.Traveler, o'er yon mountain's height, See that glory beaming star.Watchman, does its beauteous ray Aught of joy or hope foretell?Traveler, yes; it brings the day, Promised day of Israel. </verse><verse>Watchman, tell us of the night, Higher yet that star ascends.Traveler, blessedness and light, Peace and truth its course portends.Watchman, will its beams alone Gild the spot that gave them birth?Traveler, ages are its own; See it bursts o'er all the earth. </verse><verse>Watchman, tell us of the night, For the morning seems to dawn.Traveler, darkness takes its flight, Doubt and terror are withdrawn.Watchman, let your wanderings cease; Hasten to your quiet home.Traveler, lo, the Prince of Peace, Lo, the Son of God is come!</verse>

data.title: In Times Like These
data.preview: <verse>In times like these you need a Savior,In times like t
data.data: <verse>In times like these you need a Savior,In times like these you need an anchor;Be very sure, be very sure Your anchor holds and grips the Solid rock!This Rock is Jesus, Yes, He's the One;This Rock is Jesus, The only One!Be very sure, be very sure Your anchor holds and grips the Solid rock!</verse><verse>In times like these you need the Bible,In times like these O be not idle;Be very sure, be very sure Your anchor holds and grips the Solid rock!This Rock is Jesus, Yes, He's the One;This Rock is Jesus, The only One!Be very sure, be very sure Your anchor holds and grips the Solid rock!</verse><verse>In times like these I have a Savior,In times like these I have an anchorI'm very sure, I'm very sure My anchor holds and grips the Solid rock!This Rock is Jesus, Yes, He's the One;This Rock is Jesus, The only One!I'm very sure, I'm very sure My anchor holds and grips the Solid rock!</verse>

data.title: Heir of the Kingdom
data.preview: <verse>Heir of the kingdom, O why dost thou slumber?Why art
data.data: <verse>Heir of the kingdom, O why dost thou slumber?Why art thou sleeping so near thy blest home?Wake thee, arouse thee, and gird on thine armor,Speed, for the moments are hurrying on.</verse><verse>Heir of the kingdom, say, why dost thou linger?How canst thou tarry in sight of the prize?Up, and adorn thee, the Savior is coming;Haste to receive Him descending the skies.</verse><verse>Earth's mighty nations, in strife and commotion,Tremble with terror, and sink in dismay;Listen, 'tis nought but the chariot's loud rumbling;Heir of the kingdom, no longer delay.</verse><verse>Stay not, O stay not for earth's vain allurements!See how its glory is passing away;Break the strong fetters the foe hath bound o'er thee;Heir of the kingdom, turn, turn thee away.</verse><verse>Keep the eye single, the head upward lifted;Watch for the glory of earth's coming King;Lo! o'er the mountaintops light is now breaking;Heirs of the kingdom, rejoice ye and sing.</verse>

data.title: Let Every Lamp Be Burning
data.preview: <verse>Let every lamp be burning bright,The darkest hour is
data.data: <verse>Let every lamp be burning bright,The darkest hour is nearing;The darkest hour of earth's long night,Before the Lord's appearing.</verse><chorus>Then trim your lamps, my brethren dear,Then trim your lamps with godly fear;The Master's coming draweth near,Let every lamp be burning.</chorus><verse>Though thousands calmly slumber on,The last great message spurning,Wel'll rest our living faith uponHis promise of returning.</verse><verse>His word our lamp, His truth our guide,We cannot be mistaken;Though dangers rise on every side,We shall not be forsaken.</verse><verse>Then let good works with faith appear,To help the world around us;Obedience bring the blessing nearWhen faith has firmly bound us.</verse>

data.title: Look for the Waymarks
data.preview: <verse>Look for the way-marks as you journey on,Look for the
data.data: <verse>Look for the way-marks as you journey on,Look for the way-marks passing one by one;Down through the ages, past the kingdoms four'Where are we standing? Look the way-marks o'er. </verse><chorus>Look for the way-marks, the great prophetic way-marks,Down through the ages, past the kingdoms four.Look for the waymarks, the great prophetic way-marks;The journey's almost o'er. </chorus><verse>First, the Assyrian kingdom ruled the world,Then Medo-Persia's banners were unfurled;And after Greece held universal sway,Rome seized the scepter--Where are we today? </verse><verse>Down in the feet of iron and of clay,Weak and divided, soon to pass away;What will the next great, glorious drama be?Christ and His coming, And eternity.</verse>

data.title: Ye Servants of the Lord
data.preview: <verse>Ye servants of the Lord,Each in his office wait,Obser
data.data: <verse>Ye servants of the Lord,Each in his office wait,Observant of His heavenly Word,And watchful at His gate. </verse><verse>Let all your lamps be bright,And trim the golden flame,Gird up your loins as in His sight,His coming thus proclaim. </verse><verse>Watch, 'tis your Lord's command,And while we speak He's near;Mark the first signal of His hand,And ready all appear. </verse><verse>O happy servant, he,In such a posture found!He shall His Lord with rapture see,And be with honor crowned.</verse>

data.title: Watch, Ye Saints
data.preview: <verse>Watch, ye saints, with eyelids waking;Lo! The powers
data.data: <verse>Watch, ye saints, with eyelids waking;Lo! The powers of heaven are shaking;Keep your lamps all trimmed and burning, Ready for your Lord's returning. </verse><chorus>Lo! He comes, lo! Jesus comes;Lo! He come, He comes all glorious!Jesus comes to reign victorious,Lo! He comes, yes, Jesus comes. </chorus><verse>Lo! the promise of your Savior, Pardoned sin and purchased favor,Blood-washed robes and crowns of glory;Haste to tell redemption's story.</verse><verse>Kingdoms at their base are crumbling,Hark! His chariot wheels are rumbling;Tell, O tell of grace abounding,While the seventh trump is sounding.</verse><verse>Nations wane, though proud and stately;Christ His kingdom hasteneth greatly;Earth her latest pangs is summing;Shout, ye saints, your Lord is coming.</verse><verse>Sinners, come, while Christ is pleading;Now for you He's interceding;Haste, ere grace and time diminishedShall proclaim the mystery finished.</verse>

data.title: Rejoice, Rejoice, Believers
data.preview: <verse>Rejoice, rejoice, believers, And let your lights appe
data.data: <verse>Rejoice, rejoice, believers, And let your lights appear:The evening is advancing, And darker night is near.The Bridegroom is arising, And soon He draweth nigh.Up, pray, and watch, and wrestle, At midnight comes the cry. </verse><verse>The watchers on the mountain Proclaim the Bridegroom near.Go, meet Him as He cometh, With hallelujahs clear.The marriage feast is waiting, The gates wide open stand;Up, up, you heirs of glory, The Bridegroom is at hand. </verse><verse>You saints who here in patience Your cross and suff'rings bore,Shall live and reign forever, When sorrow is no more.Upon the throne of glory The Lamb you shall behold,In triumph cast before Him Your diadems of gold! </verse><verse>Our hope and expectation, O Jesus, now appear;Arise, O sun so longed for, O'er this benighted sphere!With hearts and hands uplifted, We plead, O Lord, to seeThe day of earth's redemption That brings us unto Thee.</verse>

data.title: Hold Fast Till I Come
data.preview: <verse>Sweet promise is given to all who believe--"Beho
data.data: <verse>Sweet promise is given to all who believe--"Behold I come quickly, Mine own to receive;Hold fast till I come; the danger is great;Sleep not as do others; be watchful, and wait."</verse><chorus>"Hold fast till I come," sweet promise of heaven--"The kingdom restored, to you shall be given.""Come, enter My joy, sit down on the throne;Bright crowns are in waiting; hold fast till I come."</chorus><verse>We'll "watch unto prayer" with lamps burning bright;He comes to all others a "thief in the night."We know He is near, but know not the day--As spring shows that summer is not far away.</verse><verse>Yes! this is our hope, 'tis built on His word--The glorious appearing of Jesus, our Lord;Of promises all, it stands as the sum:"Behold I come quickly; hold fast till I come."</verse>

data.title: Watchmen, on the Walls of Zion
data.preview: <verse>Watchmen, on the walls of Zion, What O tell us, of th
data.data: <verse>Watchmen, on the walls of Zion, What O tell us, of the night? Is the daystar now arising? Will the morn soon greet our sight? O'er your vision Shine there now some rays of light? O'er your vision Shine there now some rays of light?</verse><verse>Tell, O tell us, are the landmarks On our voyage all passed by? Are we nearing now the haven? Can we e'en the land descry? Do we truly See the heavenly kingdom nigh? Do we truly See the heavenly kingdom nigh?</verse><verse>Light is beaming, day is coming! Let us sound aloud the cry; We behold the daystar rising Pure and bright in yonder sky! Saints, be joyful; Your redemption draweth nigh; Saints, be joyful; Your redemption draweth nigh.</verse><verse>We have found the chart and compass, And are sure the land is near; Onward, onward we are hasting, Soon the haven will appear; Let your voices Sound aloud your holy cheer; Let your voices Sound aloud your holy cheer. </verse>

data.title: O Brother, Be Faithful
data.preview: <verse>O brother be faithful! soon Jesus will come,For whom
data.data: <verse>O brother be faithful! soon Jesus will come,For whom we have waited so long;O, soon we shall enter our glorious home,And join in the conqueror's song.O brother be faithful! for why should we proveUnfaithful to Him who had shownSuch deep, such unbounded and infinite loveWho died to redeem us His own.</verse><verse>O brother be faithful! the city of gold,Prepared for the good and the blest, Is waiting its portals of pearl to unfold,And welcome thee into thy rest.Then, brother be faithful! not long shall we stayIn weariness here, and forlorn,Time's dark night of sorrow is wearing away,We haste to the glorious morn.</verse><verse>O brother be faithful! He soon will descend,Creation's omnipotent King,While legions of angels His chariot attend,And palm wreaths, of victory bring.O brother be faithful! and soon shalt thou hearThy Savior pronounce the glad word,Well done, faithful servant, thy title is clear,To enter the joy of thy Lord.</verse><verse>O brother be faithful! eternity's yearsShall tell for thy faithfulness now,When bright smiles of gladness shall scatter thy tears,A coronet gleam on thy brow.O brother be faithful! the promise is sure,That waits for the faithful and tried;To reign with the ransomed, immortal and pure,And ever with Jesus abide.</verse>

data.title: Christian, Seek Not Repose
data.preview: <verse>Christian, seek not yet repose, Cast thy dreams of ea
data.data: <verse>Christian, seek not yet repose, Cast thy dreams of ease away;Thou art in the midst of foes; Watch and pray!</verse><verse>Gird thy heavenly armor on, Wear it ever, night and day;Ambushed lies the evil one; Watch and pray!</verse><verse>Hear the victors who o'ercame; Still they mark each warrior's way;All with one sweet voice exclaim: "Watch and pray!"</verse><verse>Hear, above all, hear thy Lord, Him thou lovest to obey;Hide within thy heart His word; "Watch and pray!"</verse><verse>Watch, as if on that alone Hung the issue of the day;Pray that help may be sent down; Watch and pray!</verse>

data.title: We Know Not the Hour
data.preview: <verse>We know not the hour of the Master's appearing;Yet si
data.data: <verse>We know not the hour of the Master's appearing;Yet signs all foretell that the moment is nearingWhen He shall return 'tis a promise most cheeringBut we know not the hour.</verse><chorus>He will come (He will come), let us watch and be ready;He will come (He will come), hallelujah! hallelujah!He will come in the clouds of His Father's bright glory--But we know not the hour.</chorus><verse>There's light for the wise who are seeking salvation;There's truth in the book of the Lord's revelation;Each prophecy points to the great comsummationBut we know not the hour.</verse><verse>We'll watch and we'll pray, with our lamps trimmed and burning;We'll work and we'll wait till the Master's returning;We'll sing and rejoice, every omen discerningBut we know not the hour.</verse>

data.title: My Soul, Be on Thy Guard
data.preview: <verse>My soul, be on thy guard!Ten thousand foes arise;The
data.data: <verse>My soul, be on thy guard!Ten thousand foes arise;The hosts of sin are pressing hardTo draw thee from the skies.</verse><verse>O watch, and fight, and pray!The battle ne'er give o'er;Renew it boldly every day,And help divine implore.</verse><verse>Ne'er think the victory won,Nor lay thine armor down;Thy arduous task will not be doneTill thou obtain the crown.</verse>

data.title: Once to Every Man and Nation
data.preview: <verse>Once to every man and nation, Comes the moment to dec
data.data: <verse>Once to every man and nation, Comes the moment to decide,In the strife of truth with falsehood, For the good or evil side;Some great cause, some great decision, Offering each the bloom or blight,And the choice goes by forever, 'Twixt that darkness and that light.</verse><verse>Then to side with truth is noble, When we share her wretched crust,Ere her cause bring fame and profit, And 'tis prosperous to be just;Then it is the brave man chooses While the coward stands aside,Till the multitude make virtue Of the faith they had denied.</verse><verse>By the light of burning martyrs, Christ, Thy bleeding feet we track,Toiling up new Calv'ries ever With the cross that turns not back;New occasions teach new duties, Time makes ancient good uncouth,They must upward still and onward, Who would keep abreast of truth.</verse><verse>Though the cause of evil prosper, Yet the truth alone is strong;Though her portion be the scaffold, And upon the throne be wrong;Yet that scaffold sways the future, And behind the dim unknown,Standeth God within the shadow, Keeping watch above His own.</verse>

data.title: God of Grace and God of Glory
data.preview: <verse>God of grace and God of glory,On Thy people pour Thy
data.data: <verse>God of grace and God of glory,On Thy people pour Thy power;Now fulfill Thy church's story,Bring her bud to glorious flower.Grant us wisdom, grant us courage,For the facing of this hour. </verse><verse>Lo, the hosts of evil round usScorn Thy Christ, assail His ways;From the fears that long have bound usFree our hearts to faith and praise.Grant us wisdom, grant us courage,For the facing of this hour. </verse><verse>Cure Thy children's warring madness,Bend our pride to Thy control;Shame our wanton selfish gladnessRich in goods and poor in soul.Grant us wisdom, grant us courage,Lest we miss Thy kingdom's goal. </verse><verse>Set our feet on lofty places,Gird our lives that they may beArmored with all Christ-like gracesIn the fight to set all free.Grant us wisdom, grant us courage,That we fail not man nor Thee.</verse>

data.title: Faith Is the Victory
data.preview: <verse>Encamped along the hills of light,Ye Christian soldie
data.data: <verse>Encamped along the hills of light,Ye Christian soldiers, rise,And press the battle ere the nightShall veil the glowing skies.Against the foe in vales below,Let all our strength be hurled;Faith is the victory, we know,That overcomes the world.</verse><chorus>Faith is the victory!Faith is the victory!Oh, glorious victoryThat overcomes the world.</chorus><verse>On every hand the foe we find Drawn up in dread array;Let tents of ease be left behind,And onward to the fray;Salvation's helmet on each head,With truth all girt about, The earth shall tremble 'neath our tread, And echo with our shout. </verse><verse>To him that overcomes the foeWhite raiment shall be giv'n;Before the angels he shall knowHis name confessed in heav'n.Then onward from the hills of light,Our hearts with love aflame;We'll vanquish all the hosts of night,In Jesus' conq'ring name.</verse>

data.title: Am I a Soldier of the Cross?
data.preview: <verse>Am I a soldier of the cross,A follower of the Lamb,An
data.data: <verse>Am I a soldier of the cross,A follower of the Lamb,And shall I fear to own His cause,Or blush to speak His name? </verse><verse>Must I be carried to the skiesOn flowery beds of ease,While others fought to win the prize,And sailed through bloody seas?</verse><verse>Are there no foes for me to face?Must I not stem the flood?Is this vile world a friend to grace,To help me on to God?</verse><verse>Sure I must fight, if I would reign;Increase my courage, LordI'll bear the toil, endure the pain,Supported by Thy word</verse><verse>Thy saints in all this glorious warShall conquer though they die;They see the triumph from afar,By faith they bring it nigh</verse><verse>When that illustrious day shall rise,And all Thy armies shineIn robes of victory through the skies,The glory shall be Thine </verse>

data.title: Stand Like the Brave
data.preview: <verse>O Christian, awake! 'tis the Master's command;With he
data.data: <verse>O Christian, awake! 'tis the Master's command;With helmet and shield, and a sword in thy hand,To meet the bold tempter, go, fearlessly go,Then stand like the brave, with thy face to the foe.</verse><chorus>Stand like the brave, stand like the brave,Stand like the brave, with thy face to the foe.</chorus><verse>The cause of thy Master with vigor defend;Be watchful, be zealous, and fight to the end;Wherever He leads thee, go, valiantly go,Then stand like the brave, with thy face to the foe.</verse><verse>Press on, never doubting, thy Captain is near,With grace to supply, and with comfort to cheer;His love, like a stream in the desert will flow;Then stand like the brave, with thy face to the foe.</verse>

data.title: Awake, My Soul!
data.preview: <verse>Awake, my soul! stretch every nerve,And press with vi
data.data: <verse>Awake, my soul! stretch every nerve,And press with vigor on;A heavenly race demands thy zeal,And an immortal crown. </verse><verse>'Tis God's all animating voiceThat calls thee from on high;'Tis He whose hand presents the prizeTo thine aspiring eye. </verse><verse>A cloud of witnesses aroundHold thee in full survey;Forget the steps already trod,And onward urge thy way. </verse><verse>Blest Savior, introduced by Thee,Our race have we begun;And, crowned with victory, at Thy feetWe'll lay our trophies down.</verse>

data.title: Onward, Christian Soldiers!
data.preview: <verse>Onward, Christian soldiers, Marching as to war,With t
data.data: <verse>Onward, Christian soldiers, Marching as to war,With the cross of Jesus Going on before.Christ, the royal Master, Leads against the foe;Forward into battle see His banners go!</verse><chorus>Onward, Christian soldiers, Marching as to war,With the cross of Jesus Going on before.</chorus><verse>Like a mighty army Moves the church of God;Brothers, we are treading Where the saints have trod.We are not divided, All one body we,One in hope and doctrine, One in charity.</verse><verse>Crowns and thrones may perish, Kingdoms rise and wane,But the church of Jesus Constant will remain.Gates of hell can never 'Gainst that church prevail;We have Christ's own promise, That can never fail.</verse><verse>Onward then, ye people, Join our happy throng,Blend with ours your voices In the triumph song.Glory, laud, and honor Unto Christ the King,This through countless ages Men and angels sing.</verse>

data.title: Fight the Good Fight
data.preview: <verse>Fight the good fight with all thy might;Christ is thy
data.data: <verse>Fight the good fight with all thy might;Christ is thy strength, and Christ thy right;Lay hold on life and it shall beThy joy and crown eternally. </verse><verse>Run the straight race through God's good grace;Lift up thine eyes, and seek His face.Life with its path before us lies;Christ is the way, and Christ the prize. </verse><verse>Cast care aside, lean on thy guide,His boundless mercy will provide;Trust, and the trusting soul shall proveChrist is its life, and Christ its love. </verse><verse>Faint not, nor fear, His arms are near;He changeth not, and thou art dear.Only believe, and thou shalt seeThat Christ is all in all to thee.</verse>

data.title: Sound the Battle Cry
data.preview: <verse>Sound the battle cry,See! the foe is nigh;Raise the s
data.data: <verse>Sound the battle cry,See! the foe is nigh;Raise the standard highFor the Lord;Gird your armor on,Stand firm, every one,Rest your cause upon His holy word.</verse><chorus>Rouse, then soldiers!Rally round the banner!Ready, steady, pass the word along;Onward, forward, shout aloud hosanna!Christ is Captain of the mighty throng.</chorus><verse>Strong to meet the foe,Marching on we go,While our cause we knowMust prevail;Shield and banner bright,Gleaming in the light,Battling for the right,We ne'er can fail.</verse><verse>O Thou God of all,Hear us when we call,Help us, one and all,By Thy grace;When the battle's done,And the victory won,May we wear the crownBefore Thy face.</verse>

data.title: Rise Up, O Church of God
data.preview: <verse>Rise up, O men of God!His kingdom tarries long.Bring
data.data: <verse>Rise up, O men of God!His kingdom tarries long.Bring in the day of brotherhoodAnd end the night of wrong.</verse><verse>Let women all rise up!Have done with lesser things.Give heart and mind and soul and strengthTo serve the King of kings.</verse><verse>Rise up, courageous youth!The church for you doth wait,Her strength unequal to her task;Rise up, and make her great!</verse><verse>Lift high the cross of Christ!Tread where His feet have trod.Disciples of the Son of Man,Rise up, O church of God!</verse>

data.title: Soldiers of Christ, Arise
data.preview: <verse>Soldiers of Christ,arise,And put your armor on,Strong
data.data: <verse>Soldiers of Christ,arise,And put your armor on,Strong in the strength which God suppliesThrough His eternal SonStrong in the Lord of hosts,And in His mighty power,Who in the strength of Jesus trustsIs more than conqueror.</verse><verse>Stand then in His great might,With all His strength endued,But take, to arm you for the fight,The panoply of God;That, having all things done,And all your conflicts passed,Ye may o'ercome through Christ alone,And stand entire at last.</verse><verse>From strength to strength go on,Wrestle and fight and pray,Tread all the powers of darkness downAnd win the well-fought day.Still let the Spirit cryIn all His soldiers, "Come!"Till Christ the Lord who reigns on highShall take the conquerors home.</verse>

data.title: We Are Living, We Are Dwelling
data.preview: <verse>We are living, we are dwelling, In a grand and awful
data.data: <verse>We are living, we are dwelling, In a grand and awful time,In an age on ages telling-- To be living is sublime.Hark! the waking up of nations, Gog and Magog to the fray;Hark! what soundeth? Is creation Groaning for her latter day?</verse><verse>Christian, rouse and arm for conflict, Nerve thee for the battlefield;Bear the helmet of salvation, And the mighty gospel shield;Let the breastplate, peace, be on thee, Take the Spirit's sword in hand;Boldly, fearlessly, go forth then, In Jehovah's strength to stand.</verse><verse>And the prince of evil spirits, Great deceiver of the world!He who at the blessed Jesus Once his deadly weapons hurled,Cometh with unwonted power, Knowing that his reign will ceaseWhen the kingdom shall be given To the mighty Prince of Peace.</verse><verse>Christians, rouse! fight in this warfare, Cease not till the victory's won;Till your Captain loud proclaimeth, "Servant of the Lord, well done!"He, alone, who thus is faithful, Who abideth to the end,Hath the promise, in the kingdom An eternity to spend.</verse>

data.title: Stand Up! Stand Up for Jesus!
data.preview: <verse>Stand up, stand up for Jesus! Ye soldiers of the cros
data.data: <verse>Stand up, stand up for Jesus! Ye soldiers of the cross;Lift high His royal banner, It must not suffer loss:From vict'ry unto vict'ry, His army shall He lead,Till every foe is vanquished, And Christ is Lord indeed.</verse><verse>Stand up, stand up for Jesus! The trumpet call obey:Forth to the mighty conflict, In this His glorious day;Ye that are men now serve Him Against unnumbered foes;Let courage rise with danger, And strength to strength oppose.</verse><verse>Stand up, stand up for Jesus! Stand in His strength alone,The arm of flesh will fail you, Ye dare not trust your own;Put on the gospel armor, And watching unto prayer,Where calls the voice of duty, Be never wanting there.</verse><verse>Stand up, stand up for Jesus! The strife will not be long;This day the noise of battle, The next the victor's song;To him that overcometh A crown of life shall be;He with the King of glory Shall reign eternally.</verse>

data.title: Lead On, O King Eternal
data.preview: <verse>Lead on, O King eternal,The day of march has come;Hen
data.data: <verse>Lead on, O King eternal,The day of march has come;Henceforth in fields of conquestThy tents shall be our home.Through days of preparationThy grace has made us strong;And now, O King eternal,We lift our battle song.</verse><verse>Lead on, O King eternal,Till sin's fierce war shall cease,And holiness shall whisperThe sweet amen of peace.For not with swords loud clashing,Nor roll of stirring drums;With deeds of love and mercyThe heavenly kingdom comes.</verse><verse>Lead on, O King eternal,We follow, not with fears,For gladness breaks like morningWhere'er Thy face appears.Thy cross is lifted o'er us,We journey in its light;The crown awaits the conquest;Lead on, O God of might.</verse>

data.title: On Jordan's Stormy Banks
data.preview: <verse>On Jordan's stormy banks I stand,And cast a wishful e
data.data: <verse>On Jordan's stormy banks I stand,And cast a wishful eyeTo Canaan's fair and happy land,Where my possessions lie.</verse><chorus>I am bound for the promised land,I am bound  for the promised land;O who will come and go with me?I am bound for the promised land.</chorus><verse>O'er all those wide extended plainsShines one eternal day;There, Christ, the Sun, for ever reigns,And scatters night away.</verse><verse>When shall I reach that happy place,And be forever blest?When shall I see my Father's face,And in His kingdom rest?</verse><verse>Filled with delight, my raptured soulWould here no longer stay;Though Jordan's waves around me roll,Fearless I'd launch away.</verse>

data.title: Gracious Father, Guard Thy Children
data.preview: <verse>Gracious Father, guard Thy childrenFrom the foe's des
data.data: <verse>Gracious Father, guard Thy childrenFrom the foe's destructive power;Save, O save them, Lord, from fallingIn this dark and trying hour.Thou wilt surely prove Thy people,All our graces must be tried;But Thy word illumes our pathway,And in God we still confide.</verse><verse>We are in the time of waiting;Soon we shall behold our Lord,Wafted far away from sorrow,To receive our rich reward.Keep us, Lord, till Thine appearing,Pure, unspotted from the world;Let Thy Holy Spirit cheer usTill Thy banner is unfurled.</verse><verse>With what joyful exultationShall the saints Thy banner see,When the Lord for whom we've waitedShall proclaim the jubilee!Freedom from this world's pollutions;Freedom from all sin and pain;Freedom from the wiles of Satan,And from death's destructive reign.</verse>

data.title: Come, Come, Ye Saints
data.preview: <verse>Come, come, ye saints, no toil nor labor fear;But wit
data.data: <verse>Come, come, ye saints, no toil nor labor fear;But with joy wend your way.Though hard to you the journey may appear,Grace shall be as your day.We have a living Lord to guide,And we can trust Him to provide;Do this, and joy your hearts will swell:All is well! All is well!</verse><verse>We'll find the rest which God for us prepared,When at last He will call;Where none will come to hurt or make afraid,He will reign over all.We will make the air with music ring,Shout praise to God our Lord and King:O how we'll make the chorus swell:All is well! All is well!</verse>

data.title: I Will Follow Thee
data.preview: <verse>I will follow Thee, my Savior,Wheresoe'er my lot may
data.data: <verse>I will follow Thee, my Savior,Wheresoe'er my lot may be.Where thou goest I will follow;Yes, my Lord, I'll follow Thee.</verse><chorus>I will follow Thee, my Saviour,Thou didst shed Thy blood for me;And though all men should forsake Thee;By Thy grace I'll follow Thee.</chorus><verse>Though the road be rough and thorny,Trackless as the foaming sea,Thou hast trod this way before me,And I'll gladly follow Thee.</verse><verse>Though I meet with tribulations,Sorely tempted though I be;I remember Thou wast tempted,And rejoice to follow Thee.</verse><verse>Though Thou leadest me through affliction,Poor, forsaken though I be;Thou wast destitute, afflicted,And I only follow Thee.</verse><verse>Though to Jordan's rolling billows,Cold and deep, Thou leadest me,Thou hast crossed the waves before me,And I still will follow Thee.</verse>

data.title: I Want Jesus to Walk With Me
data.preview: <verse>I want Jesus to walk with me.I want Jesus to walk wit
data.data: <verse>I want Jesus to walk with me.I want Jesus to walk with me.All along my pilgrim journey,I want Jesus to walk with me.</verse><verse>In my trials Lord, walk with me.In my trials Lord, walk with me.When the shades of life are falling,I want Jesus to walk with me.</verse><verse>In my sorrows, Lord, walk with me.In my sorrows, Lord, walk with me.When my heart within is aching,I want Jesus to walk with me.</verse>

data.title: Higher Ground
data.preview: <verse>I'm pressing on the upward way,New heights I'm gainin
data.data: <verse>I'm pressing on the upward way,New heights I'm gaining every day;Still praying as I'm onward bound,"Lord, plant my feet on higher ground."</verse><chorus>Lord, lift me up and let me stand,By faith, on Heaven's table land,A higher plane than I have found;Lord, plant my feet on higher ground.</chorus><verse>My heart has no desire to stayWhere doubts arise and fears dismay;Though some may dwell where those abound,My prayer, my aim, is higher ground.</verse><verse>I want to live above the world,Though Satan's darts at me are hurled;For faith has caught the joyful sound,The song of saints on higher ground.</verse><verse>I want to scale the utmost heightAnd catch a gleam of glory bright;But still I'll pray till Heav'n I've found,"Lord, plant my feet on higher ground."</verse>

data.title: In a Little While We're Going Home
data.preview: <verse>Let us sing a song that will cheer us by the way,In a
data.data: <verse>Let us sing a song that will cheer us by the way,In a little while we're going home.For the night will end in the everlasting day,In a little while we're going home.</verse><chorus>In a little while, In a little while,We shall cross the billow's foam;We shall meet at last, When the stormy winds are past,In a little while we're going home.</chorus><verse>We will do the work that our hands may find to do,In a little while we're going home.And the grace of God will our daily strength renew,In a little while we're going home.</verse><verse>We will smooth the path for some weary, wayworn feet,In a little while we're going home.And may loving hearts spread around an influence sweet!In a little while we're going home.</verse><verse>There's a rest beyond, there's relief from every care,In a little while we're going home;And no tears shall fall in that city bright and fair,In a little while we're going home.</verse>

data.title: Jacob's Ladder
data.preview: <verse>We are climbing Jacob's ladder,We are climbing Jacob'
data.data: <verse>We are climbing Jacob's ladder,We are climbing Jacob's ladder,We are climbing Jacob's ladder,Soldiers of the cross.</verse><verse>Every round goes higher, higher,Every round goes higher, higher,Every round goes higher, higher,Soldiers of the cross.</verse><verse>Sinner, do you love my Jesus?Sinner, do you love my Jesus?Sinner, do you love my Jesus?Soldiers of the cross.</verse><verse>If you love him, why not serve him?If you love him, why not serve him?If you love him, why not serve him?Soldiers of the cross.</verse>

data.title: As Jacob With Travel Was Weary
data.preview: <verse>As Jacob with travel was weary one day,At night on a
data.data: <verse>As Jacob with travel was weary one day,At night on a stone for a pillow he lay;He saw in a vision a ladder so highThat its foot was on earth and its top in the sky.</verse><chorus>Alleluia to Jesus who died on the tree,And has raised up a ladder of mercy for me,And has raised up a ladder of mercy for me.</chorus><verse>Come let us ascend! All may climb it who will;For the angels of Jacob are guarding it still:And remember each step that by faith we passo'er,Some prophet or martyr has trod it before.</verse><verse>And when we arrive at the haven of restWe shall hear the glad words, "Come up hither, ye blest,Here are regions of light, here are mansions of bliss."O who would not climb such a ladder as this?</verse>

data.title: O Happy Band of Pilgrims
data.preview: <verse>O happy band of pilgrims,If onward ye will treadWith
data.data: <verse>O happy band of pilgrims,If onward ye will treadWith Jesus as your fellow,To Jesus as your Head!</verse><verse>O happy if ye laborAs Jesus did for men;O happy if ye hungerAs Jesus hungered then!</verse><verse>The trials that beset you,The sorrows ye endure,The manifold temptationsThat death alone can cure,</verse><verse>What are they but His jewelsOf right celestial worth?What are they but the ladderSet up to heaven on earth?</verse><verse>O happy band of pilgrims,Look upward to the skies,Where such a light afflictionShall win you such a prize!</verse>

data.title: Rise, My Soul, and Stretch Thy Wings
data.preview: <verse>Rise, my soul, and stretch thy wings, Thy better port
data.data: <verse>Rise, my soul, and stretch thy wings, Thy better portion trace;Rise from transitory things Toward heaven, thy native place;Sun, and moon, and stars decay; Time shall soon this earth remove;Rise, my soul, and haste away To seats prepared above.</verse><verse>Rivers to the ocean run, Nor stay in all their course;Fire ascending seeks the sun; Both speed them to their source;So a soul that's born of God, Longs to view His glorious face,Forward tends to His abode To rest in His embrace.</verse><verse>Cease, ye pilgrims, cease to mourn; Press onward to the prize;Soon our Savior will return, Triumphant in the skies;Yet a season, and you know Happy entrance will be given,All our sorrows left below, And earth exhcanged for heaven.</verse>

data.title: When on Life a Darkness Falls
data.preview: <verse>When on life a darkness falls,When the mist flows chi
data.data: <verse>When on life a darkness falls,When the mist flows chilling,Paths and sign posts lost in doubt,Loveless, unfulfilling,Reach us, Jesus, from Your cross,Though we feel forsaken;Keep us through the aching nightTill new dawns awaken.</verse><verse>When the dreams and vows of youthPainfully accuse us,Stab our conscience, steal our worth,Christ will not refuse us:Peace the world cannot provide,Daily resurrection,Strong companion at our sideFor each new direction.</verse><verse>Come and meet Him, Friend and lord,Thro' the gospel story:Open door to life and peace,Window into glory.All who seek Him, soon are found,Made His close relation:Christ our pathway, Christ our home,Christ our sure foundation.</verse>

data.title: Until Then
data.preview: <verse>My heart can sing when I pause to remember,A heartach
data.data: <verse>My heart can sing when I pause to remember,A heartache here is but a stepping stone.Along a trail, that's winding always upward,This troubled world, is not my final home.</verse><chorus>But until then, my heart will go on singing,Until then, with joy I'll carry on,Until the day my eyes behold the city,Until the day God calls me home.</chorus><verse>The things of earth will dim and loose their value,If we recall they're borrowed for awhile;And things of earth that cause the heart to tremble,Remember there, will only bring a smile.</verse>

data.title: When We All Get to Heaven
data.preview: <verse>Sing the wondrous love of Jesus;Sing His mercy and Hi
data.data: <verse>Sing the wondrous love of Jesus;Sing His mercy and His grace.In the mansions bright and blessedHe'll prepare for us a place.</verse><chorus>When we all get to heaven,What a day of rejoicing that will be!When we all see Jesus,We'll sing and shout the victory!</chorus><verse>While we walk the pilgrim pathway,Clouds will overspread the sky;But when traveling days are over,Not a shadow, not a sigh.</verse><verse>Let us then be true and faithful,Trusting, serving every day;Just one glimpse of Him in gloryWill the toils of life repay.</verse><verse>Onward to the prize before us!Soon His beauty we'll behold;Soon the pearly gates will open;We shall tread the streets of gold.</verse>

data.title: Come, All Christians, Be Committed
data.preview: <verse>Come, all Christians, be committedTo the service of t
data.data: <verse>Come, all Christians, be committedTo the service of the lord;Make your lives for Him more fitted,Tune your hearts with one accord.Come into His courts with gladness,Each his sacred vows renew,Turn away from sin and sadness,Be transformed with life anew.</verse><verse>Of your time and talents give ye,They are gifts from God above;To be used by Christians freelyTo proclaim His wondrous love.Come again to serve the Savior,Tithes and off'rings with you bring.In your work, with Him find favor,And with joy His praises sing.</verse><verse>God's command to love each otherIs required of every one;Showing mercy to one anotherMirrors His redemptive plan.In compassion He has givenOf His love that is divine;On the cross sins were forgiven;Joy and peace are fully thine.</verse><verse>Come in praise and adoration,All who in Christ's name believe;Worship Him with consecration,Grace and love you will receive.For His grace give Him the glory,For the Spirit and the Word,And repeat the gospel storyTill mankind His name has heard.</verse>

data.title: Lord of All Good
data.preview: <verse>Lord of all good, our gifts we bring You now;Use them
data.data: <verse>Lord of all good, our gifts we bring You now;Use them Your holy purpose to fulfill.Tokens of love and pledges they shall beThat our whole life is offered to Your will.</verse><verse>We give our minds to understand Your ways;Hands, voices, eyes to serve Your great design;Hearts with the flame of your own love ablaze:Thus for Your glory all our pow'rs combine.</verse><verse>Father, whose bounty all creation shows;Christ, by whose willing sacrifice we live;Spirit, from whom all life in fullness flows:To You with grateful hearts ourselves we give.</verse>

data.title: God, Whose Giving Knows No Ending
data.preview: <verse>God, whose giving knows no ending,From Your rich and
data.data: <verse>God, whose giving knows no ending,From Your rich and endless store:Nature's wonder, Jesus' wisdom,Costly cross, grave's shattered door.Gifted by You, we turn to You,Off'ring up ourselves in praise:Thankful song shall rise forever,Gracious donor of our days.</verse><verse>Skills and time are ours for pressingToward the goals of Christ, Your Son:All at peace in health and freedom,Races joined, the church made one.Now direct our daily labor,Lest we strive for self alone:Born with talents, make us servantsFit to answer at Your throne.</verse><verse>Treasure, too, You have entrusted,Gain through pow'rs Your grace conferred:Ours to use for home and kindred,And to spread the Gospel Word.Open wide our hands in sharing,As we heed Christ's ageless call.Healing, teaching, and reclaiming,Serving You by loving all.</verse>

data.title: Son of God, Eternal Savior
data.preview: <verse>Son of God, eternal Savior,Source of life and truth a
data.data: <verse>Son of God, eternal Savior,Source of life and truth and grace,Word made flesh, whose birth among usHallows all our human race,You our head, Who throned in glory,For Your own will ever plead:Fill us with Your love and pity,Heal our wrongs, and help our need.</verse><verse>Bind us all as one togetherIn Your church's sacred fold,Weak and healthy, poor and wealthy,Sad and joyful, young and old.Is there want or pain or sorrow?Make us all the burden share.Are there spirits crushed and broken?Teach us, Lord, to soothe their care.</verse><verse>As You, Lord, have lived for others,So may we for others live.Freely have Your gifts been granted;Freely may Your servants give.Yours the gold and Yours the silver,Yours the wealth of land and sea;We but stewards of Your bountyHeld in solemn trust will be.</verse><verse>Come, O Christ, and reign among us,King of love and Prince of Peace;Hush the storm of strife and passion,Bid its cruel discords cease.By Your patient years of toiling,By Your silent hours of pain,Quench our fevered thirst of pleasure,Stem our selfish greed of gain.</verse><verse>Son of God, eternal Savior,Source of life and truth and grace,Word made flesh, whose birth among usHallows all our human race:By Your praying, by Your willingThat Your people should be one,Grant, oh, grant our hope's fruition:Here on earth Your will be done.</verse>

data.title: The Wise May Bring Their Learning
data.preview: <verse>The wise may bring their learning,The rich may bring
data.data: <verse>The wise may bring their learning,The rich may bring their wealth,And some may bring their greatness,And some their strength and health:We too would bring our treasuresTo offer to the King,We have no wealth or learning---What shall we children bring?</verse><verse>We'll bring Him hearts that love Him,We'll bring Him thankful praise,And young souls meekly strivingTo follow in His ways:And these be the treasuresWe offer to the King,And these are gifts that everThe poorest child may bring.</verse><verse>We'll bring the little dutiesWe have to do each day;We'll try our best to please HimAt home, at school, at play:And better are these treasuresTo offer to the KingThan richest gift without them:Yet these a child may bring.</verse>

data.title: A Diligent and Grateful Heart
data.preview: <verse>A diligent and grateful heartPrompts me to sing Thy p
data.data: <verse>A diligent and grateful heartPrompts me to sing Thy praise.Thy love and mercies from the startHave blessed me all my days.</verse><verse>I thank Thee for the means to serveWith talents and with tithes,For sharing brings the utmost joyWhen lifting other lives.</verse><verse>My thanks I give you for stewardshipTo minister through deeds,To serve and share with patient careThy people in their needs.</verse><verse>O Lord, I dedicate my allIn this response to Thee.Help me to magnify this callIn deep humility.</verse>

data.title: For Beauty of Meadows
data.preview: <verse>For beauty of meadows, for grandeur of trees,For flow
data.data: <verse>For beauty of meadows, for grandeur of trees,For flowers of woodlands, for creatures of seas,For all You created and gave us to share,We praise You, Creator, extolling your care.</verse><verse>As stewards of beauty received at Your hand,As creatures who hear Your most urgent command,We turn from our wasteful destruction of life,Confessing our failures, confessing our strife.</verse><verse>Teach us once again to be gardeners in peace;All nature around us is ours but on lease;Your name we would hallow in all that we do,Fulfilling our calling, creating with You.</verse>

data.title: God in His Love for Us
data.preview: <verse>God in His love for us lent us this planet,Gave it a
data.data: <verse>God in His love for us lent us this planet,Gave it a purpose in time and in space:Small as a spark from the fire of creation,Cradle of life and the home of our race.</verse><verse>Thanks be to God for its bounty and beauty,Life that sustains us in body and mind:Plenty for all, if we learn how to share it,Riches undreamed of to fathom and find.</verse><verse>Long have our human wars ruined its harvest;Long has earth bowed to the terror of force;Long have we wasted what others have need of,Poisoned the fountain of life at its source.</verse><verse>Earth is the Lord's: it is ours to enjoy it,Ours, as His stewards, to farm and defend.From its pollution, misuse, and destruction,Good Lord, deliver us, world without end!</verse>

data.title: We Praise Thee With Our Minds
data.preview: <verse>We praise Thee with our minds, O Lord,Kept sharp to t
data.data: <verse>We praise Thee with our minds, O Lord,Kept sharp to think Thy thought;Come, Holy Ghost with grace outpoured,To teach what Christ hath taught.In all our learning may we seekThat wisdom from aboveWhich comes to all: the brave, the meek,Who ask in faith and love.</verse><verse>We praise Thee thro' our bodies, Lord,Kept strong to do Thy will;Thy Spirit's temples, which affordA means to praise Thee still.We give ourselves, a sacrifice,To live as unto Thee;For Thou alone hast paid the priceTo bring salvation free.</verse><verse>We praise Thee in our hearts, O king,Kept pure to know Thy ways;And raise to Thee a hymn to singEternally Thy praise.Altho adoring hearts will bowAs age on ages roll;We praise Thee in our beings now,Mind, body, heart, and soul.</verse>

data.title: Father, Who on Us Do Shower
data.preview: <verse>Father, who on us do showerGifts of plenty form Your
data.data: <verse>Father, who on us do showerGifts of plenty form Your dower,To Your people give the powerAll Your gifts to use aright.</verse><verse>Give pure happiness in leisureTemperance in every pleasure,Wholesome use of earthly treasureBodies clean and spirits bright.</verse><verse>Lift from this and every nationAll that brings us degradation;Quell the forces of temptation;Put Your enemies to flight.</verse><verse>Father, You who sought and found us,Son of God, whose love has bound us,Holy Spirit, in us, round us,Hear us, Godhead infinite.</verse>

data.title: O God, Whose Will Is Life and Good
data.preview: <verse>O God, whose will is life and goodFor all of mortal b
data.data: <verse>O God, whose will is life and goodFor all of mortal breath:Unite in bonds of servanthoodAll those who strive with death.</verse><verse>Make strong their hands and hearts and willsTo drive disease afar,To strive against the body's illsAnd wage Your healing war.</verse><verse>By healing of the sick and blind,Christ's mercy they proclaim,Make known the great physician's mind,Affirm the Savior's name.</verse><verse>Before them set Your gracious will,That they, with heart and soul,To You may consecrate their skillAnd make the sufferer whole.</verse>

data.title: God of our fathers
data.preview: <verse>God of our fathers, Whose almighty handLeads forth in
data.data: <verse>God of our fathers, Whose almighty handLeads forth in beauty all the starry bandOf shining worlds in splendor through the skiesOur grateful songs before Thy throne arise.</verse><verse>Thy love divine hath led us in the past,In this free land by Thee our lot is cast,Be Thou our Ruler, Guardian, Guide and Stay,Thy Word our law, Thy paths our chosen way.</verse><verse>From war's alarms, from deadly pestilence,Be Thy strong arm our ever sure defense;Thy true religion in our hearts increase,Thy bounteous goodness nourish us in peace.</verse><verse>Refresh Thy people on their toilsome way,Lead us from night to never ending day;Fill all our lives with love and grace divine,And glory, laud, and praise be ever Thine.</verse>

data.title: To the Name That Brings Salvation
data.preview: <verse>To the name that brings salvation Let the nations bow
data.data: <verse>To the name that brings salvation Let the nations bow the head; Let them kneel in adoration When this name of names is said; Let them pray for restoration Of all things in Christ the head.</verse><verse>He through every generation Rules in endless majesty; May the kings of every nation Now foreswear their enmity, And with humble veneration In the love of God agree.</verse><verse>Lord, we pray for upright rulers: Guard them surely in their need From the vanity of power And the emptiness of greed; Let them see the truth of lowness, And on justice let them feed. </verse>

data.title: Mine Eyes Have Seen the Glory
data.preview: <verse>Mine eyes have seen the glory of the coming of the Lo
data.data: <verse>Mine eyes have seen the glory of the coming of the Lord;He is trampling out the vintage where the grapes of wrath are stored;He has loosed the fateful lightning of His terrible swift sword;His truth is marching on. </verse><chorus>Glory! Glory! Hallelujah! Glory! Glory! Hallelujah!Glory! Glory! Hallelujah! His truth is marching on. </chorus><verse>He has sounded forth the trumpet that shall never call retreat;He is sifting out the hearts of men before His judgment seat;O be swift, my soul, to answer Him! be jubilant, my feet!Our God is marching on. </verse><verse>In the beauty of the lilies Christ was born across the sea,With a glory in His bosom that transfigures you and me;As He died to make men holy, let us live to make men free!While God is marching on.</verse>

data.title: I Vow to Thee, My Country
data.preview: <verse>I vow to thee, my country, all earthly things above,E
data.data: <verse>I vow to thee, my country, all earthly things above,Entire and whole and perfect, the service of my love:The love that asks the reason, the love that stands the test,That lays upon the altar the dearest and the best;The love that never falters, the love that pays the price,The love that makes undaunted the final sacrifice. </verse><verse>And there's another country, I've heard of long ago,Most dear to them that love her, most great to them that know;We may not count her armies, we may not see her King;Her fortress is a faithful heart, her pride is suffering;And one by one and fervently we pray for her increase,And her ways are ways of gentleness, and all her paths are peace.</verse>

data.title: Lord, While for All Mankind We Pray
data.preview: <verse>Lord, while for all mankind we prayOf every clime and
data.data: <verse>Lord, while for all mankind we prayOf every clime and coast,O hear us for our native land,The land we love the most! </verse><verse>O guard our shores from every foe,With peace our borders bless;With prosperous times our cities crown,Our fields with plenteousness! </verse><verse>Unite us in the sacred loveOf knowledge, truth, and Thee;And let our hills and valleys shoutThe songs of liberty. </verse><verse>Lord of the nations, thus to TheeOur country we commend;Be Thou her Refuge and her trust,Her everlasting friend.</verse>

data.title: Our Father, by Whose Name
data.preview: <verse>Our Father, by whose name,All fatherhood is known,Who
data.data: <verse>Our Father, by whose name,All fatherhood is known,Who dost in love proclaimEach family Thine own,Bless Thou all parents, guarding well,With constant love as sentinel,The homes in which Thy people dwell.</verse><verse>O Christ, Thyself a childWithin an earthly home,With heart still undefiled,Thou didst to manhood come;Our children bless, in every place,That they may all behold Thy face,And knowing Thee may grow in grace.</verse><verse>O Spirit, who dost bindOur hearts in unity,Who teaches us to findThe love from self set free,In all our hearts such love increase,That every home, by this release,May be dwelling place of peace.</verse>

data.title: Happy the Home That Welcomes You
data.preview: <verse>Happy the home that welcomes You, Lord Jesus,Truest o
data.data: <verse>Happy the home that welcomes You, Lord Jesus,Truest of friends, most honored guest of all,Where hearts and eyes are bright with joy to greet You,Your lightest wishes eager to fulfill.</verse><verse>Happy the home where man and wife togetherAre of one mind believing in Your love:Through love and pain, prosperity and hardship,Through good and evil days Your care they prove.</verse><verse>Happy the home, O loving Friend of children,Where they are giv'n to you with hands of prayer,Where at Your feet they early learn to listenTo Your own Words, and thank You for your care</verse>

data.title: Love at Home
data.preview: <verse>There is beauty all around, When there's love at home
data.data: <verse>There is beauty all around, When there's love at home; There is joy in every sound, When there's love at home. Peace and plenty here abide, Smiling fair on every side; Time doth softly, sweetly glide, When there's love at home.</verse><chorus>Love at home, love at home;Time doth softly, sweetly glide,When there's love at home.</chorus><verse>Kindly heaven smiles above, When there's love at home;All the earth is fill'd with love, When there's love at home.Sweeter sings the brooklet by, Brighter beams the azure sky;O, there's One who smiles on high When there's love at home.</verse><verse>Jesus, make me wholly Thine, Then there's love at home;May Thy sacrifice be mine, Then there's love at home.Safely from all harm I'll rest, With no sinful care distress'd,Thro' Thy tender mercy blessed, When there's love at home.</verse>

data.title: Lead Them, My God, to Thee
data.preview: <verse>Lead them, my God, to Thee, Lead them to Thee,These c
data.data: <verse>Lead them, my God, to Thee, Lead them to Thee,These children dear of mine, Thou gavest me;O, by Thy love divine, Lead them, my God, to Thee;Lead them, my God, to Thee, Lead them to Thee.</verse><verse>When earth looks bright and fair, Festive and gay,Let no delusive snare Lure them astray;But from temptation's power, Lead them, my God, to Thee,Lead them, my God, to Thee, Lead them to Thee.</verse><verse>E'en for such little ones, Christ came a child,And in this world of sin Lived undefiled.O, for His sake, I pray, Lead them, my God, to Thee,Lead them, my God, to Thee, Lead them to Thee.</verse><verse>Yea, though my faith be dim, I would believeThat Thou this precious gift Wilt now receive;O take their young hearts now, Lead them my God to Thee,Lead them, my God, to Thee, Lead them to Thee.</verse>

data.title: Lord, Bless Our Homes
data.preview: <verse>Lord, bless our homes with peace and love and laughte
data.data: <verse>Lord, bless our homes with peace and love and laughter,With understanding and with loyalty.May we together follow Christ the MasterAnd know the blessing of His sov'reignty. </verse><verse>May every heart receive His loving spiritAnd know the truth that makes life truly free;Then, in that spirit may we live united,And find in God our deep security.</verse><verse>Forgive the hurts our selfishness inflictedOn those we love and those who love us best.Christ, heal the scars and draw us all togetherIn Him whose will is peace and joy and rest.</verse><verse>Father, in gratitude for homes and loved ones,We open now our hearts to all mankind.Grand us Your spirit love for one anotherSo in Your peace may we our concord find.</verse>

data.title: Happy the Home
data.preview: <verse>Happy the home when God is there, And love fills ever
data.data: <verse>Happy the home when God is there, And love fills every breast; When one their wish, and one their prayer, And one their heavenly rest. </verse><verse>Happy the home where Jesus' name Is sweet to every ear; Where children early speak His fame, And parents hold Him dear. </verse><verse>Happy the home where prayer is heard, And praise is wont to rise; Where parents love the sacred Word And all its wisdom prize. </verse><verse>Lord, let us in our homes agree This blessed peace to gain; Unite our hearts in love to Thee, And love to all will reign. </verse>

data.title: O Perfect Love
data.preview: <verse>O perfect Love, all human thought transcending, Lowly
data.data: <verse>O perfect Love, all human thought transcending, Lowly we kneel in prayer before Thy throne, That theirs may be the love that has no ending, Whom Thou forevermore dost join in one. </verse><verse>O perfect Life, be Thou their full assuranceOf tender charity and steadfast faith, Of patient hope and quiet, brave endurance, With childlike trust that fears nor pain nor death. </verse><verse>Grant them the joy which brightens earthly sorrow; Grant them the peace which calms all earthly strife, And to life's day the glorious unknown morrow That dawns upon eternal love and life. </verse>

data.title: O God, From Whom Mankind
data.preview: <verse>O God from whom mankind derives its name;Whose covena
data.data: <verse>O God from whom mankind derives its name;Whose covenant of grace remains the same,Be with these two who now before You wait;Enlarge the love they come to consecrate. </verse><verse>May through their union other lives be blessed;Their door be wide to stranger and to guest,Give them the understanding that is kind,Grant them the blessing of an open mind. </verse><verse>Preserve their days from inwardness of heart;To each the gift of truthful speech impart.Their bond be strong against all strain and strifeAmid the changes of this earthly life. </verse><verse>From stage to stage on life's unfolding wayBring to their mind the vows they make this day,Your Spirit be their Guide in every move,Their faith in Christ the basis of their love.</verse>

data.title: Heavenly Father, Hear Our Prayer
data.preview: <verse>Heav'nly Father, hear our prayerAs we bow before You:
data.data: <verse>Heav'nly Father, hear our prayerAs we bow before You:Bless them in the life they share,Humbly we implore You.Be their guide in all endeavors, Be their hope that nothing severs;Constant source of love divine,Let Your love within them shine!</verse><verse>As they pledge their love this dayHere before Your altar,May their hearts, upon You stayed,Never fail or falter.Be their comfort in all sorrow;Be their reason for tomorrow.Grant them strength to live each hourTrusting solely in Your pow'r.</verse><verse>Blest Creator, Lord of life,Hear our glad thanksgiving.Husband You have joined to wifeFor their earthly living.Justified by Jesus' merit, Life eternal they inherit.When their days on earth have passed,Take them to Your home at last!</verse>

data.title: May the Grace of Christ Our Savior
data.preview: <verse>May the grace of Christ our SaviorAnd the Father's bo
data.data: <verse>May the grace of Christ our SaviorAnd the Father's boundless love,With the Holy Spirit's favor,Rest upon them from above.</verse><verse>Thus may they abide in unionWith each other and the Lord,And possess, in sweet communion,Joys which earth cannot afford.</verse>

data.title: Glory Be to the Father
data.preview: <verse>Glory be to the Father, And to the Son, And to the Ho
data.data: <verse>Glory be to the Father, And to the Son, And to the Holy Ghost; As it was in the beginning, Is now, and ever shall be, World without end. Amen, Amen. </verse>

data.title: Holy, Holy, Holy
data.preview: <verse>Holy, holy, holy, Holy is the Lord!Holy, holy, holy,
data.data: <verse>Holy, holy, holy, Holy is the Lord!Holy, holy, holy, Holy is our God!He who always liveth, Evermore the sameHeav'n and earth He ruleth, Come and praise His name!</verse><verse>Holy, holy, holy, Holy is the Lord!Holy, holy, holy, Holy is our God!Glorious and beloved Is the One adored!Holy, holy, holy, Holy is the Lord.</verse>

data.title: Let All Mortal Flesh Keep Silence
data.preview: <verse>Let all mortal flesh keep silence, And with fear and
data.data: <verse>Let all mortal flesh keep silence, And with fear and trembling stand;Ponder nothing earthly-minded, For with blessing in His hand, Christ our God to earth descendeth, Our full homage to demand. Amen. </verse>

data.title: Amens
data.preview: <verse>A-men, A---men.</verse><verse>A-----men.</verse><vers
data.data: <verse>A-men, A---men.</verse><verse>A-----men.</verse><verse>A---men.</verse><verse>A---men, (A-men.)</verse><verse>A-----men.</verse><verse>A-men, A-men, A---men.</verse>

data.title: Sevenfold Amen
data.preview: <verse>A-men, A-men, A---men, A-----men,A-----men, A-----men
data.data: <verse>A-men, A-men, A---men, A-----men,A-----men, A-----men, A-men.</verse>

data.title: All Things Come of Thee
data.preview: <verse>All things come of Thee, O Lord; And of Thine own hav
data.data: <verse>All things come of Thee, O Lord; And of Thine own have we given Thee.Amen. </verse>

data.title: Cast Thy Burden Upon the Lord
data.preview: <verse>Cast thy burden upon the Lord,And He shall sustain th
data.data: <verse>Cast thy burden upon the Lord,And He shall sustain thee;He never will suffer the righteous to fall;He is at thy right hand.Thy mercy, Lord, is great, and far above the heavens;Let none be made ashamed, that wait upon Thee.</verse>

data.title: Lord, Bless Thy Word to Every Heart
data.preview: <verse>Lord, bless Thy word to every heartIn this Thy house
data.data: <verse>Lord, bless Thy word to every heartIn this Thy house today,And help us each as now we part,Its precepts to obey.AmenAmen</verse>

data.title: O Thou Who Hearest
data.preview: <verse>O Thou who hearest every heartfelt prayer,With Thy ri
data.data: <verse>O Thou who hearest every heartfelt prayer,With Thy rich grace, Lord, all our hearts prepare;Thou art our life, Thou art our love and light,O let this Sabbath hour with Him be bright. Amen.</verse>

data.title: The Lord Bless You and Keep You
data.preview: <verse>The Lord bless you and keep you,The Lord lift His cou
data.data: <verse>The Lord bless you and keep you,The Lord lift His countenance upon you,And give you peace and give you peace;The Lord make His face to shine upon you,And be gracious unto you, be gracious,The Lord be gracious unto you.Amen.</verse>

data.title: We Give Thee But Thine Own
data.preview: <verse>We give Thee but Thine own,What-e'er the gift may be;
data.data: <verse>We give Thee but Thine own,What-e'er the gift may be;All that we have is Thine alone,A trust, O Lord, from Thee. </verse>

data.title: Now, Dear Lord, As We Pray
data.preview: <verse>Now, dear Lord, as we pray,Take our hearts and minds
data.data: <verse>Now, dear Lord, as we pray,Take our hearts and minds far awayFrom the press of the world all aroundTo Your throne where grace does abound.May our lives be transformed by Your love,May our souls be refreshed from above.At this moment, let people everywhereJoin us now as we come to You in prayer.</verse>

data.title: Spirit of the Living God
data.preview: <verse>Spirit of the living God,Fall afresh on me!Spirit of
data.data: <verse>Spirit of the living God,Fall afresh on me!Spirit of the living God,Fall afresh on me!Break me, melt me, mold me, fill me!Spirit of the living God,Fall afresh on me!</verse>

data.title: May God Be With You
data.preview: <verse>May God be with you Till we meet again,May God be wit
data.data: <verse>May God be with you Till we meet again,May God be with you, Keep you safe till then;And may His blessings Be within your heart,May God be with you While we're apart,May God be with you.</verse><verse>May God be with you, Watch you from above,May God protect you in His tender love;And with the dawning Of each bright, new day,May God be with you, To guide your way,May God be with you.</verse>

data.title: Shalom
data.preview: <verse>Shalom, good friends, Shalom, good friends, Shalom, s
data.data: <verse>Shalom, good friends, Shalom, good friends, Shalom, shalom.Till we meet again, Till we meet again,Shalom, shalom.</verse>

data.title: May the Lord Bless and Keep You
data.preview: <verse>May the Lord bless you and keep you Both now and ever
data.data: <verse>May the Lord bless you and keep you Both now and evermore.Amen, Amen.</verse>

data.title: Thy Word Is a Lantern
data.preview: <verse>Thy Word is a lantern unto my feet,And a light unto m
data.data: <verse>Thy Word is a lantern unto my feet,And a light unto my path.</verse>

data.title: Heavenly Father, to Thee We Pray
data.preview: <verse>Heavenly Father, to Thee we pray,On the holy Sabbath
data.data: <verse>Heavenly Father, to Thee we pray,On the holy Sabbath day;Through Thy Word Thy will make known;May each heart become Thy throne,Let Thy living water flowThat we Thy boundless love may know.Amen.</verse>

data.title: God Be in My Head
data.preview: <verse>God be in my head, and in my understanding;God be in
data.data: <verse>God be in my head, and in my understanding;God be in mine eyes, and in my looking;God be in my mouth, and in my speaking;God be in my heart, and in my thinking;God be at mine end, and at my departing.</verse>

data.title: God Be in My Head
data.preview: <verse>God be in my head,And in my thinking.God be in my eye
data.data: <verse>God be in my head,And in my thinking.God be in my eyes,And in my looking.God be in my mouthAnd in my speaking.Oh, God be in my heart,And in my understanding.</verse>

data.title: Holy Spirit, Hear Us
data.preview: <verse>Holy Spirit, hear us;Help us while we sing;Breath int
data.data: <verse>Holy Spirit, hear us;Help us while we sing;Breath into the musicOf the praise we bring.</verse><verse>Holy Spirit, prompt usWhen we kneel to pray;Nearer come, and teach usWhat we ought to say.</verse><verse>Holy Spirit, shine ThouOn the Book we read;Gild it's holy pagesWith the light we need.</verse>

data.title: This Is the Day the Lord Hath Made
data.preview: <verse>This is the day the Lord hath made; He calls the hour
data.data: <verse>This is the day the Lord hath made; He calls the hours His own. Let heaven rejoice, let earth be glad, And praise surround the throne. </verse>

data.title: As You Have Promised, Lord
data.preview: <verse>As You have promised, Lord, today, You are letting Yo
data.data: <verse>As You have promised, Lord, today, You are letting Your servant go away in peace.My eyes have seen You in broad daylight Before all nations, planning salvation.Light of revelation for the nations,And glory of Your people Israel.</verse>

data.title: Jesus, Stand Among Us
data.preview: <verse>Jesus, stand among us In Thy risen power;Let this tim
data.data: <verse>Jesus, stand among us In Thy risen power;Let this time of worship Be a hallowed hour.</verse><verse>Breathe the Holy Spirit Into every heart;Bid the fears and sorrowsFrom each soul depart.</verse><verse>Thus with quickened footstepsWe pursue our way,Watching for the dawningOf eternal day.</verse>

data.title: Hear Our Prayer, O Lord
data.preview: <verse>Hear our Prayer, O Lord,Hear our prayer, O Lord;Incli
data.data: <verse>Hear our Prayer, O Lord,Hear our prayer, O Lord;Incline Thine ear to us,And grant us Thy peace.Amen.</verse>

data.title: Cause Me to Hear
data.preview: <verse>Cause me to hear Thy loving kindness in the morning,F
data.data: <verse>Cause me to hear Thy loving kindness in the morning,For in Thee do I trust.Cause me to know the way wherein I shall walkFor I lift up my soul to Thee. Amen</verse>

data.title: Bless Thou the Gifts
data.preview: <verse>Bless Thou the gifts our hands have brought; Bless Th
data.data: <verse>Bless Thou the gifts our hands have brought; Bless Thou the work our hearts have planned. Ours is the faith, the will, the thought; The rest, O God, is in Thy hand. Amen. </verse>

data.title: The Lord Is in His Holy Temple
data.preview: <verse>The Lord is in His holy temple,The Lord is in His hol
data.data: <verse>The Lord is in His holy temple,The Lord is in His holy temple,Let all the earth be silentBe silent before Him.</verse>

data.title: Surely, Surely
data.preview: <verse>Surely, surely the Lord has been here,Surely angels s
data.data: <verse>Surely, surely the Lord has been here,Surely angels still linger near;I hear music soft on my ear,I feel His Spirit,I have no fear.</verse>

data.title: Day by Day, Dear Lord
data.preview: <verse>Day by day, Dear Lord, of Thee three things I pray:To
data.data: <verse>Day by day, Dear Lord, of Thee three things I pray:To see Thee more clearly, Love Thee more dearly,Follow Thee more nearly, Day by day.</verse>

data.title: Dismiss Us, Lord With Blessing
data.preview: <verse>Dismiss us, Lord, with blessing, we pray;As from Thy
data.data: <verse>Dismiss us, Lord, with blessing, we pray;As from Thy worship we go our ways;Guide in life's conflicts, all through the day;Save in Thy kingdom, Thine be the praise.Amen. </verse>

data.title: Lead Me, Lord
data.preview: <verse>Lead me, Lord, lead me in Thy righteousness; Make Thy
data.data: <verse>Lead me, Lord, lead me in Thy righteousness; Make Thy way plain before my face. For it is Thou, Lord, Thou, Lord only, That makest me dwell in safety.</verse>

data.title: The Lord Is in His Holy Temple
data.preview: <verse>The Lord is in His holy temple,The Lord is in His hol
data.data: <verse>The Lord is in His holy temple,The Lord is in His holy temple,Let all the earth keep silence,Let all the earth keep silence, before Him,Keep silence, keep silence, before Him. Amen. </verse>

data.title: Almighty Father
data.preview: <verse>Almighty Father, hear our prayer, and bless all souls
data.data: <verse>Almighty Father, hear our prayer, and bless all souls that wait before Thee. Amen. </verse>

data.title: Praise God, From Whom All Blessings
data.preview: <verse>Praise God, from Whom all blessings flow;Praise Him,
data.data: <verse>Praise God, from Whom all blessings flow;Praise Him, all creatures here below;Praise Him above, ye heavenly host;Praise Father, Son, and Holy Ghost.</verse>
